Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.
Strong attention to detail and problem-solving abilities.
Experience in consulting or retail is an asset, especially in roles focused on addressing business challenges.
Able to communicate complex data insights in a clear, actionable format for non-technical audiences.




We offer:

A competitive salary plus 8% holiday pay
26 holidays per year (based on full-time employment) and the option to exchange public holidays
The chance to join our Work in Club program and contribute to charity work once a year
Unlimited access to all our high-end fitness locations for you and a +1
Unlimited access to well-being services for you and your family via OpenUp
An inspiring head office, a short 10-minute walk from Amsterdam Central Station
A diverse and energetic team of 500 colleagues pushing boundaries and supporting one another




* A personality assessment is part of the hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Contract)

Amsterdam based - hybrid

Up to €64.00 per hour




We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst for a contract position based in Amsterdam. In this role, you will leverage data to drive business solutions, support decision-making processes, and contribute to key strategic initiatives. You will work independently with stakeholders, using your expertise in data analysis to define problems, set success metrics, and provide actionable insights.




Key Responsibilities:

Independently manage data collection, preparation, and reporting to solve business problems.
Translate business challenges into data-driven solutions, creating clear data stories.
Maintain and manage key reports, metrics, and workflows within your scope.
Communicate data results and insights effectively to stakeholders, ensuring alignment with business needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, contributing to data quality and stability initiatives.
Utilize data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, Mixpanel) to answer business questions efficiently.
Participate in the development and execution of data governance processes, ensuring high-quality data management.
Continuously improve your technical skills and adapt to new approaches to optimize processes and workflows.




Requirements:

Bachelor's or Master’s degree in a relevant field.
5-8 years of hands-on experience in data analysis, with a strong focus on data management and visualization.
Proficiency in at least one data analysis language (e.g., SQL, R, Python).
Experience with data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, PowerBI, Mixpanel, etc.).
Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
Analytical mindset with the ability to understand the bigger picture while focusing on details.
Experience with statistical models and an understanding of experimentation processes.
Knowledge of data governance practices, including data quality monitoring and lineage management.




Ideal Candidate:

A driven, results-oriented individual who thrives in fast-paced environments.
A strong communicator who is comfortable working autonomously and in teams.
Someone who is open to feedback and eager to improve their own performance.
A proactive individual with a curious mindset, always seeking new ways to optimize solutions.




This is an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team in Amsterdam and make a significant impact on key data-driven initiatives. If you're ready to take your career to the next level, apply now!




Note: This is a contract position based in Amsterdam. Candidates must be eligible to work in the Netherlands.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a skilled Data Specialist to join a dynamic Content Management team. This role focuses on supporting key areas such as Ratings & Reviews (R&R) and User-Generated Content (UGC) in an eCommerce setting. You'll work across both front-end and back-end functions to optimize how content is displayed, monitored, and validated.




Key Responsibilities




Collaborate on ideas, designs, and hypotheses to enhance features on the website and app.
Conduct A/B testing using tools like Optimizely Feature Experimentation and in-house analytics platforms.
Align with stakeholders to communicate updates and changes across various touchpoints.
Maintain and optimize dashboards in Looker Studio to provide insights on team performance.
Support processes for review and image submission validation using SQL and relevant tools.




Broader Initiatives:

Contribute to strategic projects, including transitioning to a headless CMS and improving content performance visibility.
Provide input on performance metrics, OKRs, and monitoring strategies for data-driven decision-making.







Essential Skills

Strong analytical skills and proficiency in SQL.
Knowledge of experimentation methods, including A/B testing.
Understanding of funnels and end-to-end processes in content workflows.
Stakeholder management experience with a collaborative approach.




Desirable Skills

Experience with GCP and BigQuery.
Proficiency in Python (Notebooks).
Familiarity with eCommerce environments.
An eagerness to learn and a strong team-player mentality.







What's in It for You?

This is an exciting opportunity to work on impactful projects in a cutting-edge digital environment, where your expertise will play a vital role in enhancing the customer experience.




Randstad area
Hybrid working - you must be located in Netherlands
ZZP or interim payroll
6 months contract (view to extend)
70-75 per hour or €5000 a month







If you have the skills, curiosity, and drive to excel in this role, we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Senior 4-7 Years)

Location: Amsterdam, NL (at least 2 days per week onsite)

Duration: 13-Jan-2025 – 30-Jun-2025

Hours Per Day: 8.00




Background:

As a data specialist you will be supporting the entire Personalization area of client. While the topic is not new, the way we’ve organized it is.
Previously we’ve focused the efforts in our department on Product Recommendations and Content Recommendations.
With the addition of several teams from elsewhere in the organization, we’ve added new functionalities to our scope.
The teams that were added provide us with customer-specific details by means of an API, have built several models to help us re-organise the layout of entire pages on client.com based on historical behavior and customer details, and provide a sophisticated framework to do nudging and lotteries on client.com using very specific targeting and trigger details.
In this new set-up we’re looking for someone that can help us bridge the gap between teams.

We see that happening in 3 ways:

Strategic: help leadership shape a strategy on how we would like to move forward with Personalization at client. What are the things the industry is doing; what are the things IKEA is doing today; and how can we grow further in this space with our client values at heart.
Organizational: the teams in the area should be able to derive new value from working together. Firstly, you will understand yourself what it is they do, identify overlaps and uniqueness, and help them get to know each other better and identify opportunities for further growth or to learn in collaboration.
Operational: the potential of personalization is immense, even more so when you understand that the majority of our sales still happen in-store. It makes quantification of the potential that personalization has for client particularly difficult. We are keen to get to know your ideas and thoughts on this and we hope you can help us make a better estimate of this going forward

The scope of the consultant services is to assist client in:

Next to that, we have quite a few initiatives running in the Personalization space with our US market. The size and the complexity embedded in this market in terms of economics, demographics, and other people-related attributes requires us to (potentially) re-think the way we do personalization in these markets. You will be helping on some of these initiatives.




Requirements:

Must: analytical skills, SQL, good stakeholder management, thinking on a more strategic level, certain extent of knowledge or experience when it comes to personalization (e.g. recommender systems, clustering / segmentation, modelling techniques for prediction).
Nice: experience with GCP, BigQuery, Python (Notebooks), familiar in an FMCG of retail sector, eager to learn, familiar in an eCommerce environment, experience building more strategic plans, experience with building business cases or assessing potential monetary gains on a complex topic




What 3 things from the box above are most important?

Analytical skills, thinking on a more strategic level, certain extent of knowledge when it comes to personalization

Title: Data Analyst - Intern (Remote Internship - Data Analysis)
Description:
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights.
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations.
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings.
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments.
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued.
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous.
Some initial industry experience is a big plus.


Your Contribution:


Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes.
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights.
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making.
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges.
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis.
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations.


Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
We help companies modernize business operations, adopt intelligent automation, deliver real-time performance insights and connect the enterprise - accelerating the impact of digital transformation. Founded in 1987 and recognized as a trusted advisor, HSO is one of the world's top business solution and implementation partners, large enough to serve, small enough to care. We are 100% dedicated to Microsoft technology, with practices that offer our clients a complete set of Microsoft cloud solutions from a single global partner. HSO is a proven global leader with unique delivery capabilities offered from our dedicated Microsoft practices in more than 30 offices across the Americas, Europe, Australia and Asia.

HSO is a Gold Certified partner since 2002 and since 2006 has been a part of the Microsoft Dynamics Inner Circle, a prestige reserved for just 1% of Microsoft partners worldwide. Within HSO you'll work with Microsoft Dynamics 365, Azure cloud platform and our unique, industry-specific solutions.

We are a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business insights and decisions. Our team is passionate about technology and data, and we are looking for a talented Data Engineer / Data Analyst to join us.

Key Responsibilities


Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes
Analyze complex datasets to derive actionable insights and support decision-making
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and deliver solutions
Develop and maintain data models, databases, and data warehouses
Create and manage dashboards and reports to visualize data trends and metrics
Ensure data quality and integrity through rigorous testing and validation
Optimize data processes for performance and scalability



Requirements


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a similar role
Proficiency in Fabric, SQL, Python, and data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI)
Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is a plus
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent communication and teamwork abilities



Benefits

Why choose HSO?

Freedom and flexibility

An organization with a lot of professional freedom and flexibility where we make the best choices together to optimize your development process during your career.

Culture

An open and accessible work environment full of colleagues who are always there for each other. We are one big HSO Team. Because without cooperation and fun, there is no success!

Development and growth

A job with plenty of growth opportunities in an organisation with an eye for your talents, ambitions and the things that drive you.

A good remuneration package

An excellent salary and fringe benefits include a laptop, mobile phone, flexible incentive plan, large office offering a collaborative environment with a modern design and free parking in Amsterdam.

Do you want to be part of a fast-growing company and work with many international colleagues? Then you can apply immediately!

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

AbbVie's mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines and solutions that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people's lives across several key therapeutic areas – immunology, oncology, neuroscience, and eye care – and products and services in our Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on X, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, LinkedIn and Tik Tok.

Job Description

As Business Data Analyst you are part of Customer Excellence Team, supporting and facilitating our organization with data analytics and enabling effective decision making. In close cooperation with your colleagues in Customer Excellence, Business Technology Services and the various business stakeholders, you transform market and customer data into sustainable dashboards / analytical reports based on business use cases. The ideal candidate has a strong affinity with data analytics and the health care environment, is a quick learner and brings a positive can-do mentality. You will report to the Manager Business Analytics.

Key Responsibilities


Analytics & Reporting - Understand, combine and transform local & global datasets into visualizations. Build sustainable dashboards (PowerBI) to support both operational reporting and strategic decision making. Guide colleagues to develop right visualizations for presenting results.
Data modeling - Understand and further optimize the data models of current use cases. Develop data models for new use cases. Help manage the various data models which enable business users to answer their questions.
Data governance - Partner with internal stakeholders from different departments to help shape how we manage customer data, to ensure alignment and to maintain analytical tools sustainable and compliant.
State-of-the-art data platform – opportunity to familiarize yourself with a state-of-the-art data platform (Palantir Foundry)
Innovation - Explore and innovate new solutions and capabilities in the areas of data, analytics, and AI to address business issues and opportunities.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s or higher degree with academic courses in quantitative methods, analytics, statistics, economics or finance.
Experience in a corporate environment & experience with relevant customer / market datasets within the biopharmaceutical industry is a plus.
Analytically strong. Ability to rapidly connect & match analytics and data products to business needs. Able to analyze and draw meaningful conclusions from data. Affinity with relational database query languages using SQL.
You need to be able to quickly be in the driver’s seat and work on the different use cases with the ability to quickly learn the new environment and Palantir Foundry platform.
Expert knowledge of an analysis tool such as Microsoft PowerBI and curious to learn more about their platforms. Passionate about technology and excited about the impact of emerging / disruptive technologies.
Gives importance to creating sustainable, well-documented, compliant data solutions.
Great collaborator and excellent written and verbal communications skills
Ability to independently frame business questions, identify data sources, formulate a methodology and manage project timelines and deliverables.
Fluent in both English and preferably Dutch, with excellent written, verbal, and presentation skills.


Additional Information

AbbVie is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to operating with integrity, driving innovation, transforming lives, serving our community and embracing diversity and inclusion. It is AbbVie’s policy to employ qualified persons of the greatest ability without discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy), physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, status as a protected veteran, or any other legally protected group status.

US & Puerto Rico only - to learn more, visit https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/equal-employment-opportunity-employer.html

US & Puerto Rico applicants seeking a reasonable accommodation, click here to learn more:

https://www.abbvie.com/join-us/reasonable-accommodations.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ben jij een gedreven Data Analist met een passie voor de financiële wereld die graag de cruciale rol heeft in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar het worden van meer data-driven? Wil je impact hebben door data te vertalen naar waardevolle inzichten en besluitvorming? Dan is deze rol als Data Analist binnen onze organisatie iets voor jou!




Data Analist

Als Data Analist speel je een cruciale rol in de transformatie van onze opdrachtgevers naar data-gedreven organisaties. Je identificeert de informatiebehoeften van de business en vertaalt deze naar relevante data-oplossingen. Met jouw technische expertise verzamel en analyseer je data en zet je deze om in waardevolle inzichten.




In jouw rol ben je verantwoordelijk voor het integreren van klantdata met andere databronnen en het omzetten van deze gegevens in actionable insights. Je ontwikkelt en optimaliseert zowel nieuwe als bestaande dashboards die onze opdrachtgevers ondersteunen. Hierbij identificeer je nieuwe databronnen, valideer je de verzamelde data en presenteer je deze op een overzichtelijke manier. Dankzij jouw analyses en inzichten kunnen onze opdrachtgevers hun proposities en processen verder verbeteren.




Je werkt nauw samen met je eigen team en diverse teams bij onze opdrachtgevers, waarbij je hen ondersteunt en adviseert op zowel tactisch als strategisch niveau.




Wat bieden we jou?

Jouw gedrevenheid binnen Novisource wordt beloond. Wij vinden het belangrijk dat jij je kunt blijven ontwikkelen en kunt doorgroeien. Jij bent daarin altijd in de lead! Naast vakinhoudelijke opleidingen bieden wij ook cursussen en trainingen op het gebied van diverse methodieken en vaardigheden aan. Daarnaast:

Een salarisrange van € 4.500,- tot € 6.500,- bruto per maand (afhankelijk van kennis en ervaring) en een aantrekkelijke bonusregeling
Een persoonlijk opleidingsbudget
Laptop, vaste onkostenvergoeding en telefoonvergoeding
Direct een vast dienstverband
Leaseauto of reiskostenvergoeding
Verbinding is één van onze kernwaarden, we investeren dus gedurende het hele jaar in inhoudelijke, inspirerende en vooral leuke events
Een hybride werk cultuur. We vinden elkaar zeker op ons gezellige kantoor in Amsterdam (vlakbij station Bijlmer Arena), maar stimuleren eigen verantwoordelijkheid en flexibiliteit




Wat neem je mee?

Je bent nieuwsgierig van aard, denkt graag in oplossingen en bent resultaat gedreven. Uiteraard heb je een goed ontwikkeld organisatiebewustzijn en daarnaast neem jij onderstaande mee:

HBO/WO gediplomeerd
Minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen de financiële dienstverlening op het gebied van data
Je hebt een sterk analytisch denkvermogen en bent communicatief vaardig
Je hebt eerder gewerkt in een Scrum/Agile omgeving (sterke pré)
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift
Aantoonbare ervaring met de financiële sector
Ervaring met het werken binnen multidisciplinaire teams




Over Novisource

Novisource is een kleinschalige, ambitieuze en persoonlijke consultancy-organisatie. We bemiddelen intelligente, gedreven en gepassioneerde consultants die meebouwen aan de (digitale) verandering van morgen. Vooralsnog met name in de financiële sector, maar we werken hard aan uitbreiding van onze klantenportefeuille. We geloven dat onze expertises ook in andere sectoren hard nodig zijn en willen zo meer diversiteit bieden aan onze consultants wat betreft werkomgeving en opdrachten.




Daarnaast zitten we als organisatie zelf ook in een veranderproces, waarin we professionaliseren om de volgende stap te kunnen zetten in kwaliteit, zowel richting onze mensen als richting onze klanten. Houd je van ondernemen, meebouwen, de dynamiek die hoort bij groei en van direct verschil en resultaat zien van het werk dat je doet?




Dan is deze rol geknipt voor jou.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Product & Pricing
Description:
Apollo Tyres Ltd is an international tyre manufacturer and the leading tyre brand in India. The company has multiple manufacturing units in India and a unit each in The Netherlands and Hungary. The company markets its products under its two global brands – Apollo and Vredestein, and its products are available in over 100 countries through a vast network of branded, exclusive and multi-product outlets.




Job Title: Data Analyst - Product & Pricing

Location: Amsterdam

Reports to (Position): Product & Pricing Lead EU

Department/Function: Marketing







Short description of the work field:




We are expanding our Product & Pricing team in Amsterdam and are seeking a Data Analyst - Product & Pricing to join our commercial organization. In this role, you will generate valuable insights supporting our European commercial teams and ensure the quality, reliability, and usability of data. You will play a key role in structuring and maintaining data to enable reporting and analysis in areas such as pricing, sales, product, and market intelligence.

This position reports directly to the Product & Pricing Lead Europe.







What will be your role in more detail?




Cross-Functional Collaboration & Stakeholder Management




Act as a liaison between pricing and product analysts and other departments.
Be part of a team culture of innovation and collaboration.




Price & Product Performance Analysis and Reporting




Analyze and report on price and product performance across all our product categories.
Maintain databases and EU commercial conditions, customer price exceptions, and prices in SAP.
Develop dashboards, reports, and user-friendly analytical tools.
Conduct analyses based on operational activities, including sales outlooks and forecasts.
Track key performance metrics and provide insights for decision-making




Drive Innovation




Improve the usage Excel, SAP, and Power BI to enhance data management and reporting processes.
Perform data cleaning, preparation, and integration to ensure the reliability of insights.







Are you our ideal candidate?




We’re looking for a collaborative team player with experience in data analytics, ideally in a product and/or pricing context. Deep knowledge of Excel and PowerBI is essential. The ideal candidate is highly analytical and experienced in collaborating across teams. You are a confident communicator in English, with additional European languages being a plus.




University degree.
At least 3 years of experience in data analytics or a related field.
Expertise in marketing intelligence, big data, and reporting.
Proficiency in tools such as Excel and Power BI.
Experience with working with SAP is a plus.
Strong analytical mindset, structured approach, and attention to detail.
Collaborative team player with a trustworthy and accurate work ethic.
Tyre or automotive industry knowledge is a plus.







What can you expect? (benefits)




A dynamic and innovative environment
Colleagues from all over the world
A competitive compensation package
Participation in learning & development activities
At least 24 holidays and 4 ADV days, holiday allowance, end year bonus and pension plan
Hybrid work policy and support for home office set up




Why join us?




We take pride in our commitment to being an equal opportunity employer, creating a workplace where diversity is celebrated, and talent thrives. It’s our belief that every individual brings unique perspectives that contribute to our success. Join our Marketing team and be a part of an inclusive, dynamic, and innovative environment.




Make a significant impact as we 'move' the world forward together.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst (Remote)
Description:
Start your career in business intelligence with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and transform data into actionable insights!

Are you passionate about data and eager to uncover insights that drive business decisions? Kreativstorm is looking for a Junior Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team. You will analyze business data, create reports, and provide insights that help shape strategies. This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your analytical skills and make a significant impact.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Junior business intelligence analysts with a strong interest in data analysis.
Proficiency in BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Strong analytical and communication skills.


Your Role:


Analyze business data to identify trends and opportunities.
Develop BI reports and dashboards.
Collaborate with the data team to improve data quality.
Document and present business insights.
Support in implementing BI solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in business intelligence. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your BI skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in business intelligence!

Description:
Data Analyst | Dutch Speaking | Freelance | NL - Hybrid Working




Only candidates who speak Dutch are eligible for this role.




Are you an experienced Data Analyst with extensive experience in SQL and complex queries? Do you have a strong track record of working with stakeholders?




Then this could be the ideal role for you!




Amoria Bond is currently looking for an experienced Data Analyst for one of our clients based in the Netherlands. In this role, you will primarily focus on working with complex queries, acting as a key link between business requirements and technology.




Skills and Experience:




SQL experience of 5 years plus is essential
Experience with querying is essential
Experience with data management (nice to have)
Dutch language proficiency is essential




Are you the Data Specialist we are looking for? Send your CV and contact details to Kieran.Hyde@amoriabond.com, and I will contact you as soon as I can!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol’s ambitions – and this is where you’ll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers.

Marketing Analytics play an instrumental role here. Our goal is to enable ‘Engagement at Scale’. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll analyze our advertising partners’ behavior, uncover opportunities for improvement and share actionable insights with our marketeers so that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time. In all your decisions, you’ll take scalability into account as we serve thousands of active advertisers at any given moment.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we’re implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that the underlying data of our campaigns is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You’ll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You’ll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol’s Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand advertiser behavior, help optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of building and optimizing campaigns that help and engage advertisers
You help build, maintain and simplify our data model that supports our communication flows. All with the goal of enabling scalable campaigning where we reach thousands of advertisers at a relevant moment
You analyze the performance of our campaigns and attribute their commercial value. All with the goal of identifying opportunities for improvement and getting a clear picture of the impact we’re making as a department


We’re Looking For You If You


Don’t want to work alone. You work closely with various stakeholders to make the above possible. This requires strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers;
Challenge ideas. You help the team with the other Marketing data analysts to reach a higher level, both in terms of content and on a personal level.
Help implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards;
Help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol’s wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale;
Practice and preach Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise;
Know a thing or two about data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering and know your way around a marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage).


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


Uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you’ll need to navigate it confidently, so an entrepreneurial mindset is a must. Bol is complex, you have to involve and convince both Product & Tech colleagues to find solutions, proactively and autonomously.
Output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a dashboard – who cares how users experience it – then this job is not for you. We’re looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns!
No continuous improvement We’re always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Sharing is caring You have hands-on experience in marketing analytics, SQL (e.g. BigQuery), statistics (the basics) and feel comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets.
High quality code results in clear and actionable insights Finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles make you smile and SQL, Git and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio are your home away from home. *Dbt and/or Airflow is a plus.
You are not a one-trick-pony Our role is multi-faceted so you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building blocks. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you’ll work

You’ll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our multidisciplinary Avb Marketing team. Your marketing colleagues are seasoned in the world of data and CRM. Sparring happens on a daily basis. We like to make each other better – motivating and respecting are second nature to us.

Besides the strategic topics, you have the space to work on your own innovations and seize the opportunities you identify. Bol gladly invests in your personal and professional growth; development is a primary employment condition. The culture is informal, down-to-earth, and pioneering.

We work in collaborative spaces where you’ll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.
Show more
HTML:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol’s ambitions – and this is where you’ll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers.

Marketing Analytics play an instrumental role here. Our goal is to enable ‘Engagement at Scale’. As a Marketing Data Analyst, you’ll analyze our advertising partners’ behavior, uncover opportunities for improvement and share actionable insights with our marketeers so that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time. In all your decisions, you’ll take scalability into account as we serve thousands of active advertisers at any given moment.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we’re implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that the underlying data of our campaigns is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You’ll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You’ll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol’s Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas

  • You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand advertiser behavior, help optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of building and optimizing campaigns that help and engage advertisers
  • You help build, maintain and simplify our data model that supports our communication flows. All with the goal of enabling scalable campaigning where we reach thousands of advertisers at a relevant moment
  • You analyze the performance of our campaigns and attribute their commercial value. All with the goal of identifying opportunities for improvement and getting a clear picture of the impact we’re making as a department

We’re Looking For You If You

  • Don’t want to work alone. You work closely with various stakeholders to make the above possible. This requires strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers;
  • Challenge ideas. You help the team with the other Marketing data analysts to reach a higher level, both in terms of content and on a personal level.
  • Help implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards;
  • Help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol’s wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale;
  • Practice and preach Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise;
  • Know a thing or two about data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering and know your way around a marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage).

3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out

  • Uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you’ll need to navigate it confidently, so an entrepreneurial mindset is a must. Bol is complex, you have to involve and convince both Product & Tech colleagues to find solutions, proactively and autonomously.
  • Output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a dashboard – who cares how users experience it – then this job is not for you. We’re looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns!
  • No continuous improvement We’re always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
  • Sharing is caring You have hands-on experience in marketing analytics, SQL (e.g. BigQuery), statistics (the basics) and feel comfortable navigating and analyzing large, complex datasets.
  • High quality code results in clear and actionable insights Finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles make you smile and SQL, Git and dashboarding tools like Tableau/Looker Studio are your home away from home. *Dbt and/or Airflow is a plus.
  • You are not a one-trick-pony Our role is multi-faceted so you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building blocks. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.

This is where you’ll work

You’ll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our multidisciplinary Avb Marketing team. Your marketing colleagues are seasoned in the world of data and CRM. Sparring happens on a daily basis. We like to make each other better – motivating and respecting are second nature to us.

Besides the strategic topics, you have the space to work on your own innovations and seize the opportunities you identify. Bol gladly invests in your personal and professional growth; development is a primary employment condition. The culture is informal, down-to-earth, and pioneering.

We work in collaborative spaces where you’ll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Help design, build and continuously improve the clients online platform.
Research, suggest and implement new technology solutions following best practices/standards.
Take responsibility for the resiliency and availability of different products.
Be a productive member of the team.


Requirements


Collaborate with the team to ideate, design, and test features aimed at optimizing user experience.
Conduct A/B testing using tools like Optimizely Feature Experimentation and in-house analytical tools, requiring strong SQL skills.
Align changes with stakeholders to ensure seamless integration with multiple interfaces and their unique objectives.
Optimize existing dashboards in Looker Studio to improve performance insights and, where needed, introduce new features.
Support and enhance processes for review and image submission, moderation, and validation.
Utilize SQL and other engineering tools to manage content workflows.
Strong analytical skills with proficiency in SQL.Experience with GCP, BigQuery, and Python (e.g., Notebooks).
Familiarity with content workflows and funnels (e.g., processing inputs through a defined system to achieve end results).
Knowledge of A/B testing and experimentation methodologies.
Effective stakeholder management skills.
Prior experience in the FMCG, retail, or eCommerce sectors.


Benefits


A challenging, innovating environment.
Opportunities for learning where needed.
Show more

Benefits

  • A challenging, innovating environment.
  • Opportunities for learning where needed.

Title: Power BI Analyst
Description:
Power BI / Data Analyst

Rotterdam based - hybrid

Excellent salary & benefits package on offer




The Odiin Group is partnered with a leading company who are looking for a Power BI / Data Analyst as part of their digital transformation efforts.




Our customer is embarking on a multi year digital transformation programme, investing heavily within their ERP and broader IT landscape - a complete technology modernisation program.




This is a fantastic opportunity to join a newly formed team within Business Intelligence, where you will be focused on analysing data, developing reports within Power BI dashboards and providing key insights to the business.




Our client are able to offer lots of flexibility, company perks, benefits, and opportunities for growth and well-being!




Within this role, Dutch speaking is imperative - minimum B2.




Requirements:

Minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience, operating as a BI/Data Analyst
Strong analytical abilities with proficiency in Excel. Familiarity with other data analysis tools like Power BI or similar software is a plus.
Experience with ERP systems are considered advantageous.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner.
English is essential, and business fluency in Dutch is a must.




What’s on Offer:

Competitive salaries and benefits and perk packages.
Flexibility around start/finish times
Extensive company benefits programme
Indefinite contracts available
The chance to work on cutting-edge IT projects.
Opportunities for career growth and development in thriving markets.




If you're interested in exploring this opportunity further, please apply to the advert with your CV or contact JamesRodgers@odiin.tech for more info.

Title: Data-analist
HTML:
Ben jij de drijvende kracht achter datagedreven succes?

We zoeken een ambitieuze Senior Data Analist die ruwe data weet om te zetten in waardevolle inzichten en een sleutelrol speelt in strategische besluitvorming. Wil je jouw expertise inzetten in de dynamische wereld en bijdragen aan groei met slimme datagedreven oplossingen? Dan is dit jouw kans!


Wat ga je doen?

Als Senior Data Analist ben je een belangrijke schakel in het vertalen van data naar inzichten die het bedrijf vooruithelpen. Je ontwikkelt dashboards voor teams zoals sales en finance en bouwt datamodellen die dienen als de centrale bron voor alle belangrijke KPI’s en metrics.

Je werkt samen met een divers team van experts, waaronder data engineers, data scientists en andere analisten. Jouw rol omvat het ontwerpen van dashboards en rapportages, en het bieden van visuele datatools die besluitvormers ondersteunen bij het bepalen van strategieën.


Wat breng je mee?

  • Een afgeronde Bachelor of Master in bijvoorbeeld Data Science, Business Analytics, Informatica of een vergelijkbaar vakgebied;
  • Minimaal 5 jaar ervaring als data analist of in een vergelijkbare functie;
  • Ervaring met tools zoals SQL, Python en bij voorkeur Qlik;
  • Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden en een analytische geest;
  • Sterke projectmanagement vaardigheden en een proactieve werkhouding;
  • Ervaring met bredere datadisciplines, zoals data engineering of data science, is een pre.


Waarom deze rol bijzonder is

Je krijgt bij ons de vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid om echt impact te maken. In ons snelgroeiende bedrijf staat het datateam nog in volle ontwikkeling, waardoor jouw werk direct invloed heeft op de koers van de organisatie. Je schakelt regelmatig met diverse stakeholders en weet prioriteiten te stellen om projecten succesvol te realiseren.


Jouw verantwoordelijkheden

  • In kaart brengen van de behoeften van teams en deze vertalen naar bruikbare KPI’s en metrics;
  • Ontwikkelen van dashboards die zorgen voor overzicht en richting;
  • Fungeren als brug tussen de business en technische datateams;
  • Ondersteunen bij datamodellering in een omgeving zoals Databricks.


Wil jij deel uitmaken van een jong, ambitieus team en jouw stempel drukken op de toekomst van fintech?

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Een baan als Data Analist bij Digital Power

Als Data Analist bij Digital Power help je verschillende organisaties om beslissingen te maken op basis van data. Het is jouw taak om complexe informatie vanuit verschillende domeinen te vertalen in heldere en concrete actiepunten. Jouw doel is om ervoor te zorgen dat beslissingen niet meer worden genomen ‘op onderbuikgevoel’ maar op basis van feitelijke data.




Je werkt in multi-disciplinaire teams met collega’s van Digital Power en/of klantteams. Wij vinden het belangrijk om kennis met elkaar te delen. Hierdoor ontwikkel jij je razendsnel. Maar we verwachten ook een actieve bijdrage van jou! Dit doe je op je eigen manier, bijvoorbeeld door training te geven of junior collega’s te coachen.




Naast je opdracht(en) maak je deel uit van onze interne community. Leer van, en mét je collega’s en help elkaar nóg beter te worden! Kom je ergens niet uit? Dan staat ons hele team voor je klaar.




Wie we zoeken

Passie voor data

Je duikt graag in de off- én online data van organisaties
Je krijgt energie van het omzetten van data naar bruikbare inzichten
Je kunt data helder analyseren, visualiseren en uitleggen




De nodige ervaring

Je hebt minimaal 1 jaar werkervaring als Data Analist
Je hebt ervaring met visualisatietools zoals PowerBI of Tableau en/of (web)analyse tools zoals Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics
Je bent communicatief vaardig en in staat om organisaties te helpen meer datagedreven te werken




What else?

Je vindt het leuk om bij verschillende opdrachtgevers aan de slag te gaan: van NGO's tot aan marketingbureaus en van banken tot aan overheidsinstanties
Ervaring met SQL is een pré
Je bent leergierig en altijd bezig met je eigen ontwikkeling
Je denkt na over wat de vraag áchter de vraag is
Je vindt een goede sfeer op je werk nét zo belangrijk als je vak
Je krijgt goede energie van onze ‘werken bij’ pagina
Je beheerst de Nederlandse en Engelse taal goed in woord en geschrift
Een afgeronde hbo- of wo-opleiding




Wat we bieden

We bieden een startsalaris van € 2800 – € 6500 bruto per maand, afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring.

Onbeperkt opleidingsbudget en je eigen werktijden indelen: kijk hier wat we je nog meer allemaal bieden.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your mission

We are looking for a Data Analyst to support our Data team. You will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and presenting two of our Data Products. The Data Team is part of the Ireckonu Development team, working closely with the Product and Commercial teams to fulfill customer needs. To succeed in this role, you will collaborate with Data Scientists and Project Managers, tackling dynamic and challenging tasks daily as the Data team is involved in almost every vertical within the company.

You Will


Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques, and provide ongoing reports.
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets.
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing standardized reports and performance indicators to locate and resolve bugs.
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities.


Your profile

About You


Experience with data models, database design development, data mining, and segmentation techniques.
At least two solid years of working experience with PowerBI.
A good understanding of BI processes is essential.
Ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Skilled in queries, report writing, and presenting findings.
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management, or Statistics.
Familiarity with OLAP cubes and customer-facing experience is a plus.

Why us?

Since 2014, Ireckonu has raised the bar in the hospitality tech industry, with many of our solutions becoming industry standard. Led by its vision to accelerate the digital transformation in hospitality industry, we have continuously perfected our state-of-the-art product and put a powerful, yet easy-to-use CORE middleware solutions with wrap-around applications. This means we can provide solutions ranging from big international brands to small regional chains so everyone can undergo true digital transformation. We are proud to have become partners with some of hospitality's best brands such as CitizenM, Loews, and Mandarin Oriental Hotel Group

All of these are achieved thanks to the passion, talent, and knowledge of our team. At Ireckonu, we pride ourselves on our diverse range of nationalities and backgrounds and every employee plays an important role in building an environment where you can reap the rewards of your hard work. We also pride ourselves on our values; such as family, partnership, universal principles, and a passion for technology which are deeply embedded in our core. If you want to contribute to a growing business, be challenged, and see the impact of your work, then you have come to the right place.

About Us

Founded in 2014, Ireckonu is a leading Dutch company revolutionizing the hospitality industry through innovative digital solutions. With a global team of over 60 professionals, Ireckonu specializes in cutting-edge Software as a Service (SaaS) products and services. Seamlessly integrating Middleware expertise with a state-of-the-art Customer Data Platform, Ireckonu empowers hotels with a unified, data-driven approach, trusted by renowned brands such as Okura, CitizenM, Hard Rock Hotels, and more. Ireckonu stands at the forefront of shaping the future of hospitality.

Ireckonu stands at the forefront of shaping the future of hospitality.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Ready to visualize data and drive insight? At YoungOnes, you'll play a key role in transforming data into actionable insights. We're looking for a Data Analyst who is passionate about creating compelling dashboards and visualizations, as well as supporting various departments in optimizing their data utilization. Join our dynamic, fast-growing tech scale-up and help us shape the future of data-driven decision making. And most importantly, really create an impact in the company.




WHAT YOU'LL DO

YoungOnes is an ambitious tech platform that connects young talent with clients across the Netherlands, United Kingdom, and France. In this international environment, you’ll collaborate closely with both Dutch and English-speaking colleagues.

As a Data Analyst, your primary responsibility will be developing impactful dashboards and visualizations that transform data into easily digestible insights for various teams. In addition, you’ll actively engage with teams to understand and provide solutions to their everyday data needs, ensuring that data serves its purpose for continuous improvement.

You’ll join our Data team and work closely with colleagues across the organization. Your role will be instrumental in helping teams focus on what’s important through continuous analysis and timely delivery of insights, using data from the Azure stack alongside tools like Databricks, Databases and Power BI.




WHAT WE OFFER

A gross salary of €3,000 to €5,000 based on 40 hours per week (dependent on experience and skills).
25 vacation days, 6.5 ADV days, and 1 extra holiday per year.
A quarterly bonus (based on company performance).
8% holiday pay, pension scheme, and travel reimbursement (if living more than 10km from the office).
The chance to grow and develop within our international scale-up.
Resources and opportunities for personal development.
Attention to mental well-being, in partnership with OpenUp.
Great perks such as a €150 sports budget, daily fresh lunches, healthy snacks, biweekly get-togethers, our own festival, padel tournaments, and incentive trips like skiing.




WHO YOU ARE

HBO/WO level thinking and working capabilities.
0-3 years of experience in a relevant field.
Strong aptitude for creating data visualizations and dashboards.
Proficient in SQL & DAX.
Experience with Power BI.
Communicative and eager to learn.
Preferred Dutch speaker.
Passionate about using data to drive improvements.
Collaborative and supportive in team environments.
Willing to be in the Breda office 3 to 4 days a week.

Show more

  • Passionate about using data to drive improvements.
  • Collaborative and supportive in team environments.
  • Willing to be in the Breda office 3 to 4 days a week.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview

Foot Locker is modernizing its supply chain with strategic investments in new global distribution centers, investment in advanced technology and enabling innovative customer centric fulfillment options.Enabling Foot Locker’s Lace Up plan, we recognize that data is critical to build a customer first digital supply chain for our fast-growing omnichannel business. If you are a hands-on supply chain data analyst with passion for driving actions to solve real world supply chain challenges, then we have an opportunity for you!

With access to voluminous data and advanced BI tools, you will generate critical insights and drive cross functional business actions. Your role will focus on data driven optimization for both customer experience and operational excellence for Foot Locker’s EMEA Supply Chain functions.

Responsibilities


Support modernization of supply chain business intelligence and analytics capabilities.
Create, validate, and maintain global supply chain dashboards and reports in Power BI and Manhattan Active SCI
Analyze underperforming KPIs and assist users with root cause analysis.
Assists users with report customizations and self-service for supply chain use cases.
Develop metrics and KPIs for CX, Distribution Center and Logistics functions.
Build easy to interpret data visualizations to drive data adoption and monitor business performance.
Provide internal consulting for application of data/analytics across the many global supply chain operations teams.
Develop presentations and communicate findings on key trends and insights
Partner closely with Foot Lockers’ cross functional teams including enterprise data, global supply chain, allocation and store operations for data driven business actions.


Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as industrial engineering, computer science, math/statistics, etc.
3+ years working in strategic teams, with at least 2+ years of experience in hand-on data analyst/scientist roles.
2+ years’ experience in building and optimizing supply chain metrics and KPIs.
Proficiency in SQL.
Experience in Business Intelligence tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or comparable.
Experience in reporting/BI for Manhattan Warehouse Management Systems (Manhattan Active)
Experience with Data lakes and statistical programming languages such as R and Python.
Knowledge of supply chain operations in retail or another multi-unit sector
A pro-active and self-motivated approach to problem solving which includes curiosity and passion for customer experience.
Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to deal with complex problems and present recommendations and findings in a clear, concise format.


Benefits


Recognition, inclusion and belonging in a diverse environment
25 holidays and flexible working (hybrid position, in office ~2 days p/w)
Employee Discount on in-store and online products
Casual Sneaker Culture
Learning & Health/Wellbeing programs
Career development and growth in an ambitious international team
Travel reimbursement
Pension Plan
Discounted Collective Health plans
Activities organized by our Social Committee #

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Location: Oldenzaal

Apply now

What you can expect At ROSEN Europe we are looking for a fulltime Data Analyst to strengthen our evaluation team in Oldenzaal. We offer thorough in-house training, so that you learn the skills required for the position of technical data analyst within the ROSEN group.

The team of Data Analysts prepare inspection reports describing the condition of the pipeline in detail. As a member of the evaluation team, you are part of the ambitious and growing organization that offers state-of-the-art technologies to customers worldwide.

Responsibilities:

  • In line inspection data assessment;
  • Integration and confirmation of supplementary data;
  • Data Analysis;
  • Feature categorization and evaluation;
  • Feature sizing;
  • Application of anomaly interaction rules;
  • Standard & non-standard analysis;
  • Organize and report In-line inspection tool results as per client requirements;
  • Maintain personal skills/certifications, and complete additional training as required.

What you will bring

  • Secondary vocational education (MBO) diploma in a technical discipline with an analytical background;
  • Previous Inspection Data Analysis experience is an asset;
  • Advanced English communication skills (written and verbal) are required – ability to receive and communicate technical information accurately and timely;
  • Living within driving distance of Oldenzaal (max. 1 hour);
  • Available for 40 hours per week;
  • Strong computer and software skills;
  • Strong attention to detail, ability to work on a computer for extended periods of time;
  • Ability to pass the required vision and color blindness tests.

Providing a Certificate of Good Conduct (VOG) is a condition for employment. ROSEN Europe will bear the costs associated with the application for the certificate.

What we offer

  • Working in an international, dynamic and service-oriented team where collegiality is an important value;
  • An open culture that promotes and inspires a highly committed team to deliver world-class products and services to our customers;
  • Flexible working hours that help to combine work and private life;
  • Excellent secondary employment conditions such as health and pension schemes and a cycling plan to support a healthy lifestyle;
  • Opportunities for development and growth within the ROSEN group.

Are you interested in working in an environment where collaboration is valued and innovation is recognized? Then apply online or quickly send your motivation and CV to recruitment-oldenzaal@rosen-group.com.

Who we are The ROSEN Group is a leading global provider of cutting-edge solutions in all areas of the integrity process chain. Since its beginnings as a one-man business in 1981, ROSEN has grown rapidly and is today a technology group that operates in more than 110 countries with over 4,000 highly qualified employees.

ROSEN’s products and services:

  • Inspection of critical industrial assets to ensure reliable operations of the highest standards and effectiveness
  • Customized engineering consultancy providing efficient asset integrity management
  • Production and supply of customized novel products and systems
  • Market-driven, topical state-of-the-art research and development providing “added-value” products and services

For more information about the ROSEN Group, go to www.rosen-group.com.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Description:
Company

A retail company (one of the market leaders in their field) is currently looking for a BI Specialist to join their team.




What will you do?

• Building data models for the stakeholders from Finance, Sales, HR or Logistics departments.

• Identifying business data needs and their satisfaction.

• Improvement and maintenance of the existing data infrastructure (on-prem).

• Developing Power BI dashboards and reports.




What is required?

• 3+ years of experience in BI, Data.

• Experience with Power BI, SQL Server.

• Experience with TimeXtender or alternatives.

• Good analytical and communication skills.




Please note that visa sponsorship cannot be provided for this role.

Title: Internship - Business Intelligence
HTML:
During this internship you will gain insights into how one of the world’s largest FMCG companies is run from a Business Intelligence perspective.

You’re part of Unilever’s Information & Analytics team and will be exposed to great variety of analytical problems within the areas of Supply Chain, Sales and Finance. Expect to work end to end, so from crunching data to communicating insights to the stakeholders in the Unilever organization.

Your Key Responsibilities (amongst Others) Include

  • Solving analytical problems end to end: crunching data, modeling data, visualizing data,

gaining insights and communicating these insights to the relevant stakeholders;

  • Learning (and potentially teach) Advanced Excel, Power Pivot, Power BI and Python;
  • Optimizing and manage Power BI reporting;
  • Setting up Microsoft Azure product infrastructure (Databricks, AAS etc.) as well as the

development of potential Machine Learning algorithms.

What We Offer

  • An internship allowance of € 625,- gross per month; 
  • A travel allowance if you don’t have a student travel card; 
  • An exciting internship program with your fellow interns, such as an onboarding event and fun (virtual) activities;
  • The possibility to develop your personal and business skills via our extensive range of training programmes;
  • A flexible way of working;
  • A unique opportunity to look behind the scenes of one of the largest FMCG companies in the World!

What We Ask

  • You are available for 5 or 6 months from February 2025 (at least 32 hours a week);
  • You are registered at a Bachelor (4thyear) or a Master program in Economics, Econometrics, or Data Science;
  • Experience with coding (DAX, Python, R, SQL) and analytical software (Excel, Power BI) is a plus;
  • Fluent in English; both oral and written

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Bij ING streven we ernaar de beste mobiele bank van het continent te worden. De Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is daarbij verantwoordelijk voor het realiseren van de digitale verkoopdoelstellingen en voor het verzorgen en verbeteren van alle digitale interacties met klanten. Daarnaast zorgen we er met meer dan 70 data analisten en data scientists voor dat we de transitie naar een volledig data-gedreven organisatie versnellen. Je komt te werken in een multidisciplinaire team. Dat kan zowel binnen onze eigen tribe zijn, als binnen een van de andere tribes binnen ING Nederland. Elk jaar bepalen we samen met jou waar jouw talent het beste kan worden ingezet. Je kan jaren aan eenzelfde onderwerp of voor een bepaalde productgroep werken, maar krijgt ook de mogelijkheid om je groei te versnellen daar het aangaan van nieuwe uitdagingen.

Naar wie zijn we op zoek?

We zijn op zoek naar een gepassioneerde data analist om ons team te versterken. Je analyseert klantgedrag en vertaalt dit naar concrete inzichten, verbetervoorstellen en campagne selecties.

Als Data Analist



Heb je een passie voor fact-based werken en beslissingen maken
Genereer je persoonlijke en relevante klantinteracties door het maken van gerichte campagne selecties
Heb je een brede interesse in data waaronder het verzamelen, analyseren, experimenteren met en visualiseren van data.
Identificeer je nieuwe oplossingen en ideeën om impact te maken met behulp van data en analyses
Draag je bij aan het behoud en de voortdurende verbetering van de fact-based cultuur binnen ING




Heb jij een passie voor data en ben je klaar om impact te maken? Vind je het leuk om problemen op te lossen en wil je jezelf graag ontwikkelen? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Je competenties en ervaring



Je hebt een master op het gebied van analytics, wiskunde of econometrie
Minstens 5 jaar ervaring in Analytics
Nederlandse taalvaardigheid vereist
Je hebt ervaring met querytalen (bijvoorbeeld SQL, SAS), en bij voorkeur ook met dashboardingtools (bijvoorbeeld Cognos, PowerBI)
Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring in het maken van complexe analyses
Je kunt data transformeren in inzichten en deze op een begrijpelijke manier presenteren
Je hebt een aanpakkersmentaliteit. Je leert graag snel en past nieuwe technieken toe
Je bent klantgericht
Je kunt goed omgaan met verschillende type stakeholders bijvoorbeeld mede data specialisten, marketeers of risk collega's.
Je vraagt actief om hulp en feedback en durft feedback te geven
Ervaring met de agile manier van werken is een pré




Wat bieden wij jou?

Wij bieden een fulltime 36 uurspositie in een uitdagende omgeving. Je krijgt de kans om bij een moderne agile organisatie te werken met intelligente en leuke collega's en vele kansen om zowel je technische als persoonlijke competenties verder te ontwikkelen.

Elke 3 weken komen we met de 70 data analisten bij elkaar om met en van elkaar te leren

De Voordelen Van Werken Bij ING Zijn Onder Andere



Een uitstekend salaris dat aansluit bij je kwaliteiten en ervaring
Een werkweek van 36 uur
24-27 vakantiedagen afhankelijk van het contract
Een 13e maand en 8% vakantiegeld
Bijdrage Individuele besparingen (BIS), 3,5% van je bruto jaarsalaris
Flexibele werktijden en thuiswerken (hybride modus)
De mobiliteitskaart. Je kiest je vervoerswijze voor het woonwerkverkeer per dag. Vrijheid en flexibiliteit in mobiliteit.
Een pensioenplan
Persoonlijke groeimogelijkheden en uitdagend werk met eindeloze mogelijkheden
Een informele werkomgeving met diverse groep van innovatieve collega's




Ben je enthousiast? Klik dan op de knop ' hier Solliciteren'

Laat ons weten waarom jij bent wie wij zoeken: hoe ga je je ervaring gebruiken om ING nog beter te maken? Graag ontvangen wij een CV én motivatiebrief.

Meer informatie?

Neem contact op met Jeroen Maassen van den Brink (jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com) voor vragen.

ING is looking for a Junior/ Medior Data Analyst - Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions



Dutch fluency is required*




Who are we?

At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is responsible for achieving the digital sales objectives and for further development of all digital interactions with customers. With over 70 data analysts and scientists, We empower a data-driven focus for ING. We work in multi-disciplinary teams, while being allocated as data consultants both internally and to other departments.

Who are we looking for?

We Are Looking For a Passionate Data Analyst To Help Improve Our Service And Product Offerings. By Understanding Customer Actions, Behaviours And Product Usage, You Will Deliver High Impact And Tangible Insights. As a Data Analyst



You are passionate about using data to create impact
You generate personal and relevant customer interactions, by doing insightful analyses
You have a broad interest in data including: Collecting, analysing, experimenting and visualizing
You seize new opportunities to make impact with data and analytics. You contribute to the maintenance and continuous improvement of the fact-based culture within ING




Are you addicted to data and ready to make impact? Do you enjoy solving problems and are you eager to develop yourself? Then we are looking for you!

Your Competencies And Experience



A master's degree in the field of analytics, mathematics or econometrics
At least 5 years of experience within Analytics
Dutch fluency is actually required
You have experience with querying languages (e.g., SQL, SAS), and preferably also with dashboarding tools (e.g., Cognos, PowerBI)
You are analytically strong and have experience in making analyses and sharing results with impact
You are able to transform data into insights, and present them in an understandable way
You have a can-do mentality, and you like to quickly learn and apply new techniques
You are customer-oriented and have experience in using customer and other data to substantiate your decisions
You can manage stakeholders at different levels, including data oriented and business experts
You actively ask for help and feedback and you dare to give feedback
Experience with the agile way of working is beneficial for this role




What do we offer you?

We offer a full-time 36-hour position in a challenging environment. You will have a chance to work at a modern Agile organization with smart and fun colleagues and great opportunities to develop both your technical and personal competencies.

The Benefits Of Working At ING Include



An excellent salary that matches your qualities and experience
A 36-hour working week
24-27 vacation days depending on the contract
A 13th month and 8% holiday allowance
Contribution Individual Savings (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
Flexible working hours and working from home (hybrid mode)
The Mobility Card. You choose your mode of transport for commuting per day. Freedom and flexibility in mobility.
A pension plan
Personal growth opportunities and challenging work with endless possibilities
An informal working environment with a diverse group of innovative colleagues




Are you excited? Then click on the apply button



Let us know why you are who we are looking for: how will you use your experience to make ING even better? We would like to receive your CV and motivation letter.




More information?

Please contact Jeroen Maassen van den Brink (jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com) for your questions.
