Damit unsere Stellenanzeigen leichter lesbar sind, verwenden wird im Textverlauf die männliche Form der Anrede. Bei Flip sind alle willkommen ganz egal, welches Geschlecht du hast oder wie alt du bist. Sexuelle Identität, Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung und Behinderungen spielen keine Rolle. Das Wichtigste ist, dass DU zu uns passt!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are Sinch. With presence in more than 62 countries, we're a growing global organization that helps amazing companies engage with customers on their mobile phones. And whether you know us or not, you've definitely used our tech. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year.

This is a chance for you to dream even bigger than ever. And because we believe that equal opportunities are the key to our success, no matter who you are, you'll be able to explore career options, face fascinating challenges, building your skills alongside amazing experts. It's not easy to reach every person, on every phone, on every channel, everywhere. Create the software that makes it happen. Join our team as a Data Analyst!

The essence of the role

At Sinch, our focus is on driving growth through organic initiatives. Strong organic growth requires a solid foundation in data to be effective, guiding business strategy and building efficiencies. As part of our newly formed Data Analytics department, you'll collaborate with colleagues from around the world. Our primary goal is to deliver timely insights across the Sinch business, influencing operational optimization and providing tactical or strategic decision recommendations.

We're seeking an individual who is driven to understand the driving factors behind data patterns, whilst still having detailed orientation. Adaptability in a fast-changing environment is crucial, and an appreciation for the diversity of daily challenges is essential. Key partners for this role include multifunctional teams in areas such as Product, Finance, HR, and Sales. We work in a modern tech stack with tools like Snowflake, dbt, Tableau, Power BI.

We understand flexibility matters, so we're open to this being a hybrid role based in Stockholm and reporting to the Analytics Manager.

As Our New Data Analyst, You Will


Strategic Insights and Reports: Provide strategically actionable insights backed with data analysis; develop models and dashboards to track key performance indicators.
Data Model Development: Create and refine models to support our stakeholders' decision-making processes.
Collaboration and Integration: Work closely with various teams (i.e. Data Fabric, Data Warehouse, Product and Finance) to integrate analytics into business processes effectively.
Continuous Improvement: Assess internal resources, documentation, data sources, and reporting continually, striving for improved quality and accuracy.
Spreading Data Culture: Collaborate with the team to support and train stakeholders, aiming to increase data-driven decision-making across our groups.
Project Work: Support and drive various analytics projects through a deep understanding of data and insights.


Who are you?

To Contribute To This Role, You Have


Experience with strategy, business or financial planning, including roles from strategy, audit, finance, modelling, or consultancy.
At least 2 years of proficiency in Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, or similar data visualization software.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in SQL, or a comparable track record in analysing large structured and unstructured datasets.
A bachelor's or master's degree is desirable, ideally in a business or quantitative subject (e.g., finance, computer science, mathematics, engineering, science, economics).
Proven experience collaborating with senior stakeholders to solve business problems through data and analytics.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written.


Big Plus!

You'll Stand Out From The Crowd If You Have


Experience working in a global company with colleagues and partners across the world.
Tech, SaaS, or Telecom experience working in a Business-to-business setting.


Preferred Qualities


Growth Mindset: Encourages continuous learning and development, both personally and professionally, and views challenges as opportunities for growth.
Detail-Oriented: Pays meticulous attention to the nuances of data and analytics, ensuring accuracy and precision in all aspects of work.
Adaptability: Demonstrates flexibility in responding to changes in the business environment, maintaining effectiveness in varying situations.
Emotional Intelligence: Possesses the ability to understand and manage one's own emotions, as well as empathize with others, fostering strong workplace relationships.
Innovative Mindset: Encourages thinking outside the box and embracing new ideas and technologies, keeping us at the forefront of industry advancements.
Effective Communication: Exhibits strong skills in expressing ideas and complex data insights clearly and persuasively to diverse audiences.


Are you ready? Join us on our journey!

We will review applications on a rolling basis. Apply soon by submitting your application in English.

At Sinch, we value learning, embrace change, and offer opportunities for personal and professional growth. Unfortunately, we can only consider applicants who hold Swedish or EU/EEA citizenship or have a valid work permit for Sweden.

Benefits

At Sinch, we support employees with benefits that adapt regionally, ensuring you have the resources need to thrive. These include health and life insurance, flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.

Our Hiring Process

At Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and non-discriminatory. We use pre-employment assessment to create an inclusive application experience to help foster diverse and high-performing teams.

Even if you do not meet all job requirements, don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always looking for people that could help us pioneer the way the world communicates.

If this role isn't what you're looking for, please consider other open roles on our career page: https://www.sinch.com/careers/
Show more

Title: Dataanalytiker som vill bidra till utveckling inom SiS
Description:
Statens institutionsstyrelse, SiS, är en myndighet som ansvarar för individuellt anpassad tvångsvård för ungdomar med komplex psykosocial problematik och för vuxna med missbruk. SiS verkställer även sluten ungdomsvård. Det gör vi på ungdomshem och hem för vuxna med missbruk, över hela landet. Hos oss på SiS blir ditt arbetsliv en spännande utmaning. Oavsett var i vår organisation du arbetar, eller vilken tjänst du har, hjälper du till att skapa livsviktig förändring.

På huvudkontoret i Solna Business Park är vi ca 350 medarbetare och tillsammans arbetar vi för att stötta och utveckla myndigheten med ca 4000 medarbetare.

Arbetsbeskrivning Är du en driven dataanalytiker med passion för BI-lösningar och datadrivet beslutsstöd? Har du erfarenhet av att bygga datalager och leda utvecklingsprojekt? Vill du vara med och skapa smarta lösningar för att förbättra en myndighet i förändring? Då är detta din nästa utmaning! Statens institutionsstyrelse stärker sin analysförmåga och vi bygger upp vår analysenhet vid huvudkontoret. Vi söker nu en engagerad dataanalytiker som vill vara med och forma myndighetens arbete med verksamhetsanalyser, datalager och BI-verktyg. I rollen får du arbeta både strategiskt och operativt, från att leda utvecklingen av datalager och BI-lösningar till att snabbt ta fram analyser och beslutsunderlag för myndighetsledningen. Du får möjlighet att driva förändringsprojekt och utveckla myndighetens datadrivna arbetssätt i nära samarbete med avdelningar över hela organisationen. Hos oss får du en central roll i att förbättra systemstöd och skapa lösningar som gör verklig skillnad. Här finns utrymme att tänka nytt, ta initiativ och bidra med din expertis för att utveckla SiS analys- och uppföljningsarbete. Låter det som en utmaning för dig? Välkommen till en roll där dina färdigheter som dataanalytiker verkligen gör skillnad! Kvalifikationer Krav:


relevant akademisk eller eftergymnasial utbildning och/eller erfarenhet som SiS bedömer likvärdig
några års erfarenhet av analysarbete och/eller utvärderingar, med kunskaper i kvantitativ eller kvalitativ analys
god kommunikativ förmåga och kan uttrycka dig tydligt i tal och skrift på svenska Det är meriterande om du också har:
systemvana och kunskap inom Business Intelligence (BI) och gärna erfarenhet av att ha arbetat med verktyget Power BI och QlikSense
erfarenhet av projektledning
erfarenhet av arbete med analyser och utvärderingar inom offentlig verksamhet
erfarenhet av och kunskap om metod-, kvalitets- eller verksamhetsutveckling
kunskap i programmering, exempelvis i SQL
erfarenhet att översätta verksamhetskrav till tekniska specifikationer För att lyckas i rollen har du en mycket god analytisk förmåga och är van vid att på ett pedagogiskt sätt förmedla resultat och analyser utifrån aktuell målgrupp. Som person är du nyfiken och har lätt för att sätta dig in i nya kunskapsområden och tar gärna initiativ till att finna lösningar. Du tar ansvar och driver med uthållighet ditt arbete framåt. Med god förmåga att strukturera och prioritera ditt arbete tar du dig an arbetsuppgifter på ett systematiskt och noggrant sätt. Du har god förmåga att lösa uppgifter såväl självständigt som tillsammans med andra. Du är lyhörd och har förmåga att skapa goda relationer med din omgivning och uppskattar att arbeta i tvärfunktionella team.


Vi fäster stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. På SiS månar vi om ett gott medarbetarskap. Det innebär att du som medarbetare tar ansvar för ditt arbete, bidrar till utveckling och medverkar till ett gott samarbete. Läs mer om vårt medarbetarskap. Anställning En tillsvidareanställning på heltid som inleds med sex månaders provanställning. Tillträde enligt överenskommelse. Ansökan Välkommen att registrera din ansökan senast den 17 januari 2025 med aktuell CV samt genom att besvara våra urvalsfrågor som är kopplade till kravprofilen för tjänsten.

Vid frågor är du välkommen att kontakta Annika Ribbing, sektionschef, på telefonnummer: 010-453 45 12. Arbetsprov kommer att ingå i rekryteringsprocessen. SiS arbetar aktivt mot all form av diskriminering och välkomnar alla sökande.

För arbete på våra institutioner gör SiS registerkontroll innan anställning.

Inför rekryteringsarbetet har Statens institutionsstyrelse tagit ställning till rekryteringskanaler och marknadsföring. Vi undanber oss därför bestämt kontakt med mediesäljare, rekryteringssajter och liknande.

OBS! Om du har skyddade personuppgifter ska du inte söka via rekryteringssystemet. Kontakta i stället den som står som kontaktperson i annonsen. Läs gärna mer om oss på https://www.stat-inst.se/jobba-hos-oss/
Show more

Title: Data Analyst With Portfolio Brands Focus To Retail Bi & Analytics
Description:
Company Description

Portfolio brands consist of COS, & Other Stories, ARKET, Weekday, Monki and Singular Society, all with high growth ambitions for the future. We are a global network of colleagues spread across 9 regions. New market entries, both physical stores and digital, as well as Digital partnerships are of high strategic importance ahead to expand our reach, build brand awareness and deliver on our growth plans. Another big part of our growth potential is to continuously improve our way of expanding to enable profitable growth. In partnership with our brands, markets and functions, we are creating memorable omni customer experiences across the globe. Profitable growth is key for achieving success at portfolio brands.

The mission of the Retail Unit is to grow and transform the portfolio by building exceptional store experiences – securing high productivity, financial resilience and a strong brand. This is done through holistic retail strategies, fueled by tech innovation and enabled through our global network of teams and partners.

Job Description

The Retail BI & Analytics team is a team gathering data competencies within the Retail unit including Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Data Analysts and Business Intelligence Analysts. We work closely together with stakeholders within the Retail function and within the regions to enable data driven decisions, tools and processes.

We are now looking for a Data Analyst with focus on supporting the Portfolio Brands. In the role you will work closely together with the Central Growth team for Portfolio Brands and other stakeholders and colleagues to address the most important topics on the growth agenda for the brands. More concretely, you will be using internal and external data to perform analysis on areas such store and online growth, customer behavior and store planning. You will be supporting the business with proactive analysis and decision support for strategic decisions and key initiatives answering complex business questions. To succeed in the role you will need to take initiative, manage your own projects, communicate clearly with senior stakeholders and utilize your data analysis experience and business acumen to deliver actionable insights.

In the role you will:


Work together with the Central PB Growth team and the growth teams at the Portfolio Brands to understand their analytical needs
Utilize the Retail BI & Analytics team community to leverage previous analysis, insights and best practices and apply them to Portfolio Brands.
Transform business questions into analyses that results in actionable insights, working on the whole analysis process from defining the question to presenting the findings
Analyze large data sets and select, test and develop the best method or model for your analysis, utilizing your technical skills in SQL, R, Python, Power BI or other analytics tools that can help you reach your goals
Perform ad-hoc analyses to quickly address incoming questions when needed
Support in leading analyses, deriving insights and preparing communication material for senior stakeholders



Qualifications

As a person we believe that you are a true role model of H&M values and that you are an ambitious, flexible and communicative team player, full of drive and optimism. You have a genuine passion for growing businesses and creating results. You have experience in driving strategically important analytical projects. You thrive in an entrepreneurial setting where you are constantly looking for possibilities to develop more efficient ways of working.

Additionally, we see that you:


Have an academic degree in a quantitative field, such as engineering, business, economics, finance or math/statistics
You have developed strong analytical skills through relevant work experience with at least four years of experience from Data Analyst, Insight Analyst or Business Analyst type roles
Are confident in working with large data sets using SQL and extracting data by writing complex queries.
Are an expert in analyzing data in either R or Python
Have strong business sense and have the ease of seeing the totality and make fast interpretations of data and other information
Are a clear communicator who can easily translate complex analytical methods to business stakeholders and are comfortable in presenting results of your analyses to different stakeholders
Are a team player and enjoy sharing your knowledge with colleagues
Love data as much as we do and have a genuine interest in sharpening your analytical skills and creating business value out of data



Additional Information

This is a fulltime position with placement in Stockholm. If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!

H&M is committed to creating a Diverse & Inclusive environment and we are actively looking for qualified candidates irrespective of race, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, religion, national origin, disability, or age. We strive to have a fair and inclusive recruitment process. Therefore, we kindly ask you to not attach a cover letter in your application as they often contain information that can easily trigger unintentional biases.

Kindly do not send applications to this email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

About Your Future Role

At Nets, you’ll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Working to shape the future of payments, it’s not just skills and motivation that get the job done, it’s the full package that makes the difference. Together, we impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business and colleague.

Are you enthusiastic about working with data in reporting and analytical solutions? And would you be excited to take a critical role within data analysis in productive agile teams? Then take this opportunity at Nets as Data Analyst and join an experienced team, where you’ll be allowed to facilitate and direct our use of agile principles and methods according to SAFe (Portfolio configuration).

You’ll be powering Data and Analytics Nordics and DACH department, and your key responsibilities will include:


Bringing about product development from MVP to full-fledged operational solutions
Analyze payment datasets and design solutions for developing product propositions for customers.
Establishing data flows, transforming large data sets, building data models, enabling robust and scalable integration, and provisioning of data towards customer solutions.


As a Data Analyst, you’ll join an open and sharing community with highly skilled colleagues. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.

What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, your potential sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

At Nets, we are going all-in to establish agile best practices around product development and portfolio management, so we need a person who is a quick learner, motivated, result-oriented, highly analytical, and structured.

Your other qualifications include:


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proven experience (2+ years) in data analysis, preferably in the financial industry.
Ideally, you have 5 - 7 years of experience with a broad and deep technical understanding in areas of BI, analytics, data platforms, architecture and governance.
Potentially, you have been working with many of these technologies and tools:
– Big Data technologies like Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) including Apache Hive, Apache Spark, Hbase, Sqoop, etc.
– SQL and RDBMS like Oracle, SQL server
– SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
– Power BI tool
Experience on public cloud-based technologies is an added advantage
You have a solution-oriented and analytical mindset, and you thrive working with complex end-to-end solutions and processes.
You are a team-oriented person, have great communication skills, and have worked with both on-site and off-site development teams.
Verbal and written communication skills in English is necessary.

If you join us in the role of Data Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Health insurance
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

About The Team

We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth

At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=about-the-team

Title: Data Analyst Working student -Master
Place: Ballerup, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Siemens Energy, we are dedicated to nurturing innovation and forward-thinking. We are currently seeking a motivated and diligent student to join our Finance team as a Data Analyst. If you are a quick learner, well-organized, and passionate about data, we encourage you to apply.

The job is flexible and will be aligned with your studies.

Your Daily Responsibilities

You will be involved in data mapping, assisting with implementing a new data warehouse, making data analysis, and translating business needs into technical specifications for IT. Additionally, you will collaborate closely with data providers to maintain database accuracy and integrate data from various sources to offer a comprehensive view of business performance. Your tasks will include:


Conducting detailed data analysis to uncover insights and trends
Supporting the development and implementation of data-driven solutions
Assisting in the design and maintenance of data systems and databases
Ensuring data quality and integrity by performing regular audits and validations
Creating detailed and comprehensive reports for the business
Collaborating with multi-functional teams to gather and define data requirements



How You’ll Make An Impact

Improving our reporting and data analysis capabilities. This position offers you the opportunity to contribute your expertise and innovative ideas, rather than simply performing routine tasks. You will play an important role in:


Enhancing the accuracy and efficiency of our data reporting processes
Providing actionable insights that drive business decisions and strategies
Streamlining data workflows to enhance productivity and performance
Facilitating better data-driven decision-making across the organization
Bringing to bear your technical skills to solve complex data challenges



What You Bring

To be successful in this role, you should have:


Proficiency in SQL, Python, R, SAS, Power BI, and Power Apps
Knowledge of deep learning/machine learning, unstructured/structured data, and data warehousing fundamentals
Proficient skills in Microsoft Office and a passion for numbers and data
A bachelor's degree in Finance, Data Science, or Mathematics, or Master's degree or equivalent experience in Finance, Data Science, or Machine Learning
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for effective collaboration with colleagues from diverse professional backgrounds
High integrity, team spirit, and a proactive approach to collaboration



If you are ready to make a difference and grow with us, we invite you to apply and join our team at Siemens Energy.

About The Finance Team

Our Finance team provides a dynamic and exciting environment where you can grow and make a significant impact. We value collaboration and innovation, and we are committed to supporting your professional development. Our team strives for excellence and works together to achieve ambitious goals, ensuring that our data analyses are exceptionally accurate, and our processes are detailed. We believe in the power of teamwork and are determined to successfully conduct world-class solutions that compete at the highest levels.

Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 98,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we’re also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Find out how you can make a difference at Siemens Energy: https://www.siemens-energy.com/employeevideo

Our Vision

As a global leader in energy technology, Siemens Energy is committed to meeting the world's energy demands while protecting our climate. With a 150-year legacy of innovation, we are on the lookout for individuals who are passionate about decarbonization, new technologies, and the transformation of the energy sector.

Diversity Drives Us

Our strength lies in our diversity and dedication to inclusion. Celebrating over 130 nationalities, we value the outstanding backgrounds of all our team members and are dedicated to energizing society in its entirety.

Ready to Power the Future? Apply Now!

Join a diverse and innovative team at Siemens Energy by submitting your application via Siemens Energy Careers https://jobs.siemens-energy.com/en_US/jobs (Job ID: 268304) by January 17th, 2025.

We are reviewing applications promptly.

We refrain from all contact with staffing and recruitment companies, or advertising brokers.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Copenhagen, Denmark

About The Job

Do you want to work with management reporting and financial crime prevention in one? Saxo is an investments bank, with high speed, global colleagues and we are looking for a Data Analyst to work within the AML program management and reporting team.

The AML program is part of 1st Line of defense in Group Operations and located in Saxo’s headquarters in Hellerup. We are currently a team of four dedicated employees with diverse backgrounds and experience, and we are looking for new colleagues to join our program. The responsibility of the program team is to ensure progress on the Financial Crime Prevention globally across Saxo.

As our new Data Analyst, your primary focus will be to work closely with the reporting and data team to develop and implement multiple reporting solutions based on the right data. Furthermore, you will be responsible for supporting senior management and financial crime prevention leadership with data requests on different projects.

Responsibilities

The ideal candidate should possess a balanced blend of business acumen and IT expertise. Saxo has a client-centric focus, which requires the candidate to comprehend data analysis and issues from a business standpoint. It is a requirement for this role to be able to collaborate with and communicate across departments and business units in the organization. The nature of the position is analyzing data stemming from financial crime prevention business units, so findings, scoping and collaboration of fixing issues will take place across the value chain.

Besides this, the candidate must be self-driven and interested in learning how the business works. Experience with data analysis itself and with other financial institutions is a plus, but the right attitude can go a long way if other elements are missing.

Your profile

You thrive in an environment with constant changes but have an eye for the details. You may have experience from the financial sector within financial crime prevention or are eager to expand your qualification in this area.

The Ideal Candidate For The Job


Understanding of how data is used within business processes and its impact on desired business process outcomes.
Experience with data analysis of big data sets using SQL, Power BI, and Excel.
Experience with Databricks would be an advantage.
Solid project management skills to guide point-in-time and ongoing targeted data quality projects. 
Comprehensive understanding of the importance and impact of data (or bad data) on the ability of the business to meet its own objectives. 
Facilitation and conflict resolution skills to assist in resolving the different points of view and requirements that invariably collide during cross-team and cross-organization efforts.
Have experience in presenting and reporting to senior management
Have good communications skills both verbally and in writing.
Masters English on a professional level


We conduct interviews on a continuous basis, so send your application sooner rather than later.

Interviews will be conducted on an ongoing basis.

We get curious people invested in the world

When you work at Saxo, you become a Saxonian and part of a purpose-driven organisation, where good ideas are always taken seriously, and where you can make a true impact. We are invested in your development, and you can expect a robust career from day one when you join Saxo – no matter which role you take on.

You will join 2,500 other ambitious colleagues across 15 countries and become part of an international organisation. Working in Saxo, you will get to meet colleagues from many different cultures and backgrounds, and you should know that we value diversity and inclusion and see it as a genuine source of strength to drive growth, foster innovation and position us for long-term success.

We encourage an open feedback culture and supportive team environments enabling employees to grow and fulfil their career aspirations.

When you bring passion, curiosity, drive and team spirit, your learning journey will be dynamic and your career opportunities in Saxo will be immense.

At Saxo we don’t just offer a job – we offer an opportunity to invest in your future!

How To Apply

Click here to create an account and upload your resume and a short motivation. We look forward to getting to know you better!

Title: Lab Data Analyst
Description:
On behalf of our client, market leader, we are looking for a skilled, Lab Data Analyst for a mechanical/physical laboratory.




The role will revolve around thermal performance and testing, as well as advising and guiding projects from initial product testing to certification.




Overview of the role:




Focusing on thermal performance and other product properties, planning tests, performing analyses, and presenting conclusions, as well as:




Supporting R&D development projects and participating in/initiating line trials at the factories
Diving into test methods and data to become the expert in the field
Preparing statistics and documentation for reporting of test results to project managers and project groups
Participating in internal and external networks at test institutes




More specifically, tasks include:




Planning and conducting tests in collaboration with laboratory technicians.
Evaluating products and test results.
Analyzing data and preparing reports for project managers.




Essentials in a nutshell:




A degree in chemical engineering or other scientific area
Interest in the world of data and statistics
Willingness to specialise within the field of thermal performance
Material knowledge
A couple of years of experience from a similar position, ideally within development
Stellar communications skills







As of now, the duration has been set to around 3-6 months, but there is a high possibility of the contract being extended.




In case of any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me. Looking forward to seeing your application!

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about enabling insights to be discovered through data? Do you have a keen eye for how to best visualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to assist in enabling data-informed decision making in area of Supply & Distribution to grow the world’s largest jewelry brand? If yes, you are the person we are looking for. As our new data visualization specialist, you will play a pivotal role in making sure that we create technical analytics solutions that solve real business problems and engage users to drive adoption.

Transform, model and visualize data

At PANDORA, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Data Visualization Specialist, you will collaborate with product managers, data engineers, stakeholders, and end-users across the global organization. You will help business verticals and clusters maximize the value of our data and drive impactful business change.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing analytics solutions on our global data platform along with our team of excellent engineers in the organization.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  


Working closely with your products team to design efficient, stable, and to-the-point products to drive commercial business value through reporting, self-service analytics and other data communication cases.
Creating and maintaining high-quality and high-performance Power BI reports and semantic models.
Taking ownership of your products and continuously tracking stability, adoption, and impact.
Ensuring that great user experiences are at the heart of all deliverables.
Delivering self-service solutions for end-users and training them in their usage.
Working with stakeholders and end-users to assist with data-related technical challenges.
Following best practices and existing guidelines but also challenging the status quo.



Team Player With Strong Analytical Skills

We are looking for a real team player with a product-oriented, can-do attitude who is both technically proficient but also able to engage with end-users. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, we are looking for a confident communicator that can explain solution designs and can tailor their message and solutions according to the audience.

You’re perfect for this role if you have:


Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field, however experience and passion for data analytics is most important.
At least 2 years of experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization.
Experience from a global retail organization.
Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS, Databricks, Power Automate, Power Apps, and Jira.
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL and Tabular models.
High proficiency in English and ability to communicate at all levels of technical competence.
Agile mindset and experience with Scrum and agile ways of working.



Your new team

You will be an essential asset to one of PANDORA’s Data & Analytics product teams, consisting of data engineers, business analysts, scrum masters, and product managers who all enable our global business users in making impactful decisions informed by data. You will join our Digital Hub in Havneholmen, a peninsula on Kalvebod Brygge with a great view over Copenhagen Harbour.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake 

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more
HTML:
Are you passionate about enabling insights to be discovered through data? Do you have a keen eye for how to best visualize and communicate with data through reporting and analytics solutions? Do you want to assist in enabling data-informed decision making in area of Supply & Distribution to grow the world’s largest jewelry brand? If yes, you are the person we are looking for. As our new data visualization specialist, you will play a pivotal role in making sure that we create technical analytics solutions that solve real business problems and engage users to drive adoption.

Transform, model and visualize data

At PANDORA, we are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new Data Visualization Specialist, you will collaborate with product managers, data engineers, stakeholders, and end-users across the global organization. You will help business verticals and clusters maximize the value of our data and drive impactful business change.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing analytics solutions on our global data platform along with our team of excellent engineers in the organization.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  

  • Working closely with your products team to design efficient, stable, and to-the-point products to drive commercial business value through reporting, self-service analytics and other data communication cases.
  • Creating and maintaining high-quality and high-performance Power BI reports and semantic models.
  • Taking ownership of your products and continuously tracking stability, adoption, and impact.
  • Ensuring that great user experiences are at the heart of all deliverables.
  • Delivering self-service solutions for end-users and training them in their usage.
  • Working with stakeholders and end-users to assist with data-related technical challenges.
  • Following best practices and existing guidelines but also challenging the status quo.


Team Player With Strong Analytical Skills

We are looking for a real team player with a product-oriented, can-do attitude who is both technically proficient but also able to engage with end-users. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, we are looking for a confident communicator that can explain solution designs and can tailor their message and solutions according to the audience.

You’re perfect for this role if you have:

  • Relevant education within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, Statistics, or a related field, however experience and passion for data analytics is most important.
  • At least 2 years of experience working with BI, data preparation, and visualization.
  • Experience from a global retail organization.
  • Experience with Power BI, DAX, Analysis Services, Tabular Editor, SSMS, Databricks, Power Automate, Power Apps, and Jira.
  • Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL and Tabular models.
  • High proficiency in English and ability to communicate at all levels of technical competence.
  • Agile mindset and experience with Scrum and agile ways of working.


Your new team

You will be an essential asset to one of PANDORA’s Data & Analytics product teams, consisting of data engineers, business analysts, scrum masters, and product managers who all enable our global business users in making impactful decisions informed by data. You will join our Digital Hub in Havneholmen, a peninsula on Kalvebod Brygge with a great view over Copenhagen Harbour.

Did we get your attention?

We hope you got all your questions answered and feel confident applying for this position, however if you have more questions regarding the position, please contact:

Kelly Kavarnou

Global Tech Recruiter

kekav@pandora.net

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We are an international team, so please make sure to send us your application in English to be considered. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible. You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake 

You will be working out of our beautiful Digital & Technology Hub in Copenhagen, rapidly growing environment of highly skilled and experienced colleagues. Which is a key initiative that goes along with Pandora’s experience & ambitions.

You will also be able to take part in creating eco-friendly environment – that we are not only talking about – but implementing. The result is a professional and dynamic environment that is unique, enjoyable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here.

About Pandora

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2025?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us in influencing the future of digital payments in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

About Your Future Role

At Nets, you’ll develop in a fast-growing tech company in a high-paced, high-impact market. Working to shape the future of payments, it’s not just skills and motivation that get the job done, it’s the full package that makes the difference. Together, we impact the lives of everyone around us by powering an easier tomorrow for every citizen, bank, business and colleague.

Are you enthusiastic about working with data in reporting and analytical solutions? And would you be excited to take a critical role within data analysis in productive agile teams? Then take this opportunity at Nets as Data Analyst and join an experienced team, where you’ll be allowed to facilitate and direct our use of agile principles and methods according to SAFe (Portfolio configuration).

You’ll be powering Data and Analytics Nordics and DACH department, and your key responsibilities will include:


Bringing about product development from MVP to full-fledged operational solutions
Analyze payment datasets and design solutions for developing product propositions for customers.
Establishing data flows, transforming large data sets, building data models, enabling robust and scalable integration, and provisioning of data towards customer solutions.


As a Data Analyst, you’ll join an open and sharing community with highly skilled colleagues. You can come as you are and be at your best at Nets. You’ll find the freedom to balance an exciting job with life outside of work.

What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, your potential sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

At Nets, we are going all-in to establish agile best practices around product development and portfolio management, so we need a person who is a quick learner, motivated, result-oriented, highly analytical, and structured.

Your Other Qualifications Include


Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Proven experience (2+ years) in data analysis, preferably in the financial industry.
Ideally, you have 5 - 7 years of experience with a broad and deep technical understanding in areas of BI, analytics, data platforms, architecture and governance.
Potentially, you have been working with many of these technologies and tools:
– Big Data technologies like Cloudera Data Platform (CDP) including Apache Hive, Apache Spark, Hbase, Sqoop, etc.
– SQL and RDBMS like Oracle, SQL server
– SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS)
– Power BI tool
Experience on public cloud-based technologies is an added advantage
You have a solution-oriented and analytical mindset, and you thrive working with complex end-to-end solutions and processes.
You are a team-oriented person, have great communication skills, and have worked with both on-site and off-site development teams.
Verbal and written communication skills in English is necessary.

If you join us in the role of Data Analyst, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Health insurance
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

About The Team

We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth

At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=about-the-team

Title: Data Analyst Copenhagen
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are a digitally native technology services company where innovation, design and engineering meet scale. We use some of the latest technologies in the digital and cognitive field to empower organizations in every aspect.

Vertic, Globant division is currently looking for a Data Analyst to join its Globant GUT Strategy Studio in Copenhagen. In that role you will play a pivotal role in transforming complex data from various sources into insights that drive strategic decision-making in marketing, branding, and communications. You will be an integral part of the 'Insights & Strategy' department, a dynamic team of analysts, strategists, and media specialists. Your expertise will be crucial in conducting thorough analyses to generate insights that empower both internal teams and clients to make informed decisions across brand strategy, product launches, campaign planning, media planning, and engagement strategies.

Your day to day work will be shaped by the projects we have at that given period of time, but across the year you can expect approximately:


Data Analysis 60%: The majority of your time will be spent hands-on conducting data analysis to deliver on insights projects for our clients and internal teams.
Take ownership of digital insights projects from start to finish, including briefing, scoping, data collection, analysis, drawing conclusions, providing recommendations, and delivering presentations.
Become an expert in the digital insights services and methods that we offer (social listening, search engine analysis, influencer mapping, web analytics, competitor profiling etc.) through a range of SaaS tools (e.g. Brandwatch, SEMRUSH, Traackr etc.) and our custom built toolbox of AI applications for data processing and analysis (written in Python).
Insights Communication 20%: An important part of your job will be to reflect on what the data and insights mean in the context of our clients and the challenges they face.
Consolidate and distil often complex and larger data briefs (from our own digital insights, client provided market research, interviews, surveys, brand plans/ strategies etc.) into clear, impactful insights that inform business, brand, and marketing strategies/ decisions.
Create data visualizations and write reports that effectively convey your work.
Liaison with client and internal teams (account, creative, project management) and collaborate closely with Insights & Strategy colleagues (strategists, campaign planners).
Data Science 20%: We constantly innovate the insights services that we offer. You will play an important role in testing and suggesting new approaches as part of your work. Particularly exploring how to keep leveraging the fast-developing space of Generative AI in data analysis and insights work.
Continuously enhance our insights services by exploring new data sources, tools, testing and developing innovative frameworks, integration of new technologies (e.g., AI/LLMs) and refining how results are created and presented.
Support in the development of new custom AI tools (written in Python) and the updating and refinement of existing tools.
Define approaches to solve new requirements, problems, or data use cases.



What will help you succeed:


Bachelor's or Master's degrees in Data Science, Statistics, Business, Marketing, or a related discipline.
A minimum of 3 years in data analysis, business intelligence, or data science.
Strong data literacy and analytics skills.
Business acumen with a strategic mindset.
Good communication skills, with the ability to clearly present findings and recommendations to diverse audiences.
Proficiency in Python and experience working with Jupyter Notebooks.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau.
Familiarity with digital intelligence tools such as social listening platforms (e.g. Brandwatch, Netbase) and search/ web analysis tools (e.g. Semrush, Google/Adobe Analytics etc.)
Fluency in written and spoken English.



Bonus, but not required, experience:


Experience with graph databases such as Neo4j
Experience with web analytics (Adobe, Google).
Experience with healthcare, life science, medico, and pharmaceutical industries.
Experience with the b2b software industry space.



At Globant we believe that an inclusive culture and a diverse environment makes us stronger. We encourage people to have an inclusive spirit as our global footprint expands. We seek to generate a place of inspiration and growth for everyone. A safe space, based on equity as a value, where everyone's careers can be promoted and developed in the same way. There is no innovation without diversity and there is no improvement without plurality.

Are you ready?

Job Segment: Database, Data Analyst, Testing, Business Development, Market Research, Technology, Data, Marketing, Sales

Title: Analytiker
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
NY STUDENT TIL ERHVERVSLIVETS TÆNKETANK




Vil du bidrage til samfundsdebatten med ny viden indenfor emner såsom grøn omstilling, selskabsledelse, globalisering, regulering, erhvervsinvesteringer, arbejdsmarkedspolitik, ny teknologi og meget andet? Er du vild med tal og databearbejdning? Så kan Erhvervslivets Tænketank være noget for dig.




Vi er politisk uafhængige, men arbejder ud fra overbevisningen om at et velfungerende erhvervsliv er til gavn for hele samfundet. Erhvervslivets Tænketank arbejder tæt sammen med virksomheder, myndigheder og organisationer for at finde løsninger på samfundets komplekse udfordringer. Gerne med et kritisk blik, et mål om at styrke investeringsklimaet og ultimativt for at pege på de samfundsøkonomisk bedste løsninger. Vi bor i Bredgade 40 i indre København. I tænketanken har vi gode arbejdsforhold og faciliteter – bl.a. fitness, lækker frokost, god kaffe, og aller vigtigst, et stærkt sammenhold blandt tænketankens otte medarbejdere.







Arbejdsopgaver




I stillingen får du rig mulighed for at:

o       Deltage i produktionen af samfundsøkonomiske analyser fra idé-fasen til det sidste punktum

o       Videreudvikle og opdatere Erhvervslivets Tænketanks data

o       Udarbejde analyser i Excel og Stata

o       Løse diverse analytiske opgaver




Om dig




Vi forestiller os, at du:

o       Læser økonomi eller et andet samfundsvidenskabeligt studie (stud. polit, oecon. eller lign.)

o       Er analytisk stærk og kan arbejde struktureret med store datasæt

o       Har lyst til at lære nyt og ikke er bange for at tage fat i komplicerede emner

o       Er skarp i Excel og har kendskab til programmering i Stata, R, Python eller lignende.

o       Er en god kollega




Vi forventer, at du arbejder 15-20 timer om ugen, og vi er fleksible i forhold til undervisning og eksamensperioder.

Har du spørgsmål til jobbet, er du velkommen til at kontakte cheføkonom Finn Lauritzen på fla@e-tank.dk / 20 44 03 25 eller analytiker Adam Munk Riis på amr@e-tank.dk / 50 94 70 98.

Send en kort ansøgning, CV og karakterudskrift til os på e-tank@e-tank.dk senest d. 10. januar 2025.




Vi afholder samtaler løbende, og stillingen besættes når vi har fundet den rette kandidat.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig




Om os: Erhvervslivets Tænketank er et mødested for erhvervsliv, myndigheder, politikere, forskere og andre relevante samfundsaktører. Vi blev stiftet i 2011 (under navnet Axcelfuture) af kapitalfonden Axcel med det formål at fremme et sundt investeringsklima i Danmark – til fordel for det brede danske erhvervsliv.




Denne målsætning gennemsyrer tænketankens holdninger i alle policy-spørgsmål.

Sammen med erhvervslivets ledende aktører analyserer vi emner af central betydning og skaber uafhængige indsigter, der skaber grobund for konkrete handlinger. 

Show more

Title: Analytiker
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Analytiker søges til Danmarks hurtigst voksende bredbåndsvirksomhed




Vil du være med til at forme fremtiden for bredbånd i Danmark? Hos Fastspeed søger vi en skarp og engageret analytiker med et kommercielt mindset til at styrke vores team og understøtte virksomhedens fortsatte vækst. Som vores nye kollega bliver du en nøglespiller i arbejdet med at analysere data, skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger.




Dine arbejdsopgaver

Som analytiker hos Fastspeed får du et bredt ansvarsområde og vil arbejde tæt sammen med ledelsen og resten af organisationen. Dine opgaver vil blandt andet omfatte:

Udarbejdelse af datadrevne analyser, der skaber værdi for forretningen.
Analyse af kalds- og maildata samt udarbejdelse af forecasts.
Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af rapportering til bestyrelse og ledelse.
Sikring af datakvalitet på tværs af virksomhedens systemer og processer.
Automatisering og kvalitetssikring af den daglige rapportering i værktøjer som Plecto og PowerBI.
Oversættelse af dataindsigter til konkrete anbefalinger og beslutningsgrundlag for ledelsen.




Om dig

Vi leder efter en ambitiøs analytiker, der kan kombinere tekniske kompetencer med et stærkt forretningsmæssigt fokus og sætter en ære i at løse sine opgaver med høj kvalitet:

Du har en relevant videregående uddannelse på kandidatniveau (fx cand.merc., cand.oecon. eller lignende).
Minimum 2-3 års erfaring som analytiker i en dynamisk virksomhed – erfaring fra en start-up er et plus.
Du er superbruger i Excel - erfaring i VBA og udvikling af makroer er en fordel.
Du er stærk i datahåndtering og analyser og har erfaring med store datamængder.
Kompetencer i rapporteringsværktøjer som PowerBI, Plecto eller lignende er et plus.
Du har solide erfaringer med stakeholder management og kommunikerer klart og præcist.
Som person er du struktureret, grundig og evner at arbejde selvstændigt.




Vi tilbyder

Hos Fastspeed bliver du en del af en virksomhed med højt til loftet og en flad struktur, hvor gode idéer hurtigt bliver til handling. Vi tilbyder:

En arbejdsplads med fokus på både faglig og personlig udvikling.
En spændende og alsidig rolle med stor indflydelse på virksomhedens fremtid.
Tæt samarbejde med ledelsen og mulighed for at påvirke strategiske beslutninger.
En stærk teamkultur, hvor vi løfter i flok og fejrer vores fælles succeser.
Et åbent kontormiljø, centralt i København NV.




Du vil referere direkte til vores CFO, Ammar Ali, og får mulighed for aktivt at bidrage til at Fastspeed fortsat kan sætte agendaen på det danske bredbåndsmarked.  




Om Fastspeed

Fastspeed blev grundlagt i 2019 med et klart mål: At udfordre det danske bredbåndsmarked med højhastighedsinternet, konkurrencedygtige priser og verdensklasse kundeservice. På blot fem år er Fastspeed blevet en af de mest betydende bredbåndsspillere, og sikret os branchens højeste trustscore på Trustpilot.




Vil du med på rejsen?

Ansøgninger behandles løbende, og vi opfordrer dig til at søge stillingen hurtigst muligt. Har du spørgsmål, kan du sende dem til ama@fastspeed.dk. Ansøgningsfristen er 13. januar, men vi afholder samtaler løbende, så tøv ikke med at søge.




Vi glæder os til at høre fra dig!

Show more
HTML:
Analytiker søges til Danmarks hurtigst voksende bredbåndsvirksomhed


Vil du være med til at forme fremtiden for bredbånd i Danmark? Hos Fastspeed søger vi en skarp og engageret analytiker med et kommercielt mindset til at styrke vores team og understøtte virksomhedens fortsatte vækst. Som vores nye kollega bliver du en nøglespiller i arbejdet med at analysere data, skabe indsigt og drive strategiske beslutninger.


Dine arbejdsopgaver

Som analytiker hos Fastspeed får du et bredt ansvarsområde og vil arbejde tæt sammen med ledelsen og resten af organisationen. Dine opgaver vil blandt andet omfatte:

  • Udarbejdelse af datadrevne analyser, der skaber værdi for forretningen.
  • Analyse af kalds- og maildata samt udarbejdelse af forecasts.
  • Udvikling og vedligeholdelse af rapportering til bestyrelse og ledelse.

  • Et åbent kontormiljø, centralt i København NV.


Du vil referere direkte til vores CFO, Ammar Ali, og får mulighed for aktivt at bidrage til at Fastspeed fortsat kan sætte agendaen på det danske bredbåndsmarked.

Title: Student Assistant for BI & Analytics
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Imagine a future where you turn your passion for data into action and contribute to Ørsted’s journey towards a world that runs entirely on green energy.

Join us in this role where you’ll where you’ll play an important role in changing the way our organization looks at data. You will contribute by simplifying and presenting complex datasets for relevant decision makers, all the while asking the right question to make sure value is generated.

Welcome to Ørsted Bioenergy

You’ll be part of an agile team called Team Explorer within the agile program called Smart Plant, involving five teams and in all around 50 people across Denmark, Poland and Malaysia. Together with your colleagues, you will help with data visualization via PowerBI and analytical models on our assets. A part of the team is also responsible for implementing a data lake solution, where data located on different servers and databases will be transferred to a central place. As a team, we enjoy an informal way of working, challenge each other, combined with creating great results.

You’ll play an important role in:


working in an agile and energetic environment in a world-leading green energy organization
maintaining our existing PowerBI dashboards and help further develop them, based on concrete end-user needs
enhancing existing analytical models using e.g. Python and deliver on user stories
helping translate complex data issues within our power plant business


producing and presenting analytical results about e.g. maintenance on rotating equipment.

To succeed in the role, you:


are enrolled in a relevant study program like data science or similar at, e.g. ITU, KEA, KU or DTU and should have at least one year left in your studies, preferably more
either have existing Microsoft Power BI knowledge or are eager to learn how to combine data into appealing and user-friendly dashboards
possess programming skills, e.g. Python, which the team frequently uses
speak and write English fluently – Danish is a plus, but not a requirement
have a strong personal drive and can work independently.


Maybe you’ve read the above and can see you have some transferable skills, even though they don’t quite match all the points. If you think you can bring something to the team, we still encourage you to apply.

Join a global leader in renewable energy

Ørsted is a growing green energy major and global leader in climate action. With us you’ll play a part in driving change towards a green energy future. You’ll grow your talent in a fast-paced and high-growth industry where you have plenty of opportunities to learn and develop through challenging assignments and industry-leading experts. Here, you can perform in a friendly work environment based on trust, respect, and collaboration.

Shape the future with us

Send your application, CV and other relevant documents to us as soon as possible. We’ll be conducting interviews on a continuous basis and reserve the right to take down the advert when we’ve found the right candidate.

As an applicant or employee, you may request reasonable work and position accommodation or adjustments via accommodation@orsted.com.

Please note that for your application to be taken into consideration, you must submit your application via our online career pages and answer the screening questions relevant for your country. We don't take applications or inquiries from external recruiters or agencies into account for this position.
Show more

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Join a world of energy as MFT Energy's new Quantitative Analyst

In MFT Energy we trade energy to make markets efficient and to facilitate the green transition. We are looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join our ambitious Intraday team with experienced colleagues, who strive to be the best every day.




The job as Quantitative Analyst

As our new Quantitative Analyst, you will become part of a professional and dedicated algorithmic trading team. Our team contributes to developing autonomous trading strategies in the European intraday power market using cutting-edge technologies and trading methodologies.

The team consists of a highly diverse set of individuals, all with a common passion for data-driven trading and a goal to create the most sophisticated setup in the industry.

Your work areas will be within programming new trading strategies as well as supporting the improvement of our current trading setup. You will be reporting to our Head of Algorithmic Trading, Daniel Vibe.




Your key responsibilities

Research new market opportunities
Develop new trading strategies using machine learning and market knowledge
Contribute to existing trade signal and execution frameworks
Benchmark and evaluate external forecast providers
Optimize our active trade execution algorithms
Acquire and maintain data from external sources




Your qualifications and personal skills

Minimum 2 years of experience from a similar role or top of your university class
Quantitative background in Science, Economics, Engineering, Finance, or similar
Experience with Python and standard libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, etc.
Master machine learning and data-science fundamentals
Excellent communication skills and a proactive approach
Strong analytic skills and an eye for detail
The ability to work independently and structure your workload
A positive and competitive attitude, but at the same time a valued team player
Have a curious mind and the courage to take on a steep learning curve
Fluent in English, both spoken and written, as our company language is English




Working in MFT Energy

You will be part of a young, global, and vibrant working environment in the heart of Aarhus. MFT Energy is a transparent and flat organization with entrepreneurship at heart. We have 175 employees working out of our headquarters in Scandinavian Center in Aarhus C and from our international offices in Turkey, Australia, USA, and Singapore as well as several remote colleagues working from all over the world. Our mission is to empower entrepreneurs to become the best – we believe that this is done via a fair organizational structure, with the most competent people, based on the right values.




We offer:

A competitive and entrepreneurial work environment
Professional and committed colleagues with great ambitions
Great employee benefits and a people-centered leadership approach
The chance to one day become partner
A celebrative work environment, a modern workplace, and an entrepreneurial, professional culture.




Make the most of your talent! Join us!

If you think there is a fit between our values and your aspirations, we will be looking forward to receiving your application with your CV and your diplomas. For questions, please contact career@mft-energy.com.




Start date: As soon as possible.

We will be screening candidates on an ongoing basis.

Title: Graduate i data science
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
”Hos PFA søger vi en ny graduate med interesse for data og AI. Som medlem af vores AI Community får du mulighed for at anvende din tekniske viden, tage ansvar for spændende projekter og samarbejde med et team af engagerede kollegaer. Som graduate i PFA får du 24 måneders personlig og faglig udvikling – designet til at skyde din karriere i fuld gang,” siger Helle Gormsen, leder af AI Udvikling i PFA.

Du skal forbedre PFA’s digitale løsninger med AI

Bliv en af de to nye graduates i PFA’s AI Community, der består af 30 dedikerede kollegaer. Sammen vil vi anvende data og AI til at skabe branchens bedste kundeoplevelser for PFA’s 1,3 millioner kunder. Siden 2017 har vi arbejdet målrettet med AI-udvikling i PFA, og vi har i dag et modent setup med et AI Community fordelt på to teams med data scientists og data science engineers. Vi dækker hele værdikæden fra idé til produktion og effektmåling, med fokus på løsninger, der gør en reel forskel for både PFA’s kunder og vores kollegers hverdag. Eksempler på vores arbejde inkluderer datadrevne anbefalingsmodeller, skalerbar digital rådgivning og machine learning til målrettet sygdomsforebyggelse.

Hos PFA får du mulighed for at lære en masse og se dit arbejde blive implementeret i vores systemer. Din hverdag bliver en blanding af fordybelse i programmering, data og modeller samt udadvendte aktiviteter som deltagelse i tværfaglige arbejdsgrupper og møder med interne kunder. Du bliver en del af et stærkt socialt og fagligt fællesskab i vores AI Community, hvor vi støtter hinanden og prioriterer aktiviteter som demoer, innovationssprint og Townhall-møder.

Du skal bl.a. arbejde med at:


udvikle AI/ML-løsninger til at understøtte og forbedre PFA’s processer og digitale løsninger
lære at sætte AI-løsninger i produktion og bidrage til drift og lifecycle management
anvende ny teknologi og nye metoder i dine løsninger, fx Cloud-værktøjer og eksterne sprogmodeller fra Azure OpenAI Services
tage ansvar for dine egne projekter (i samarbejde med dit team), formidle resultater og indgå i tværfaglige teams.


To år med fuld fart på din udvikling

Som graduate i PFA bygger du venskaber og netværk med de andre graduates. I er sammen på bootcamps, hvor I får en professionel værktøjskasse med træning i bl.a. problem solving, innovation og facilitering. Programmet er designet til, at du udvikler dig både fagligt og personligt. Du er med i netværk og får en mentor, der sparrer med dig og støtter dig. Du er fastansat og tilknyttet én forretningsenhed gennem hele forløbet på 24 måneder. PFA ligger lige ved Nordhavn Metro og tæt på havnebadet. Her får du de bedste rammer for et fedt arbejdsliv. Vi kan arbejde hjemme op til to dage om ugen, men er generelt ret sociale, så du kan lære flere kolleger at kende fx i fredagscafeen, i vores medarbejderklubber eller på bokse-, løbe- og yogahold.

Kan du se dig selv som PFA’er?

For at blive graduate i PFA skal du have en kandidatgrad, og det må max være to år siden, du dimitterede, når programmet starter til september. Du trives med at arbejde med komplekse problemstillinger og forvandle dem til innovative løsninger. Og så har du evner, vilje og interesse for at blive klogere - og spille dine kollegaer gode. Måske kender du også lidt til PFA og synes, at vores kundefællesskab og samfundsansvarlige agenda er helt rigtig.

Du:


er kandidat eller snart færdiguddannet inden for data science, naturvidenskab, civilingeniør, computer science eller lignende områder
har erfaring med Python og stor interesse for data, AI, machine learning og programmering
er dygtig til at skrive kode, analytisk tænkende og god til at løse problemer og generere idéer
værdsætter samarbejde med kollegaer for at udvikle de bedste løsninger sammen.


Ansøg nu – og begynd nedtællingen til september 2025

Send din ansøgning og CV hurtigst muligt og senest den 21. januar 2025. Alle vores graduates begynder som udgangspunkt den 1. september 2025. Du kan læse mere om PFA’s graduate program her Graduate.

Tag endelig fat i os

Har du spørgsmål til den konkrete stilling, kan du kontakte Caroline Amalie Fuglsang-Damgaard, der er Data Scientist i AI Udvikling i PFA, på tlf.: 23 81 06 36. Har du spørgsmål til Graduate programmet, kan du skrive til Karina Roulund Bergmann på krb@pfa.dk.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.
Show more

Tag endelig fat i os

Har du spørgsmål til den konkrete stilling, kan du kontakte Caroline Amalie Fuglsang-Damgaard, der er Data Scientist i AI Udvikling i PFA, på tlf.: 23 81 06 36. Har du spørgsmål til Graduate programmet, kan du skrive til Karina Roulund Bergmann på krb@pfa.dk.

Vi samarbejder for at vores kunder kan leve et godt liv – både nu og i fremtiden

I PFA bliver du en del af noget stort – både som kunde og som kollega. Vi er omkring 1500 kolleger, der hver dag samarbejder for at gøre en positiv forskel for vores mere end 1,3 mio. kunder og samfund. Vi arbejder for at sikre økonomisk tryghed og sundhed gennem arbejdsliv og gode seniorliv for PFA er med vores kunder hele livet.

Title: Data Operations Associate (student role)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Do customer onboarding, system integrations, and technical solutions excite you? Are you ready to grow your career in the SaaS field and help shape the future of the automotive industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Data Operations Associate (student).

We are a high-growth SaaS and analytics company that works predominantly in the automotive industry, where we bridge the gap between data and insights, providing our clients with the necessary tools and intelligence to make informed decisions and optimize their operations. We build automations and utilize prediction models for our prestigious clients so they can take action on data. We work with the biggest clients in the industry such as Audi, VW, Porsche, SKODA, Seat, Peugeot, Opel, Suzuki, KIA and Citroën.

We are looking to hire a part-time Data Operations Associate to join our growth journey and help us to continue to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.

The Position

Skills

As a Data Operations Associate at ag analytics, you will be able to leverage your technical skills and organizational abilities to ensure successful customer onboarding and integration with their Data Management System (DMS). With a primary focus on technical aspects, you will take part in a wide range of projects, helping you to develop a diverse skill set and advance your career. You will be working together with our Data Science and Customer Success departments, where your main tasks will include:


Managing the technical onboarding process for new clients
Building and maintaining integrations using APIs
Coordinating with internal teams to ensure seamless implementation
Providing technical support and troubleshooting during the onboarding phase
Collaborating on workflow optimizations and process improvements


With exposure to a wide range of industries and technologies, you will have the chance to expand your knowledge and develop your career in a dynamic and challenging environment.

About You

You are currently pursuing a University Degree, ideally in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field. You have an understanding of APIs and system integrations and are eager to develop your skills further.

At our company, we believe that passion is the key to success. We are not just looking for individuals with a specific set of hard skills; rather, we are seeking individuals who are truly passionate about data analytics, technology, and making a difference in the world. We believe that with the right mindset and drive, skills can be developed and honed over time. Our clients expect the best from us, so we expect you to be a self-starter, take responsibility, and keep deadlines. You take ownership of your tasks, you are curious and willing to learn and improve. You work in a structured manner, have an eye for detail and ensure we always deliver the highest quality.

Skills And Qualifications


Basic understanding of system integrations and a willingness to learn
Basic knowledge of programming languages such as R, Python or similar
Understanding of API usage and data flows
Highly structured and organized
Good verbal and written English skills


Nice-to-Have


Previous practical experience
Basic understanding of Scrum environment
Familiarity with the automotive industry


About Us

ag analytics is a highly international scale-up with a team of over 40 employees who are passionate about predictive data analytics. Our offices are on Højbro Plads in the tech start-up community Matrikel 1. We are highly focused on delivering best-in-class solutions to our customers while learning and developing at the same time. We have an informal and relaxed team atmosphere with team events, breakfasts and Friday bars. You can read more about us here www.aganalytics.dk

Hiring Process

Selected candidates will be invited to a short interview with our Data Science Team Leader to discuss their skills, experience, and learn more about the role. Those who advance will be invited to a follow-up meeting with our Head of Engineering.

How To Apply

Please apply using the ‘apply’ button below. We interview on an ongoing basis so please apply as soon as possible. We expect to begin responding to the applications at the beginning of January 2025.

If you have any questions about the role, please contact our Data Science Team Leader, Oskar Riewe-Perla.

We look forward to hearing from you.
Show more
