We look forward to hearing from you.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
We Compare søger for Homerunner




EN DYNAMISK DATA ENGINEER




Er du en dygtig Data Engineer med en god bredde, der er ønsker at arbejde med etablering af pipelines og klargøring af data til udstilling/analyse, men også med behovsafklaring og indledende analyse… i en virksomhed der er lysår foran alle andre?




Så træd ind i Homerunners spændende univers, hvor de ikke blot laver historie - de skriver den om med deres innovationer. Dette er ikke bare et job, det er en invitation til at forme fremtiden med Homerunner og sætte dit præg på historien.




Hos Homerunner er alle kolleger forskellige med differentierede styrker, men deres fællesnævner er;

Du skal kunne stortrives i et dynamisk ”omstillingsparat” ungt miljø med stor kreativ frihed, samt frihed til at forme din egen arbejdsdag og vælge de metoder, der passer bedst til dig.
Du har ikke noget imod at blive kastet ud på dybt vand (fagligt) og du ønsker at udvikle dig sammen med huset på en spændende ScaleUp rejse.
Du besidder generelt et positivt mindset og lyst til samarbejde på tværs i huset.
Du er åben, relations skabende, ansvarlig, proaktiv og ikke mindst videns delende.




Hvem leder vi efter...

Vi leder efter dig, der besidder en stor passion for data, som ønsker ejerskabet i at sikre virksomheden det korrekte overblik, samt dig der samtidigt har en evne til at træffe velovervejede beslutninger på vegne af den gode holistiske løsning.




Opgaven og setup hos Homerunner

Business Information & Processes (BIP) sidder med hovedansvaret for at indsamle data fra Homerunners mange kildesystemer og sammenkøre disse, så de kan udstilles til brug for resten af forretningen.

Opgaven man går ind til indebærer dels den tekniske del af etablering af pipelines og klargøring af data til udstilling/analyse, men involverer også behovsafklaring og indledende analyse. Derudover spiller BIP en central rolle i oprimering af processer, hvor data og analytics kan mindske eller eliminere repetitive manuelle opgaver.




Lige nu har BIP opgaver, der vedrører support med analysebehov for pakkesortering/kvalitet og automatisering af omkostningskontroller, så fakturaer og fakturaspecifikationer ikke skal afstemmes manuelt.

Vi arbejder f.eks. på etablering af datastreaming med henblik på real time. Som data engineer i BIP, er man en aktiv medspiller på tværs af forretningens domæner. Der arbejdes løsningsorienteret med behovsafdækkelse og opbygning af relevant datagrundlag.




Aktuelt har BIP medvirket til at skabe en samlet analyseplatform, hvor data fra kildesystemerne er samlet og ageret op på den enkelte forsendelse, så forretningen hurtigt og let kan tilgå information om på forsendelsesniveau uden at slå op i 3-4 forskellige operationelle systemer.

Homerunner er generelt en meget dynamisk arbejdsplads, hvor man forventes at se løsningerne frem for begrænsningerne. Vi stiler ikke efter, at first draft er perfekt, men derimod at udvikle solide løsninger gennem en eksperimenterende tilgang, og forstår, at 20% af arbejdet genererer 80% af resultaterne - Vi vil hellere have en fartbøde end en parkeringsbøde.




Vi tror på, at vi sammen kan skabe noget, ingen andre kan!




Dine kompetencer

Mindst 1-2 års erhvervserfaring indenfor området
Du kan se dig selv i ovenstående fællesnævner
Du besidder herudover evner til at se og arbejde på løsningerne ud fra et helikopter perspektiv,
Du er ansvarlig og har gerne en holdning indenfor området.
IT uddannelse eller stor passion for data, men husk vi ansætter passionerede mennesker og ikke blot et cv.
Du er en udpræget teamplayer og er god til at samarbejde på tværs i organisationen.
Du behersker dansk og engelsk på højt niveauer.




Tech Kompetencer

(Det er ikke sikkert at du har erfaring med samtlige technologier, men du har erfaringen med en overvejende del)




Snowflake (Data Vault)
Postgres (udfases til fordel for snowflake)
Apache Iceberg
DBTcore
Light dash
Quicksight
Python
SQL




Homerunners kultur og DNA er, at man arbejder på kontoret.

Skal bilen på værksted eller lign. kan man sagtens arbejde hjemmefra, men vi har generelt ikke faste hjemmearbejdsdage, da vi tror på, at vi sammen kan skabe noget, ingen andre kan!




Hvorfor Homerunner

Hos Homerunner har man en stærk moderne filosofi, der gør dette til en forfriskende anderledes arbejdsplads og derfor tror man også på, at den stærkeste ledelse kommer fra at forstå og engagere sig i mennesker på et dybt niveau.

Det er din leders evne til at forstå og håndtere menneskelige relationer, også kendt som emotionel intelligens, der er grundstenen i deres tilgang til ledelse og en strategisk prioritet hos Homerunner.

Vi ser derfor også på din egen evne til at opbygge tillidsfulde relationer på tværs i huset og med kunder og forstå komplekse dynamikker, som en vigtig brik og en afgørende del for at skabe et miljø, hvor innovation og vækst kan blomstre.

Når du træder ind på de lækre kontorer hos Homerunner, vil du med det samme mærke en ånd og kultur, der oser af passion, innovation og du vil opleve at der er lys i øjnene på medarbejderne... ganske enkelt en anderledes arbejdsplads.

Homerunner er netop flyttet i nye lækre lokaler i Østerågade 27 i Aalborg

______________________________________________________________________________

Hvis DU er klar til at tage fat på en rejse, hvor dine færdigheder vil blive udfordret på det højeste niveau, og brænder for at være med til at forme fremtiden for en hel galakse, så send os din ansøgning til her på LinkedIn og gerne på tka@compare.dk og lad os sammen tage et møde og tale ind til og komme omkring en potentiel spændende fremtid hos Homerunner.




Kontakt gerne Tanja Kaysen hos We Compare (trusted advisor hos Homerunner)

+45 93 83 83 54 og aftalt et samtaletidspunkt. (vi afholder ferie fra den 20. december til den 3. januar 2025)




Vi indkalder løbende i december til indledende samtale i uge 1 og 2 – 2025.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job ID: 27839 



Would you like to analyze the links between investment decisions, risk and performance? We are now looking for a quantitative analyst to support our investment teams in delivering risk-optimized outperformance.     

Nordea Asset Management (NAM) is the centre of investment management in the Nordea Group and in the Asset & Wealth Management division. NAM is the largest asset manager in the Nordics with the vision of being a leading European Asset Manager. We want to do this by delivering returns with responsibility. We meet customer demands and guide our customers in the right direction in asset selection while ensuring prudent ESG practices. NAM has around 900 employees and more than 475 Nordic and international institutional clients. 

About this opportunity

Welcome to the Risk and Performance Analysis team. We add value by providing investment insights and analyses. As quantitative analyst, you’ll play a valuable role in providing a solid foundation for making informed investment decisions. 

What you’ll be doing:

Meet with portfolio managers at regular intervals to discuss risk and performance based on your analysis, predominantly in the fixed income domain
Maintain and develop risk and performance analysis tools
Produce internal risk and performance reporting using a combination of in-house tools and vendor-based systems
Perform in-depth investment process reviews, alpha plan reviews, to challenge and develop our investment processes 
Ad-hoc tasks of various nature to support the portfolio managers



You’ll join a close-knit team of 6 specialists with long experience in the field. The role is based in our waterfront offices at Christianshavn, Copenhagen.

Who you are

Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us.  

To do well in this role, we believe that you:

Are analytical by nature
Are self-propelled and persistent to make a multitude of analyses to arrive at good result
Enjoy programming and crunching numbers. Python and SQL are our friends
Have a genuine interest in the fixed income domain
Are a nice colleague - value teamwork and contribute to a great workplace culture 



Your experience and background: 

A solid quantitative background with a higher education in finance, statistics, economics or similar
Basic financial knowledge from a bank, asset manager, hedge fund or similar
Applied statistics experience is advantageous
Fixed income knowledge is also advantageous

 

If this sounds like you, get in touch!

 

Next steps

Submit your application no later than 12/01/2025.  For more information, you are welcome to contact Morten Eddy, morten.eddy@nordea.com 

At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at supporting our customers and communities. So please come as you are.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Supply Chain
Place: Billund, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Are you passionate about working in the interface between Supply Chain and Digital Data Organization while building the Business Intelligence solutions to make crucial decisions in LEGO® Operations?

Then bring your strong Business Intelligence (BI) skills, analytical mindset and stakeholder management capabilities into play in this role and help us playing a strong part in the provisioning of solid data solutions within a truly global organization!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

In this role as Senior BI Analyst, you will be responsible for the data connectivity and global reporting solutions for allocated user groups within the Global Supply Chain Operations. You will act as an interface between business stakeholders in Supply Chain and our Digital Data Organization, to both translate business needs to IT requirements as well as create and influence business intelligence solutions to suit the digital data tool roadmap. Furthermore, you will support team priority activities related to new BI platforms and business developments. More specifically, you will





Secure accessible and reliable data across the Supply Chain information areas through data platforms like Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Automate and SAP Analysis for Office (AfO)
Develop and maintain global Power BI reporting and dataflow solutions used across wider user groups in Operations, Finance and Markets & Channels
Partner directly with supply chain colleagues to co-create a clear roadmap based on key business requirements to deliver both new and improved reporting solutions for use in critical business decision making.
Provide data governance across data assets and Power BI reports and give timely support to end-users when requested
Collaborate with Digital BI engineers to bridge the data requirements from colleagues in Operations
Understand tools and trends within the BI area to apply the newest specialist knowledge within Supply Chain




Play your part in our team succeeding

You will join the Supply Chain Business Intelligence team playing a crucial role in the Global Supply Chain Operations (GSCO) department, by enabling the broader Operations organization in driving the integrity and developments of reports and analysis used in LEGO® Operations.

The team is primarily located in LEGO Campus, Billund and consists of 7 highly skilled and dedicated colleagues with great diversity in terms of educational backgrounds, nationalities, age groups, experience levels, etc.

Do you have what it takes?

The ideal candidate comes with 2+ years of proven experience with Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse building data models for reporting purposes. Experience with Supply Chain & Operations and Demand Management will be an advantage. In addition, you have





Minimum BSc in Supply Chain, Business Intelligence, Business Science or equivalent educational fields
Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI including DAX programming and the overall Power Platform
Strong analytical, data management and problem-solving skills with core ability to spot end-to-end perspectives and solutions
Effective and confident communication, collaboration and networking skills to build strong business relationships
Experience with Databricks, SQL and SAP will be an advantage




As a person, you are a true team player contributing and collaborating closely with colleagues, while bringing a strong curiosity and collaborative mindset following a passion about solving user needs and making sure that we all succeed together!

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

What’s in it for you?

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Insurances – All colleagues are covered by our life and disability insurance which provides protection and peace of mind.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Colleague Discount – We know you'll love to build, so from day 1 you will qualify for our generous colleague discount.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Children are our role models. Their curiosity, creativity and imagination inspire everything we do. We strive to create a diverse, dynamic and inclusive culture of play at the LEGO Group, where everyone feels safe, valued and they belong.

The LEGO Group is highly committed to equal employment opportunity and equal pay and seeks to encourage applicants from all backgrounds (eg. sex, gender identity or expression, race/ethnicity, national origin, sexual orientation, disability, age and religion) to apply for roles in our team.

Research shows that women and people from different underrepresented backgrounds often only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. If you dream of being a part of our team and you meet many, but not all of our listed qualifications for this role, please apply.

The LEGO Group is fully committed to Children’s Rights and Child Wellbeing across the globe. Candidates offered positions with high engagement with children are required to take part in Child Safeguarding Background Screening, as a condition of the offer.

Thank you for sharing our global commitment to Children’s Rights.

Just imagine building your dream career.

Then make it real.

Join the LEGO® team today.

HTML:
Job Description

Are you passionate about working in the interface between Supply Chain and Digital Data Organization while building the Business Intelligence solutions to make crucial decisions in LEGO® Operations?

Then bring your strong Business Intelligence (BI) skills, analytical mindset and stakeholder management capabilities into play in this role and help us playing a strong part in the provisioning of solid data solutions within a truly global organization!

No relocation assistance is offered for this position.


Core Responsibilities

In this role as Senior BI Analyst, you will be responsible for the data connectivity and global reporting solutions for allocated user groups within the Global Supply Chain Operations. You will act as an interface between business stakeholders in Supply Chain and our Digital Data Organization, to both translate business needs to IT requirements as well as create and influence business intelligence solutions to suit the digital data tool roadmap. Furthermore, you will support team priority activities related to new BI platforms and business developments. More specifically, you will



  • Secure accessible and reliable data across the Supply Chain information areas through data platforms like Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Automate and SAP Analysis for Office (AfO)
  • Develop and maintain global Power BI reporting and dataflow solutions used across wider user groups in Operations, Finance and Markets & Channels
  • Partner directly with supply chain colleagues to co-create a clear roadmap based on key business requirements to deliver both new and improved reporting solutions for use in critical business decision making.
  • Provide data governance across data assets and Power BI reports and give timely support to end-users when requested
  • Collaborate with Digital BI engineers to bridge the data requirements from colleagues in Operations
  • Understand tools and trends within the BI area to apply the newest specialist knowledge within Supply Chain



Play your part in our team succeeding

You will join the Supply Chain Business Intelligence team playing a crucial role in the Global Supply Chain Operations (GSCO) department, by enabling the broader Operations organization in driving the integrity and developments of reports and analysis used in LEGO® Operations.

The team is primarily located in LEGO Campus, Billund and consists of 7 highly skilled and dedicated colleagues with great diversity in terms of educational backgrounds, nationalities, age groups, experience levels, etc.

Do you have what it takes?

The ideal candidate comes with 2+ years of proven experience with Business Intelligence and Data Warehouse building data models for reporting purposes. Experience with Supply Chain & Operations and Demand Management will be an advantage. In addition, you have



  • Minimum BSc in Supply Chain, Business Intelligence, Business Science or equivalent educational fields
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Power BI including DAX programming and the overall Power Platform
  • Strong analytical, data management and problem-solving skills with core ability to spot end-to-end perspectives and solutions
  • Effective and confident communication, collaboration and networking skills to build strong business relationships
  • Experience with Databricks, SQL and SAP will be an advantage



As a person, you are a true team player contributing and collaborating closely with colleagues, while bringing a strong curiosity and collaborative mindset following a passion about solving user needs and making sure that we all succeed together!

Applications are reviewed on an ongoing basis. However, please note we do amend or withdraw our jobs and reserve the right to do so at any time, including prior to any advertised closing date. So, if you're interested in this role we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

Here is what you can expect

Family Care Leave - We offer enhanced paid leave options for those important times.

Wellbeing - We want our people to feel well and thrive. We offer resources and benefits to nurture physical and mental wellbeing along with opportunities to build community and inspire creativity.

Bonus - We do our best work to succeed together. When goals are reached and if eligible, you'll be rewarded through our bonus scheme.

Workplace - When you join the team you'll be assigned a primary workplace location i.e. one of our Offices, stores or factories. Our hybrid work policy means an average of 3 days per week in the office. The hiring team will discuss the policy and role eligibility with you during the recruitment process.

Title: Data Operations Associate (student role)
Description:
Do customer onboarding, system integrations, and technical solutions excite you? Are you ready to grow your career in the SaaS field and help shape the future of the automotive industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Data Operations Associate (student).




We are a high-growth SaaS and analytics company that works predominantly in the automotive industry, where we bridge the gap between data and insights, providing our clients with the necessary tools and intelligence to make informed decisions and optimize their operations. We build automations and utilize prediction models for our prestigious clients so they can take action on data. We work with the biggest clients in the industry such as Audi, VW, Porsche, SKODA, Seat, Peugeot, Opel, Suzuki, KIA and Citroën.

We are looking to hire a part-time Data Operations Associate to join our growth journey and help us to continue to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.




The Position

As a Data Operations Associate at ag analytics, you will be able to leverage your technical skills and organizational abilities to ensure successful customer onboarding and integration with their Data Management System (DMS). With a primary focus on technical aspects, you will take part in a wide range of projects, helping you to develop a diverse skill set and advance your career. You will be working together with our Data Science and Customer Success departments, where your main tasks will include:

· Managing the technical onboarding process for new clients

· Building and maintaining integrations using APIs

· Coordinating with internal teams to ensure seamless implementation

· Providing technical support and troubleshooting during the onboarding phase

· Collaborating on workflow optimizations and process improvements




With exposure to a wide range of industries and technologies, you will have the chance to expand your knowledge and develop your career in a dynamic and challenging environment.




About You

You are currently pursuing a University Degree, ideally in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field. You have an understanding of APIs and system integrations and are eager to develop your skills further.

At our company, we believe that passion is the key to success. We are not just looking for individuals with a specific set of hard skills; rather, we are seeking individuals who are truly passionate about data analytics, technology, and making a difference in the world. We believe that with the right mindset and drive, skills can be developed and honed over time. Our clients expect the best from us, so we expect you to be a self-starter, take responsibility, and keep deadlines. You take ownership of your tasks, you are curious and willing to learn and improve. You work in a structured manner, have an eye for detail and ensure we always deliver the highest quality.




Skills and Qualifications:

· Basic understanding of system integrations and a willingness to learn

· Basic knowledge of programming languages such as R, Python or similar

· Understanding of API usage and data flows

· Highly structured and organized

· Good verbal and written English skills




Nice-to-Have:

· Previous practical experience

· Basic understanding of Scrum environment

· Familiarity with the automotive industry

About Us

ag analytics is a highly international scale-up with a team of over 40 employees who are passionate about predictive data analytics. Our offices are on Højbro Plads in the tech start-up community Matrikel 1. We are highly focused on delivering best-in-class solutions to our customers while learning and developing at the same time. We have an informal and relaxed team atmosphere with team events, breakfasts and Friday bars. You can read more about us here www.aganalytics.dk




Hiring Process

Selected candidates will be invited to a short interview with our Data Science Team Leader to discuss their skills, experience, and learn more about the role. Those who advance will be invited to a follow-up meeting with our Head of Engineering.

Show more

Title: Performance Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Purpose

The Performance Analyst is a group position that plays a pivotal role in analysing and optimizing business performance across their respective market

This role involves deep data analysis, identifying barriers to revenue and profit growth, and collaborating with various teams to implement effective solutions.

The Performance Analyst will work closely with country managers and franchise partners to ensure tailored strategies that drive continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Key Responsibilities


Collaboration: Building strong relationships with Country Managers to gain deep insights into their operations, local markets (including competitor landscape), & customers.
Analysis: Identifying areas of strength and weakness within their business units through detailed performance analysis using the IWG analytical toolkit and reporting suites.
Problem-Solving: Collaborating with centralised teams (e.g. marketing, finance, pricing, recruitment) to develop tailored solutions for the identified issues.
Implementation: Assisting in the implementation of these solutions to ensure they are effectively addressing the problems.
Continuous Improvement: Monitoring the outcomes and making necessary adjustments to strategies and processes to drive continuous improvement.



Team Dynamics

The Performance Analyst role is part of a Global Performance Management Team, split into regional teams, each headed up by a Team Lead, dedicated to driving revenue growth and optimising EBITDA margin.

The team collaborates closely to share best practices and insights, enhancing the revenue and margin performance across various markets.

As an independent entity, the team provides objective and actionable insights during regular business reviews, supporting country, regional, and functional teams.

Reporting to the Chief Strategy Officer, the Performance Management Team is responsible for monitoring performance against targets.

The Chief Strategy Officer, along with the Performance Management Team, conducts quarterly deep dives with country managers, regional CEOs, and sales and operations functions to ensure continuous improvement and strategic alignment.

Personal Abilities


Commercial Acumen- Strong understanding of business operations and the ability to make sound decisions that positively impact financial performance and drive business growth.
Accurate - Ability to perform work accurately and thoroughly.
Communication - Ability to communicate effectively with others using the spoken and written word.
Problem solving - Ability to find a solution for or to deal proactively with work-related problems.
Working Under Pressure - Ability to complete assigned tasks under stressful situations.
Agile - Ability to deal with shifting priorities and issues inherent in a young company.
Passionate - A desire and passion to beat the competition and win.
Pragmatic - Ability to be hands-on as well as strategic and be a trouble-shooter when the business need deems it appropriate to do so



About The Company

IWG has been at the forefront of flexible working for more than 30 years. With over 3,500 locations around the globe, spanning brands including Regus, Spaces, Signature and HQ, we have made it possible for businesses of all sizes to make the transition to hybrid working, empowering employees to work wherever and whenever is most convenient.

We help more than 8 million people and their businesses to work more productively, supported by a choice of professional, inspiring and collaborative workspaces, communities and services. As the world’s leading provider of hybrid work solutions, with four times the number of locations compared to its nearest competitor, IWG is already working with over 80% of the Fortune 500 and counts businesses including Amazon, Netflix, EY and Uber amongst its customers.

Companies of all sizes are shifting to flexible working to lower costs, improve employee retention and lower their carbon emissions. The flexible workspace is expected to grow by 600% by 2023, when 30% of all office space will be hybrid. We are growing our network faster than ever to keep up with demand from customers as we work towards our goal of reaching 30,000 centres.

Carbon Neutral Workplaces

IWG’s purpose of helping everyone have a great day at work, while protecting people and the planet is at the heart of everything we do. We are proud to supply all of our customers worldwide with carbon neutral workplaces, and we have a strong climate action plan in place to help us achieve our objective of Net Zero emissions by 2040.

Leading Employer Award

IWG is proud to be the recipient of a Leading Employer Award in both 2022 and 2023. Awarded exclusively to the top 1% of employers, the accolade is testament to our diverse global workforce and the role everyone plays in bringing our purpose, culture and values to life, every single day.

Join us at https://careers.iwgplc.com/home

Title: Data Engineer - BI Specialist
Place: Esbjerg, Region of Southern Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Er du passioneret for dataintegration, dataarkitektur og BI-løsninger? Vil du være med til at drive digital transformation i en international virksomhed på en spændende vækstrejse? Så er du måske vores nye Data Engineer / BI Specialist hos Skechers Nordic i Esbjerg.

Om Jobbet

Skechers Nordic er midt i en spændende transition fra ejerledet virksomhed til en fuldt integreret del af Skechers-familien. Som del af vores udvikling og transition står vi overfor en stor opgave med at opbygge en ny dataplatform. Du kommer til at spille en nøglerolle i dette vigtige projekt og i vores fortsatte digitale udvikling som datadrevet organisation.

Dine Primære Opgaver


Oprette forbindelse til datakilder og indhente data, og modellere data til løsninger, der opfylder forretningens behov.
Udvikle og forstå løsninger i dybden, med fokus på skalerbarhed og pålidelighed
Opbygge ny dataplatform til understøttelse af digitalisering og optimering
Deltage i hele processen i opgaveløsningen i tæt samarbejde med forretningen
Vedligeholde eksisterende BI-løsninger


Vi arbejder i dag med systemer som Data Factory, Power BI og kommercielle systemer som Sitoo og Shopify. Vi koder i SQL og DAX.

Din Profil


Har solid erfaring med principper og teknologier inden for lagring, håndtering og tilgang til data i forskellige datasystemer
Erfaring med ETL-processer
Forståelse for forretningsbehov og evne til at omsætte dem til dataløsninger
Stærke kompetencer inden for SQL og DAX
Uddannelse inden for datalogi, IT eller lignende er en fordel, men solid erfaring vægtes lige så højt
Stærke kommunikationsevner på engelsk


Vi Tilbyder


En nøglerolle i opbygningen af fremtidens dataplatform
Mulighed for at præge vores digitale transformation
Et dynamisk arbejdsmiljø med dygtige kolleger
Gode udviklingsmuligheder i en international koncern


For at lykkes i denne rolle forventer vi, at du:


Etablerer en solid forståelse for vores forretning og nuværende BI-løsninger
Aktivt bidrager til at opbygge en skalerbar og pålidelig dataplatform, der understøtter forretningens behov
Bliver en nøgleperson i vores digitale transformation, der kan omsætte forretningsbehov til effektive dataløsninger


Vi ønsker opstart hurtigst muligt, men vi holder stillingen åben, indtil vi har fundet den rette kandidat. Opslaget kan derfor blive lukket før tid, så send gerne din ansøgning hurtigst muligt.

Har du spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Økonomidirektør Mads Riber.

Om Os

SKECHERS er verdens 3. største skomærke, med hovedsæde i Manhattan Beach, Californien. Med over 5.300 konceptbutikker globalt, tilbyder SKECHERS et bredt udvalg indenfor lifestyle- og performancesko, tøj og tilbehør til både damer, herrer og børn. Salget af SKECHERS i Norden varetages af SKECHERS’ datterselskab Sports Connection, fra det nordiske hovedkontor i Esbjerg, Danmark, hvor vi beskæftiger over 440 medarbejdere. Der er i dag ca. 180 shop-in-shops, 4 online shops, samt 64 konceptbutikker i de nordiske lande, og dette antal forventes at stige over de kommende år. Derudover føres SKECHERS hos et stærkt netværk af ca. 1.800 forhandlere indenfor sko- og sportsbranchen i hele Norden. Du kan læse mere på www.sportsconnection.dk

About Skechers

Skechers (NYSE: SKX), a global, Fortune 500® brand develops and markets a diverse range of lifestyle and performance footwear, apparel, and accessories. Developing comfort technologies is the foundation of all we do – delivering stylish, innovative, and quality products. Serving over 180 countries and territories, Skechers connects customers to products through department and specialty stores, e-commerce and digital stores, and through our more than 5,200 company-and third-party-owned retail locations. Headquartered in Southern California, with offices and distribution centers around the globe, Skechers has spent 30 years helping people of all ages look and feel good.
Show more

Salget af SKECHERS i Norden varetages af SKECHERS’ datterselskab Sports Connection, fra det nordiske hovedkontor i Esbjerg, Danmark, hvor vi beskæftiger over 440 medarbejdere. Der er i dag ca. 180 shop-in-shops, 4 online shops, samt 64 konceptbutikker i de nordiske lande, og dette antal forventes at stige over de kommende år. Derudover føres SKECHERS hos et stærkt netværk af ca. 1.800 forhandlere indenfor sko- og sportsbranchen i hele Norden. Du kan læse mere på www.sportsconnection.dk

About Skechers

Skechers (NYSE: SKX), a global, Fortune 500® brand develops and markets a diverse range of lifestyle and performance footwear, apparel, and accessories. Developing comfort technologies is the foundation of all we do – delivering stylish, innovative, and quality products. Serving over 180 countries and territories, Skechers connects customers to products through department and specialty stores, e-commerce and digital stores, and through our more than 5,200 company-and third-party-owned retail locations. Headquartered in Southern California, with offices and distribution centers around the globe, Skechers has spent 30 years helping people of all ages look and feel good.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 170+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?




We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.




Would you like to…




Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives




We would like you to be…




Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)




Would you like to join…




A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a skilled individual to take on a pivotal role in overseeing and improving Data Centre facilities across Kalundborg, Funen, and Zealand (minimum onsite requirement of 2-3 days per week).




6 month Contracts

Travel in Denmark is a must (Kalundborg, Funen, and Zealand)




Define, establish, and operate IT Data Centre facilities, including MDF/IDFs.
Coordinate maintenance and operations by working closely with contractors and vendors, such as electricians and cooling technicians.
Ensure new and existing Data Centre and Patch Room facilities align with established standards and best practices.
Oversee infrastructure lifecycle management and play a key role in managing major incidents affecting IT and business continuity.

Key Skills and Experience

Proven expertise in Data Centre Management, particularly in large organizations.
Strong vendor management and coordination capabilities.
In-depth knowledge of IT infrastructure, service management, and IT processes.
Familiarity with ITIL frameworks (certification preferred).
Experience working on large-scale IT projects and supporting technical architectures.
Understanding of pharmaceutical processes is an advantage.

  • Strong vendor management and coordination capabilities.
  • In-depth knowledge of IT infrastructure, service management, and IT processes.
  • Familiarity with ITIL frameworks (certification preferred).
  • Experience working on large-scale IT projects and supporting technical architectures.
  • Understanding of pharmaceutical processes is an advantage.

Title: Power BI Analyst and Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2024?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us to influence the future of digital banking in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

Role

If you join us in the role of Power BI Analyst & Developer, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Private health insurance
Healthcare cost reimbursements
Sponsored sports activities
Voluntary pension fund (company-sponsored retirement plan or pension)
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


About Your Future Role

If you join us in the role of Power BI Analyst and Developer, you will become a part of a team Self-Service BI team in Data Insights & Analytics responsible for building and maintaining self-service portal for our stakeholders to access and work with their data, reports and dashboards. You will never be alone and always have a lot of knowledgeable colleagues to support your journey.

We will be a team of 9 colleagues when you join in the Denmark Self-Service BI team with the team spread across multiple geographies - Norway, France ,Denmark, Germany & India.

Your reference line Manager will be Self-Service BI Manager Arjun Sagena, who will support your learning journey.

Your Key Responsibilities In This Role Will Be


Building full-fledged operational solutions, including building data models, reporting and dashboard solutions
Support delivery of data visualizations and insights to our customers and internal stakeholders via accessible, creative, and engaging data visualization and storytelling.
Maintaining and further developing data/reporting solutions by creating data sets to power critical dashboards
Usage of agile principles and methods according to SAFe (Portfolio configuration)


What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, it's your potential that sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

Qualifications Needed To Be Successful In This Role


You have professional data visualization and storytelling skills, are proficient in modern data visualization tools, and can communicate and present clearly
You are an expert in Microsoft Power BI with 5+ years of hands-on experience developing Reporting and Dashboard solutions in the field of Business Intelligence.
Proven experience with SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) and in building and managing tabular models.
Proficiency in using Tabular Editor for managing and optimizing tabular models.
Methodological knowledge in the field of data warehousing and data modelling
Strong SQL skills and experience working with RDBMS like Oracle, SQL Server, etc
Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) and Visual Studio for database and application development.
It would also be beneficial if you have experience with the below technologies, tools and domain:
Power BI Embed: Knowledge and experience with Power BI Embedded for integrating analytics into applications.
Power Apps: Familiarity with Power Apps for building custom business applications.
Power Automate: Understanding of Power Automate for automating workflows and business processes.
Paginated Reports: Demonstrated ability to create and manage paginated reports.
Version Control: Experience with GitHub and version control practices for managing and tracking changes in code and project files.
Exposure to Payment industry – especially Issuing, Account/Card Management
High commitment, self-organization, and ability to work in a team
Enjoy friendly cooperation, exchange of knowledge and experience
Furthermore, that you have a solution-oriented and analytical mindset, and you thrive working with complex end-to-end solutions and processes
Strong in the English language verbally and in written topped with great communication skills

Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

About The Team

We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth

At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=about-the-team

Title: Bi & Data Analyst til afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Motiveres du af udvikling, store datamængder og analyser, der skaber reel værdi? Vil du arbejde med data fra kildesystemerne helt ud til brugerne? Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.




Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.




Primære arbejdsopgaver

Modellering og effektivisering af data
Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab




Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.




Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.




For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.




Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.




MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Show more
HTML:
Motiveres du af udvikling, store datamængder og analyser, der skaber reel værdi? Vil du arbejde med data fra kildesystemerne helt ud til brugerne? Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.


Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.


Primære arbejdsopgaver

  • Modellering og effektivisering af data
  • Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
  • Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
  • Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
  • Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
  • Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab


Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.


Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.


Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.


For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.


Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.


MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are one of the fastest growing podcast & audiobook platforms in Europe and we are now looking for an ambitious Data Engineer to join us and play a key role in enabling the technical platform for our work with data and analytics.

Come and join us on our journey to enrich lives through listening.


This is the role

At Podimo, data is at the center of nearly everything we do; guiding decisions and fueling our business processes. This is where you come in!


In this position, you will join our BI & Analytics Engineering team, which is part of our global Data department. The team is responsible for our company-wide data platform and works to enable data-driven decision-making and operations across the organisation.


You will be collaborating with data/analytics engineers, analysts, and business teams, and will be responsible for ensuring a solid technical platform for our work with BI and analytics, and that data and insights are activated across relevant tools.

Our team offers a casual atmosphere with excellent opportunities for growth and impact, and you will in this position get the chance to take part in shaping and developing Podimo’s data engineering and business intelligence efforts.


While the role eventually will encompass projects supporting the broader organisation, the initial key responsibility will be to strengthen and take ownership of the data integration with our CRM system, Braze. This involves ensuring a seamless flow of relevant data into the system, enabling the Global CRM team to be even more data-driven in their work.

Your main responsibilities are:

Build and maintain robust, compliant and scalable storage and data pipeline solutions to form the data foundation for BI and analytics

Design, develop and maintain pipelines to deliver curated data and insights from our internal data platform to external systems (via APIs or other integrations)
Collaborate closely with members of the Data department, including analytics engineers, data analysts, and scientists, to understand their needs and meet these with high quality solutions, driving efficiencies in their work
Create and maintain data platform infrastructure, adhering to best practices
Take ownership of workflow orchestration, including scheduling, coordination, and monitoring of data processes
Collaborate with relevant engineering squads across the Tech department to optimize infrastructure, align practices, and coordinate data source changes
Work to optimize infrastructure and processes for performance and cost efficiency
Develop and maintain architecture and systems documentation


This is you

We are looking for a colleague who is motivated by and takes great pride in building and maintaining innovative and reliable data solutions. You understand the concepts of working in a dynamic and fast-paced startup environment, and you thrive in collaborating cross-functionally with your colleagues across the company.


In more detail, you will thrive in this role if you have:
2-3 years of experience of a similar role in a fast-growing company
Proficiency in one or more scripting languages, such as Python (preferred) or JavaScript, for building data pipelines and automation
Hands-on experience with batch, streaming, and event-driven data setups, as well as workload orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Spark, Beam)
Proficiency in working with APIs, including ability to write and maintain stable services for interacting with various APIs to fetch or push data
Experience managing platform infrastructure on a cloud provider (Google Cloud preferred), including building data pipelines, monitoring systems, applying CI/CD practices, and using IaC tools like Terraform or Pulumi for automation
Prior hands-on experience with data platforms such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience implementing data governance and compliance best practices
Solid SQL skills and foundational understanding of data warehousing principles
A collaborative mindset and a passion for teamwork, continuous improvement, and learning, combined with the ability to work highly independently while ensuring alignment with team goals
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal), with the ability to articulate complex data concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences

Naturally, being passionate about podcasts, audio content, and entertainment is a big plus!



These are the benefits
ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) for all employees, no matter where in the world you live.
Learning and personal development opportunities to help you thrive and enrich your skills in a fast-paced creator economy.
Up to six months of fully paid parental leave for all new parents - no matter how you identify or where in the world you live
Free online therapy sessions through We.Care.
Delicious lunch with great colleagues.
Unlimited child sick days and the opportunity to work flexible hours and remotely.
Opportunity to make an impact at a growing international company and see your work pay off immediately.


This is the hiring process

Please share your CV or LinkedIn profile. We’d love to hear why you’re interested in the job, but it’s not a must. If we move forward with your application, here’s what to expect:

An initial conversation with a recruiter to set expectations
A case conversation with the hiring manager, Martin Otto-Sidelmann, Director of BI & Analytics Engineering
A coffee chat with some of your potential future team members

We might tweak the process to keep things smooth and enjoyable. We'll be conducting interviews continuously, aiming for a start date around March or asap after that date.

Can’t wait to hear from you!


This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear – whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We recognize the value every individual brings, and respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions, and time. We approach our work with integrity and humility, and believe that we are better together. We have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We’re fiercely passionate about discovering, creating, and obsessing over great stories. We support our creators deeply, and have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their most exciting ideas and stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we have a good time doing it.

We seek to build a company and culture that mirrors the diversity of the world we’re living in. This means; diversity of talent, voices, ideas, and thoughts. That goes both for our brand, our content, our creators, and our teams.

You are welcome at Podimo for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what stories you have playing in your headphones.



Equal Opportunity Employer

Podimo is an equal opportunity employer, and we believe in equal opportunities for all in our workplace. We don’t discriminate based on race, colour, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age or political orientation, no matter where we operate.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We recognize the value every individual brings, and respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions, and time. We approach our work with integrity and humility, and believe that we are better together. We have zero time for brilliant jerks.

Title: Student BI Developer
Description:
Are you eager to develop your skills within business intelligence, be a part of a great team, and contribute to the green transition?

If you have programming skills, a can-do attitude, and a willingness to learn, Energi Danmark offers a unique opportunity for students like you.




As a student employee in the Business Intelligence team, you will play a key role in supporting the optimization of renewable and conventional assets, contributing to the efficient management of energy production across the Nordic region and Germany. Your work will directly support the division's goal of maximizing asset performance and delivering optimal results for our clients, helping drive the green transition.




You will report to the Head of Market Analysis & Projects, Origination.




YOUR MISSION

Your main responsibilities will be to develop and maintain business relevant tools on a strategic and operational level. You will be exposed to big data mining, which is one of our core approaches to decision making.




Your startup project will be rethinking an existing project, which is written in C#, and writing the new project in Python.




Otherwise, your area of responsibilities will be to:

Develop solutions to help traders make the right decision
Develop backend code (Python) for analysis and present valuable insights
Pull data from databases (SQL)
Ad hoc tasks




JOIN A TEAM WITH LIKEMINDED ENERGY

Our team is made up of both an analysis function, focused on asset and market analyses and forecasts, and a software development branch that ensures operational stability.




As a part of the software development team, you'll collaborate closely on a range of challenging tasks, from developing tools to supporting daily operations.

This is a great opportunity to learn valuable skills in data science and contribute to the green transition, all while growing both professionally and personally.




The team consists of 11 dedicated individuals who work together to drive impactful results.




LET US SWITCH THE FOCUS TO YOU

The ideal candidate is someone who has started their second or third year of a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Physics, Mathematics, Mathematics-Economy, or Data Science. However, we value skills and experience over formal education.




We are looking for a candidate who excels in their studies, is curious, and thrives in a challenging environment where the learning curve is steep.

You should be conscientious, taking full responsibility for your own projects.

Additionally, we hope you are proficient in programming, particularly Python and C#, with experience in SQL, VBA, or R being a plus.




You should also be available to work an average of 14-16 hours per week.




There will be an introduction period at the onset of your employment.




We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and identities to apply, as we believe that a diverse team leads to innovation and success.




WE MIGHT BE BIASED, BUT IT IS QUITE AWESOME HERE

Building on decades of trading expertise, we are one of the leading trading companies in the Nordics. When you join us, you will be part of an ambitious energy trading company with over 300 employees, working alongside talented and dedicated colleagues. We are on a transformational journey, driving high efficiency in the energy markets and accelerating the energy transition by connecting and serving producers and consumers of renewable energy.




We offer an exciting and dynamic workplace that fosters high ambitions and nurtures a culture of dedication, problem-solving, and a winning mindset. As we navigate a significant transformation, you will find a lot of opportunities for growth, skill development, and specialization with us.




We place great emphasis on the well-being of our employees, both inside and outside the workplace. We prioritize excellent working conditions and offer a comprehensive benefits package, including extra days off, competitive compensation and flexible working hours to promote a healthy work-life balance.




LET US GET THIS CONVERSATIONS STARTED

If you want to join us, don’t wait – send your resume and application as soon as possible, but no later than January 10.




Please note that due to the winter break, you should expect to hear from us in the beginning of January 2025. However, we will still be conducting interviews on a rolling basis, so the post may close early if we find the perfect fit.




Got questions or need more details? Feel free to reach out to Smail Kozarcanin, Head of Market Analysis & Projects, Origination via email at smko@energidanmark.dk or on phone: phone +45 87 42 67 37.




You’re almost there – ready to cross the finish line and join us in 2025?

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data engineering and do you want to be a part of data driven growth at the world’s largest jewelry brand?

Our Journey:

We are on a journey from IaaS based Microsoft solutions to Azure PaaS with use of well-known tools and solutions like ADF, Data lake, Synapse, Analysis Services and DataBricks.

As a Data Engineer you will build high quality data and Data & Analytic products on our Azure Paas data platform.

About the Role:

We are growing our Data & Analytics footprint. As our new data engineer you will collaborate with product managers, architects and other key profiles across the global organisation. You will help business verticals and clusters maximising the value of our data and drive business change as an impact of this.

Your primary focus will be building and implementing scalable data products on our global data platform together with other smart engineers in the organization.

Key responsibilities:


Work closely with your colleagues within a product team to design scalable, efficient and stable products
Work closely with product owners to build and deliver features designed to support PANDORA to drive the business cases and efficiencies within reporting and analytics & AI and other data driven use cases
Create and maintain high quality data pipeline architecture
Obtain relevant business and system knowledge to convert requirements efficiently to technical design documentation and conceptual data modelling
Ingest large, complex data sets, automate manual processes, optimize data delivery, improve data quality, etc.
Own your data products and track continuous stability and benefits



About The Team

You will be an essential part of the data engineering organization and Pandora’s extended Data & Analytics community. You will work within the data product engineering team in a virtual and agile based organization.

As we are a growing team, you will have the chance to influence our culture and working tools and work together with other data engineers, Data Visualization Specialists, architects, scrum masters, product managers and much more from Europe, India and Thailand.

Hard requirements:


A minimum of 3 years of proven experience with DataBricks



Experience:


ADF, Data Lake, Synapse, T/U-SQL, and SQL Server.
Experience with at least one object oriented or functional/scripting languages – PySpark, SQL, Python etc.
DevOps and CI/CD focus
Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL
Experience with data warehousing and dimensional modelling
Experience in building, and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and datasets
Experience in working with Azure, AWS or other cloud providers
Experience in working with Streaming data processing or C#/JavaScript/Containerization
Relevant education in within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, or Statistics.



Soft Skills Requirements:

We are looking for a team player passionate about data and engineering. You consider yourself as a real team player, product oriented, can-do attitude and with good stakeholder management skills. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, you are a confident communicator and have the ability to explain your solution design and tailor the message according to the audience.

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora:

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.
Show more
