  • Own your data products and track continuous stability and benefits


About The Team

You will be an essential part of the data engineering organization and Pandora’s extended Data & Analytics community. You will work within the data product engineering team in a virtual and agile based organization.

As we are a growing team, you will have the chance to influence our culture and working tools and work together with other data engineers, Data Visualization Specialists, architects, scrum masters, product managers and much more from Europe, India and Thailand.

Hard requirements:

  • A minimum of 3 years of proven experience with DataBricks


Experience:

  • ADF, Data Lake, Synapse, T/U-SQL, and SQL Server.
  • Experience with at least one object oriented or functional/scripting languages – PySpark, SQL, Python etc.
  • DevOps and CI/CD focus
  • Experience in working with relational data sets using SQL
  • Experience with data warehousing and dimensional modelling
  • Experience in building, and optimizing data pipelines, architectures, and datasets
  • Experience in working with Azure, AWS or other cloud providers
  • Experience in working with Streaming data processing or C#/JavaScript/Containerization
  • Relevant education in within Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, Information Management, or Statistics.


Soft Skills Requirements:

We are looking for a team player passionate about data and engineering. You consider yourself as a real team player, product oriented, can-do attitude and with good stakeholder management skills. You are structured and analytical, always aiming to achieve great results. Furthermore, you are a confident communicator and have the ability to explain your solution design and tailor the message according to the audience.

Did we get your attention?

If you see yourself in the position and would like to become a part of Pandora’s future, please do not hesitate to apply. We look forward to hearing from you!

We process applications on a continuous basis, which is why we encourage you to send your application as soon as possible.

You can also read more about Pandora on our corporate site www.pandoragroup.com.

Icing on the cake:

You will be working out of our beautiful Head Office in Copenhagen V, established in 2016 and designed to unite and inspire our teams. Besides our beautiful interior design we are also proud of our LEED Gold Certification for Energy and Environmental Design. This means that we use as few natural resources as possible and that we use them with respect. The result is a professional and dynamic space that is unique, comfortable and inspirational – and delivers a true Pandora experience to anyone who works here or comes to visit.

About Pandora:

Established in 1982, Pandora designs, manufactures and markets hand-finished jewellery made from high-quality materials at affordable prices. Pandora’s products are available in more than 100 countries on six continents through more than 6,500 points of sale, including around 2,500 concept stores.

Headquartered in Copenhagen, Denmark, Pandora employs 32,000 people worldwide and crafts its jewellery at two LEED certified facilities in Thailand, using mainly recycled silver and gold. The company plans to be carbon neutral by 2025 and has joined the Science Based Targets initiative to reduce emissions across its full value chain. Pandora is listed on the Nasdaq Copenhagen stock exchange and generated a revenue of DKK 28.1 billion in 2023.

At Pandora, we believe that creating an inclusive and diverse workplace and reflecting societal diversity in our customer engagement is essential to delivering on our company purpose: to give a voice to people’s loves. We dedicate ourselves to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of inclusion and diversity where everyone feels respected and valued.

Title: Open Application
Place: Gentofte, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
You have superpowers, but you haven’t found the right positions for you. Well, you are always welcome

to send us your open application.

For example, we are usually looking for new talents in the following areas:


Sales
Architects
Integration experts
Data Management
Please note that our offices cannot sponsor work permits for the time being.


NOTE: At Fluido, we do background checks for our future employees where applicable.

In relation to the background checks, our background checks provider Hire Right Ltd. will contact you to conduct these checks on the Company’s behalf. We will ask you for your education and the last two employers. This information will be processed with the utmost sensitivity and your personal data will be handled in accordance with our data protection legislation and Fluido’s Data Privacy Notice. If the outcome of the background check comes back with concerns due to misstatements or misrepresentations provided, we reserve the right to withdraw your offer of employment.

Title: Student BI Analyst
Place: Silkeborg Municipality, Central Denmark Region, Denmark
Description:
Er du god til tal, data, struktur og analyse, og kan du se det spændende i at arbejde i en teknologi-drevet organisation, der drifter Danmarks økonomi? Vil du sætte turbo på din udvikling som fremtidig BI-udvikler, datakonsulent eller analytiker? Så kan du blive en del af vores Business Intelligence (BI) team i JN Data som Student BI Analyst.




Stillingen

Som én af de største IT-service virksomheder for den finansielle sektor i Norden er vi med til at drifte Danmarks økonomi. For at understøtte vores egen og kunders forretning har vi lanceret et Enterprise Data Governance (EDG) initiativ, der skal sikre effektiv behandling af data, regulatorisk compliance, og at data kan anvendes på flere og nye forretningsområder.




Dine primære arbejdsopgaver bliver at:

Vedligeholde vores datakatalog, herunder håndtere det samlede datalandskab, så det altid er up-to-date og indeholder de relevante oplysninger.
Sammen med dine kollegaer i teamet at videreudvikle vores tekniske katalog-løsning, herunder automatisere og optimere en række processer og drive de forskellige aktiviteter relateret hertil.
Udvikle forskellige typer af rapportering, både i relation til EDG og til generel supportering af BI-teamet.
Afhængigt af dine evner og interesser at løse opgaver på tværs af teamets portefølje, fra klassifikation af vores data og modeller – til udvikling af rapporter og data-produkter.




Teamet

Du bliver en del af vores BI-team i Silkeborg, som arbejder for den øverste ledelse i JN Data for at skabe en funktion, der kan støtte udvikling af datamodenhed. I BI-teamet får du syv kollegaer, herunder seks dygtige udviklere og en projektleder. Vi garanterer et stærkt fagligt læringsmiljø, som vi kan supplere med regulær uddannelse indenfor fx PowerBI. Herudover vil du få en stor berøringsflade med resten af JN Data. Vores engagement er højt, og hvis vi selv skal sige det, har vi en fed arbejdsplads og venligheden er slående.




Vi sikrer løbende fokus på dit potentiale og din udvikling med faste feedback-samtaler med din leder og planlægger et introduktionsforløb for dig fra første dag, hvor du får tilknyttet en mentor.




Dig

Vi er på udkig efter dig, som har interesse for tal, dataanalyse og struktur. Du skal formentlig i gang med det sidste semester på din bachelor eller læser kandidat på cand.merc., cand.oecon., ingeniør- eller datavidenskab.




Vi lægger vægt på, at:

Du er god til Excel og har kendskab til basal datamodellering, fx med PowerPivot eller andre værktøjer.
Du har interesse for IT og tech og ønsker at arbejde i et teknologi-drevet miljø.
Du arbejder struktureret og detaljeorienteret.
Du kommunikerer flydende på skrift og i tale på dansk og engelsk.




Har du kendskab til PowerBI, PowerQuery og SQL er det en fordel. Afhængigt at behov så vil du også modtage træning i nogle af disse værktøjer.




Vi forventer, at du kan arbejde to dage om ugen, men vi tager naturligvis hensyn til din undervisning og eksamensperioder.




Hvad vi tilbyder

Særligt i starten er det vigtigt, at du kommer fysisk på vores kontor i Silkeborg, mens du med tiden vil kunne udføre nogle af dine opgave hjemmefra. Der er indtil flere køreordninger fra Aarhus.




Derudover:

Et professionelt, men uformelt arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er stort fokus på medarbejdertrivsel og udvikling.
Arbejdscomputer og headset.
Kantineordning.
Udvalgte forsikringer, herunder Tandsikring, Sundhedssikring og Kritisk Sygdom.




Fangede vi din interesse?

Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & Systems Architecture Lars Trier Husted på 61240213.

Show more

Derudover:

  • Et professionelt, men uformelt arbejdsmiljø, hvor der er stort fokus på medarbejdertrivsel og udvikling.
  • Arbejdscomputer og headset.
  • Kantineordning.
  • Udvalgte forsikringer, herunder Tandsikring, Sundhedssikring og Kritisk Sygdom.


Fangede vi din interesse?

Så ser vi frem til at høre fra dig. Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er du velkommen til at kontakte Head of Data & Systems Architecture Lars Trier Husted på 61240213.

Title: Data Insights Consultant
Place: Kongens Lyngby, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
About Us

Topsoe is a leading global provider of technology and solutions for the energy transition. We combat climate change by helping our customers and partners achieve their decarbonization and emission reduction goals.

Based on decades of scientific research and innovation, we offer world leading solutions for transforming renewable resources into fuels and chemicals for a sustainable world, and for efficient and low-carbon fuel production and clean air.

We were founded in 1940 and are headquartered in Denmark, with over 2,800 employees serving customers all around the globe. To learn more, visit www.topsoe.com.

Who We’re Looking For

Can you identify needs, build, and apply BI reports to support the business and for decision-making, or do you have an interest within this area? Do you like to work, and help colleagues from many different departments and across functions? Then you might be the Data Consultant we are looking for!

Our team supports the business with tools and insights to make data-driven strategic and tactical improvements. We are a smaller team within the Business Finance organization with lots of ambitions, so there will be plenty of opportunity to make a difference and set the agenda on data communication, presentation and understanding together with the rest of the organization. Your role will be very diverse. One day you might be developing new insights reports, and the next day you will innovate existing analyses and reports – and discuss next-level solutions with stakeholders or managers.

Your Responsibilities Will Include


Identifying and designing value-adding insights solutions
Interpreting business requests and clarifying data requirements
Assisting and advising on data models and scoping of new BI projects
Collaborating with highly skilled colleagues including Data analysts, Application Specialists, Business Partners, and Managers to service our clients coherently
Promoting new insights/reports (descriptive and prescriptive).


Our primary tools - knowledge to the tools is not a requirement:


SAC (SAP Analytics Cloud)
Excel and SAP Analysis
Eclipse IDE (Eclipse Modeling Tools)
PowerBI
PowerPoint and Think-cell.


What You’ll Bring

The preferred candidate has some years of experience from similar jobs, e.g., Business Analyst, BI Consultant or Data Analyst in either other companies or consultancy firms. It is a plus but not a requirement to have consultancy experience.

The right candidate could also be newly graduated and hold a master’s degree within Economics or Data Science or equivalent. If this is the case, together we will find the right balance between tasks and responsibilities to match your profile.

Why join us

There are many reasons to join us. To mention a few, you will get:


A job with a purpose: We are on a mission to solve the world’s climate crises. We are using our cutting-edge technology for a better world
A platform to grow from: We have personal and professional development high on our agenda, and we will provide you with tools and tasks to make you learn and grow
We care about you: We believe in the strength derived from diversity, and we strive to build trust in- and collaborate with one-another.


How You Can Apply

Please contact Andreas Bøttger, Finance Director, Commercial Business Finance & Data Insights, via ANBG@topsoe.com or +45 4188 9521 if you want to know more about the position.

If you would like to be part of a team of skilled and professional colleagues in an informal organization, please submit your application and resume in English through our website www.topsoe.com.

To ensure a secure and trustworthy work environment, our recruitment process may include background checks and criminal record requests.

Application deadline

February 15th, 2025.

Title: System Engineer
Place: Glostrup Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Would you like to work in an international, dynamic and challenging environment? Would you like to work in the space industry? Then Rovsing A/S could be the right challenge for you!




Due to increased activity in our EGSE project group we are looking for a dedicated and committed System Engineer.




Rovsing provides state of the art test and simulation systems for ground testing of satellites to customers primarily in Europe and USA. These systems enable a satellite manufacturer to test existing parts of a satellite while simulating non-existing parts during their development, assembly, integration and test. All our systems are built to very high safety and quality standards.




As a System Engineer you are responsible for defining the overall technical solution. This requires a holistic approach, as the development of Electrical Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) involves several technical disciplines. All of which must interact to produce a system (electrical, mechanical, software etc.) compliant to the customer requirements. High- and mid-level understanding of all these areas will enable you to act as the interface between technical disciplines and ensure the resulting compliance of the overall design, drawing on the knowledge of specialists and colleagues as needed.




We are looking for a person with a profile matching most of the characteristics listed below:




We offer:

A technically challenging job, working with highly skilled colleagues in the growing space business.
A workplace with a dynamic, flexible and flat organisation, where you have significant influence on your own tasks.
Being the technical lead and main technical interface to the customer on one or more EGSE projects from project initiation to delivery.
Participation in definition, development and rollout of new Rovsing products.
The opportunity to interact with the big European space integrators and ESA.
The opportunity to grow both your personal and technical competences.




Your Profile:

Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in Electrical or Software Engineering or equivalent.
Relevant working experience in the field of satellite test systems is a plus.
Experience in analysing, designing and implementing efficient solutions in response to customer specifications.
Experience with technical customer communication in a B2B environment.
Structured thinking, preference for proactiveness over reactiveness, attention to detail, excellence and completeness are useful traits, as is being interested in using a broad range of competences.
Project management experience is a plus.
Takes responsibility for your own work and the overall results.




Please, send you application including CV by e-mail to: job@rovsing.dk




You are welcome to contact for further information:




Mr. Jacob Skov Larsen, System Engineering Team Lead

jsl@rovsing.dk

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Måløv, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you the Data Engineer that will help us expand our application platform in the future? Are you motivated by instrument data capture, scientific data transformation and data-flow automation? Would you like to leverage your skills to boost traditional scientific research laboratories at Novo Nordisk?

Then join us in a newly established position as Data Engineer in Drug Product and Analytical Development. Apply now for a life-changing career!

The position
As a Data Engineer with a focus on software and cloud development, your primary responsibility will be to design and build innovative software solutions leveraging cloud capabilities and automated CI/CD pipelines. You will have the opportunity to explore new technologies and tools and play a key role in shaping the future alongside a diverse and dynamic team. The position offers significant flexibility for experimentation and a chance to have a direct impact on the future of scientific research laboratories in the CMC Drug Product & Analytical Development area.

You will be part of a young, dynamic team where we have fun and in your day-to-day work, you will work closely with not only your team members, but also with chemists, laboratory technicians, specialists etc. in the line of business. These are your customers, and you will have the privilege of developing software solutions that will make them more efficient in their day-to-day work going from paper to paperless laboratories.

Qualifications

You hold an academic degree in computer science, software engineering, information technology or other relevant field with relevant work experience in data engineering. We expect you to bring strong technical skills in back-end development. You have worked in a team before and appreciate delivering projects together with your colleagues, not been the only contributor to a code base and having delivered one or more products to production.

Ideally you also have:



Experience with one of the big cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP)
Proficiency in AWS services like Lambda, S3 and CloudWatch (or similar services in one of the other cloud providers)
Data modelling and schema design for relational databases
Expertise in ETL processes, orchestration, and data warehousing concepts
Python
Experience with API lead connectivity e.g. using MuleSoft
Experience with data storage solutions, such as delta lake and parquet
Experience with Databricks
Understanding of security and data governance best practices
Git
Proficiency in CI/CD tools such as ADO pipelines or GitHub actions




Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply – we value passion, potential, and the willingness to learn!

Additional skills we are looking for you to have or aspire to develop:



Write fit-for-purpose software while not compromising on quality
Adaptability to learn new technologies and comply with pharma methodologies and compliance requirements
Design for reliability, testability and mutability
Deep knowledge in a few areas but able to jump in where it’s needed
Innovative mindset
Agile mindset




On a personal level you have a detail-oriented mindset with profound documentation skills. You have the ability to influence, communicate, and collaborate across an organization and are able to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You enjoy building novel solutions for your costumers, like to drive decisions in your area of expertise, and take pride in helping your colleagues in a pulsing and dynamic environment. You enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility go hand in hand as well as working in a dynamic team environment.

About The Department

As part of the Novo Nordisk PSQIT organisation, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Control (CMC) Development & Scaling makes a real difference for patients with chronic diseases across the world. We develop, manufacture, and distribute drug candidates for clinical trials and have a strong culture with a “can do” mindset.

Drug Product & Analytical Development (DP & Ana Dev) is part of Novo Nordisk’s CMC Development and Scaling family and acts as a link between the research unit and the production, spanning from early development to phase 3 clinical trials and registration. Our ambition is to improve our patients lives by developing the world finest drug substance and injectable drug products.

The position is anchored in the team Data Applications & Support, where we focus on bridging life science research and computer science by developing, implementing and operating data and software applications. We support the line of business by enable them to work efficiently through automation of repetitive tasks and accompany the business in changing for the future through data empowerment and digitalization. The team consists of highly skilled subject matter experts with different backgrounds, ranging from formulation specialists and data scientists to software developers and data engineers.

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is its people. We know that life is anything but linear, and balancing what is important at different stages of our career is never easy. That’s why we make room for diverse life situations, always putting people first. We value our employees for the unique skills they bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk is working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it’s a collective effort. Novo Nordisk relies on the joint potential and collaboration of its more than 40,000 employees. Together, we go further. Together, we’re life changing.

Contact
For further information, please contact Martin Busch Neergaard at +45 30793041 (mobile) / mngd@novonordisk.com or Christian Kjølhede Hallgren at +45 29838575 (mobile) / chlg@novonordisk.com.

 

Deadline
22 January 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.
Show more
HTML:
Are you the Data Engineer that will help us expand our application platform in the future? Are you motivated by instrument data capture, scientific data transformation and data-flow automation? Would you like to leverage your skills to boost traditional scientific research laboratories at Novo Nordisk?

Then join us in a newly established position as Data Engineer in Drug Product and Analytical Development. Apply now for a life-changing career!

The position
As a Data Engineer with a focus on software and cloud development, your primary responsibility will be to design and build innovative software solutions leveraging cloud capabilities and automated CI/CD pipelines. You will have the opportunity to explore new technologies and tools and play a key role in shaping the future alongside a diverse and dynamic team. The position offers significant flexibility for experimentation and a chance to have a direct impact on the future of scientific research laboratories in the CMC Drug Product & Analytical Development area.

You will be part of a young, dynamic team where we have fun and in your day-to-day work, you will work closely with not only your team members, but also with chemists, laboratory technicians, specialists etc. in the line of business. These are your customers, and you will have the privilege of developing software solutions that will make them more efficient in their day-to-day work going from paper to paperless laboratories.

Qualifications

You hold an academic degree in computer science, software engineering, information technology or other relevant field with relevant work experience in data engineering. We expect you to bring strong technical skills in back-end development. You have worked in a team before and appreciate delivering projects together with your colleagues, not been the only contributor to a code base and having delivered one or more products to production.

Ideally you also have:


  • Experience with one of the big cloud providers (AWS, Azure or GCP)
  • Proficiency in AWS services like Lambda, S3 and CloudWatch (or similar services in one of the other cloud providers)
  • Data modelling and schema design for relational databases
  • Expertise in ETL processes, orchestration, and data warehousing concepts
  • Python
  • Experience with API lead connectivity e.g. using MuleSoft
  • Experience with data storage solutions, such as delta lake and parquet
  • Experience with Databricks
  • Understanding of security and data governance best practices
  • Git
  • Proficiency in CI/CD tools such as ADO pipelines or GitHub actions



Even if you don’t meet every requirement, we encourage you to apply – we value passion, potential, and the willingness to learn!

Additional skills we are looking for you to have or aspire to develop:


  • Write fit-for-purpose software while not compromising on quality
  • Adaptability to learn new technologies and comply with pharma methodologies and compliance requirements
  • Design for reliability, testability and mutability
  • Deep knowledge in a few areas but able to jump in where it’s needed
  • Innovative mindset
  • Agile mindset



On a personal level you have a detail-oriented mindset with profound documentation skills. You have the ability to influence, communicate, and collaborate across an organization and are able to communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. You enjoy building novel solutions for your costumers, like to drive decisions in your area of expertise, and take pride in helping your colleagues in a pulsing and dynamic environment. You enjoy working in an informal atmosphere where flexibility and responsibility go hand in hand as well as working in a dynamic team environment.

About The Department

As part of the Novo Nordisk PSQIT organisation, Chemistry, Manufacturing and Control (CMC) Development & Scaling makes a real difference for patients with chronic diseases across the world. We develop, manufacture, and distribute drug candidates for clinical trials and have a strong culture with a “can do” mindset.

Drug Product & Analytical Development (DP & Ana Dev) is part of Novo Nordisk’s CMC Development and Scaling family and acts as a link between the research unit and the production, spanning from early development to phase 3 clinical trials and registration. Our ambition is to improve our patients lives by developing the world finest drug substance and injectable drug products.

The position is anchored in the team Data Applications & Support, where we focus on bridging life science research and computer science by developing, implementing and operating data and software applications. We support the line of business by enable them to work efficiently through automation of repetitive tasks and accompany the business in changing for the future through data empowerment and digitalization. The team consists of highly skilled subject matter experts with different backgrounds, ranging from formulation specialists and data scientists to software developers and data engineers.

Working at Novo Nordisk
Novo Nordisk is its people. We know that life is anything but linear, and balancing what is important at different stages of our career is never easy. That’s why we make room for diverse life situations, always putting people first. We value our employees for the unique skills they bring to the table, and we work continuously to bring out the best in them. Working at Novo Nordisk is working toward something bigger than ourselves, and it’s a collective effort. Novo Nordisk relies on the joint potential and collaboration of its more than 40,000 employees. Together, we go further. Together, we’re life changing.

Contact
For further information, please contact Martin Busch Neergaard at +45 30793041 (mobile) / mngd@novonordisk.com or Christian Kjølhede Hallgren at +45 29838575 (mobile) / chlg@novonordisk.com.

 

Deadline
22 January 2025

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV. To ensure an efficient and fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your CV.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

We commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants.

At Novo Nordisk we recognize that it is no longer good enough to aspire to be the best company in the world. We need to aspire to be the best company for the world and we know that this is only possible with talented employees with diverse perspectives, backgrounds and cultures. We are therefore committed to creating an inclusive culture that celebrates the diversity of our employees, the patients we serve and communities we operate in. Together, we’re life changing.

Title: Experienced Data Analyst at Novo Nordisk Engineering
Place: Virum, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Experienced Data Analyst At Novo Nordisk Engineering

Does the idea of being the link between business requirements and needs towards IT data engineers excite you? And do you thrive on working with complex data structures? Then you’ll fit right in!

What do we do at NNE?

We are experts in end-to-end pharma engineering, and we design and build pharma facilities that are essential for millions of patients all over the world. Our success is built on our relationships, both with our colleagues and our customers. If you are passionate about working for a noble cause on projects shaping the future of sustainable and intelligent pharma facilities, NNE is the place to be.

About The Role

We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join our Engineering Systems department of 10 people. As a team, we are working on designing, developing, and deploying dashboards, giving our internal stakeholders the ability to get an overview of data and make a data-driven decision.

Why do we need you? Our goal is to be in the forefront and provide the business with timely data in dashboards so our projects can be executed even faster. Your role will be key in ensuring fast development of dashboards with a user-friendly design that matches the business need.

Location Virum Department Engineering Systems

Experience +5 years Employment Type Full Time

How You Might Spend Your Days

As a Data Analyst, you’ll be:


Analyzing and organizing data
Helping maintain data storage and data warehouses
Taking an active part in designing, developing, deploying dashboards for stakeholders that effectively communicate trends, patterns and predictions using data insights
The link between business requirements and needs towards IT data engineers
Proficiently communicating in both IT and business “language”



Who You Are

We care about who you are as a person. In the end, how you work, and your energy, is what impacts the results we achieve as a team. As a person, you are:


Able to combine your analytical skills with technical understanding
Interested in technology and are excellent in adapting to and utilizing new knowledge within the field
A good communicator who has consistently successful dialogues with stakeholders
Structured and focused on delivering a good product on time



The miles you’ve walked

In all positions there are some things that are needed, and others a bonus. We believe these qualifications are needed for you to do well in this role:


A bachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant field
At least 5 years of hands-on experience within MS Power Platform – with main focus on Power BI
Experience working with SQL and programming languages such as Python
Experience with ETL/ELT processes
You speak and write English fluently



If you do not check all the boxes, you are welcome to offer alternative experience that you think would be valuable in this role.

Why choose NNE?

We provide a range of perks and benefits tailored to enhance your overall experience. Some highlights include:


Vibrant and project-based work environment
Collaboration and innovation-based culture
True empowerment and flexible working conditions



Unleash your potential

NNE is short for Novo Nordisk Engineering. And for all of us who work here, NNE means so much more. We are the epitome of a people business and, as such, we are dedicated to continuously developing our people. We do not expect you to know it all, and we recognize that a great onboarding experience is key. We therefore greet new colleagues with our award-nominated onboarding program, and in-house talent programs designed to keep our biggest asset – you - developed for the long-run.

Did we spark your curiosity? If you’re ready to join our passion, let’s hear from you.

Deadline of application is January 26th, 2025.

Questions before applying? Please contact Senior Manager Maria Bang-Møller on +45 3075 7818.

At NNE, we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. To maintain fairness, we request that you refrain from including a photo in your CV.

Please note we only accept applications submitted through our online recruitment system.

You do not need to attach a cover letter to your application, but please include a few sentences about why you are applying in your resume or CV.

We will invite to interviews on a running basis.

To learn more about us visit www.nne.com

Title: IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Title: IT Analyst

Company: BluEdge

Max Price Rate: Open bid

Location: Copenhagen (DK)

Start Date: 06 Jan 2025

End Date (renewable): 28 Feb 2025

We are seeking an experienced IT analyst to join our Core Banking program team. The primary objective of the program is to transition from old local legacy systems to a unified Nordic core banking program and establish an Agreement Directory Service. We are currently looking for an Expert IT analyst to contribute to the team responsible for building the Common Booking Component. The ideal candidate will be responsible for gathering requirements from business stakeholders and translating them into features and user stories. They should be capable of independently driving the entire process from requirement collection to documentation and handover to developers. The role requires the ability to operate in a complex environment with multiple stakeholders and dependencies. Familiarity with tasks such as data mapping and data governance is essential.

Requirements


Professional knowledge of data mapping and data governance is required.
Experience in the banking sector, preferably within a larger bank, is essential.
Extensive knowledge in the accounting area is necessary.
Substantial experience as a senior Business analyst and/or senior IT analyst is required.
Prior experience in a larger program with approximately 300+ employees is preferred.
Previous work experience in a Nordic bank is advantageous.


Required skills:


IT Governance
Business Analyst
Mapping


Languages:


English (Proficient)

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you ready for a new beginning?

We need your talent, knowledge and dedication to better our world with biology.

Our purpose points the way

In Novonesis, we know that solutions rooted in biology can help solve humanity’s biggest challenges. Since we began more than a century ago, this has been our guide. It’s how we've gotten so far. And it’s how we'll impact the future. Now, more than ever, the world needs change. And with biosolutions, the possibilities for transformation are endless.

We’re here to better our world with biology.

The Data Engineer will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and optimizing our data infrastructure. The data engineer will work closely with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to ensure that data is accessible, reliable, and ready for analysis. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, excellent problem-solving skills, and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.

In This Role You’ll Make An Impact By


Developing and maintaining our Data Science Platform
Building and maintaining data ingestion pipelines using Python and Airflow to ensure high data quality and timely delivery
Writing and maintaining documentation and make it available to relevant stakeholders
Automating software deployment and monitoring using tools like Ansible and Grafana


Potentially Relevant Experience


A degree in IT, computer science or equivalent experience
Hands on experience with development and operations of software systems in a Linux environment
Strong experience with Python and SQL
Comfort working from command line interfaces and with automation technologies like Ansible
Fluency in spoken and written English
Experience in the field of biology is a plus, but not a requirement


Location: Lyngby, Denmark

Application deadline: 19-01-2025

Contact details: Vignir Isberg, Senior Department Manager, vis@novonesis.com

Could our purpose be yours? Then apply today!

At Novonesis we commit to an inclusive recruitment process and equality of opportunity for all our job applicants. We recommend you not to attach a cover letter to your application. Instead, please include a few sentences in your resume/CV about why you are applying. To ensure a fair recruitment process, please refrain from adding a photo in your resume/CV.

Novonesis is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. All employment decisions are based on business needs without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability, or veteran status.

Want to learn more?

Learn more about Novonesis, our purpose, and your career opportunities at novonesis.com

Not the right fit for you?

Even if this job isn't the right fit for you, perhaps you know someone who might find it interesting. If so, please feel free to share the job link and encourage them to apply. Thank you for your referral! Please check out our other open positions. The right fit for you could just be a few clicks away.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Do ETL processes, workflow automation, and data transformation excite you? Are you ready to grow your career in Data Engineering and help shape the future of the automotive industry? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you to join our team as a Data Engineer.




We are a high-growth SaaS and analytics company that works predominantly in the automotive industry, where we bridge the gap between data and insights, providing our clients with the necessary tools and intelligence to make informed decisions and optimize their operations. We build automations and utilize prediction models for our prestigious clients so they can take action on data. We work with the biggest clients in the industry such as Audi, VW, Porsche, SKODA, Seat, Peugeot, Opel, Suzuki, KIA and Citroën.

We are looking to hire a full-time Data Engineer to join our growth journey and help us to continue to deliver outstanding products and services to our customers.




The Position

As a Data Engineer at ag analytics, you will be able to leverage your analytic skills to gain insights from a diverse range of data sources. You will be working in our Data Science department, where your main tasks will include:

· Building, maintaining, and optimizing ETL workflows using tools such as Apache Airflow.

· Developing R and Python scripts for data processing and analysis.

· Automating data workflows and ensuring efficient execution.

· Integrating APIs to enhance data accessibility.

· Ensuring data quality through robust testing and validation of workflows.

· Collaborating with cross-functional teams to support analytics and reporting needs.




With exposure to a wide range of technologies, you will have the chance to expand your knowledge and develop your career in a dynamic and challenging environment.




About You

You have a background in data science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, computer science, or other relevant scientific education. You have practical experience working with R and Python and are curious to know more and develop your skills within both Data Science and Data Engineering.

At ag analytics, we believe that passion is the key to success. We are not just looking for individuals with a specific set of hard skills; rather, we are seeking individuals who are truly passionate about data analytics, technology, and making a difference in the world. We believe that with the right mindset and drive, skills can be developed and honed over time. Our clients expect the best from us, so we expect you to be a self-starter, take responsibility, and keep deadlines. You take ownership of your tasks, you are curious and willing to learn and improve. You work in a structured manner, have an eye for detail and ensure we always deliver the highest quality.




Skills and Qualifications

· Experience in building ETL pipelines and workflow automation.

· Good knowledge of programming languages such as R and Python.

· 2-4 years of practical experience.

· Highly structured and committed to delivering reliable, high-quality solutions.

· Good verbal and written English skills.

· Enjoys working on dynamic and diverse data projects.




Nice-to-Have

· Experience working in a Scrum environment.

· Practical experience with Apache Airflow.




About Us

ag analytics is a highly international scale-up with a team of over 40 who are passionate about predictive data analytics. Our offices are on Højbro Plads in the tech start-up community Matrikel 1. We are highly focused on delivering best-in-class solutions to our customers while learning and developing at the same time. We have an informal and relaxed team atmosphere with team events, breakfasts and Friday bars. You can read more about us here www.aganalytics.dk




Please note: this is not a remote role, you will be working in our Copenhagen office.




How to apply

Please apply using the ‘apply’ button, we do not accept applications via email. We interview on an ongoing basis so please apply as soon as possible. We expect to begin responding to the applications at the beginning of January 2025.




If you have any questions about the role, please contact our Head of Engineering, Jan Vittrup Hansen at jvt@aganalytics.dk




We look forward to hearing from you.

Show more

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
About us

At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year’s Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. We recently launched Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.




Join RavenPack:

RavenPack is searching for a Quantitative Researcher / Data Scientist to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters. The role is based in Marbella. We offer a relocation package, competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.

As a Quant Researcher, you will be participating in the development of new agentic workflows utilizing our semantic search engine, showcasing the value of our RavenPack data for excavating insights.

The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must.

European legal working status is required.

We offer competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.




Your Responsibilities:

As a Quant Researcher, you will join the “Quantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) Team,” consisting of four quant researchers dedicated to feature engineering and developing systematic trading strategies. Your work will primarily involve data-driven research. You will create research workflows to enhance RavenPack’s reputation as a thought leader in the alternative data industry and present systematic workflows to conduct fundamental analysis. You will work jointly with the Head of QIS on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:

Understanding accurately the fundamental implications of a topic on the macro and microeconomy.
Developing chain-of-thought agents to mimic a human professional analyst using our data, while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.
Offering data-driven insights, engaging in research discussions, and presenting features to leading financial analysts, quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.
Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.




What We're Looking For:

A MSc in Data Analysis, Quantitative Finance, or Economics.
2+ years of relevant work experience as a data scientist or quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering.
Outstanding analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to conduct fundamental analysis in a systematic and quantitative way.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python, and in at least Dash, StreamLit, or RepLit web applications.
Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in language models is highly advantageous.




What's in it for you?

You will work with the latest technologies.
Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Following the onboarding period, we offer a hybrid work model, allowing for up to 2 days remote per week.
Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, Riviera and Estepona.
You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Show more
HTML:
About us

At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year’s Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. We recently launched Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.


Join RavenPack:

RavenPack is searching for a Quantitative Researcher / Data Scientist to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters. The role is based in Marbella. We offer a relocation package, competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.

As a Quant Researcher, you will be participating in the development of new agentic workflows utilizing our semantic search engine, showcasing the value of our RavenPack data for excavating insights.

The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must.

European legal working status is required.

We offer competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.


Your Responsibilities:

As a Quant Researcher, you will join the “Quantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) Team,” consisting of four quant researchers dedicated to feature engineering and developing systematic trading strategies. Your work will primarily involve data-driven research. You will create research workflows to enhance RavenPack’s reputation as a thought leader in the alternative data industry and present systematic workflows to conduct fundamental analysis. You will work jointly with the Head of QIS on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:

  • Understanding accurately the fundamental implications of a topic on the macro and microeconomy.
  • Developing chain-of-thought agents to mimic a human professional analyst using our data, while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.
  • Offering data-driven insights, engaging in research discussions, and presenting features to leading financial analysts, quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.
  • Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.


What We're Looking For:

  • A MSc in Data Analysis, Quantitative Finance, or Economics.
  • 2+ years of relevant work experience as a data scientist or quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering.
  • Outstanding analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to conduct fundamental analysis in a systematic and quantitative way.
  • Demonstrated proficiency in Python, and in at least Dash, StreamLit, or RepLit web applications.
  • Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in language models is highly advantageous.


What's in it for you?

  • You will work with the latest technologies.
  • Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Following the onboarding period, we offer a hybrid work model, allowing for up to 2 days remote per week.
  • Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, Riviera and Estepona.
  • You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
  • You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
  • As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
  • Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)


We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Senior Data Engineer (Advanced Audience Modelling)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a cutting-edge thinker with a passion for leveraging the latest in strongly typed data pipelines, AI-powered anomaly detection and cloud-first compute systems? Do you want to join an existing, high-output team of academic and professional experts to tackle some of the most complex challenges in advertising? If so, we’d love to meet you.




Our team is embarking on a highly strategic project at the intersection of data science, advertising technology, and audience insights, with a focus on privacy-friendly predictive modelling for audience segmentation and targeting. The system you'll be designing will support 1/3rd of the world's ad campaigns, so the scope is huge, and the success of our team depends on our ability in the near term to demonstrate to key stakeholders the superiority of our system, and then follow up on that promise in the mid-long term.




What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with a high-performing team to explore, design, and implement proprietary models based on contemporary research papers. Your role will have a focus on designing and building out the supporting data pipelines and cloud infrastructure.
Implement AI-powered anomaly detection frameworks to help us discover signal loss of data degradation in our pipelines.
Explore advanced audience segmentation strategies using massive, multi-dimensional data sets spanning behavioural, social, and content engagement patterns.
Leverage your expertise in and experience with well-architected distributed compute systems and integrated ML solutions to accelerate our journey towards a privacy-first future for the ad tech industry.
Work on the full software engineering lifecycle, from first design to initial implementation, to maintenance of stable products everyone relies on.




WhoYou Are:

You have a strong academic background (PhD or Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Data Science, or a related field).
You’re passionate about solving real-world problems with advanced models and scalable architecture.
Proven experience in at least one strongly typed language such as Scala, Rust, Go or similar
You have a track record of delivering end-to-end software engineering projects and deploying them at scale, with a focus on measurable results.
A strong communicator who thrives in collaborative environments and is eager to learn from and mentor others.
You know how to land on your feet when priorities change. You want to work in a high-throughput environment.




Bonus Points:

If you have experience with multiple programming languages and particularly functional programming languages
If you have contributed to one or more open-source projects




Why Join Us?

Be a key player in shaping the future of privacy-first advertising and audience modelling using cutting-edge AI techniques and highly performant computing systems.
Join an elite team where your research and technical contributions will have a direct impact on strategic outcomes. Work with massive, industry-scale data sets and the latest machine learning techniques.
Growth opportunities; collaborate with leading minds in the field, present your work at major industry conferences, and push the boundaries of applied machine learning.




If you’re ready to innovate and collaborate on high-stakes projects with real-world impact, apply now to join my team and help us redefine the future of audience modelling.

Show more

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Show more

Title: Business Analytics Consultant – med sans for økonomistyring
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
twoday er den førende digitale transformationspartner i Nordeuropa med en global tilstedeværelse. Med cirka 3.000 teknologer samarbejder vi med de mest beundrede private og offentlige organisationer for at levere banebrydende digitale løsninger. Vores dybe brancheekspertise omfatter Data & AI, softwareudvikling, digitale oplevelser og forretningsapplikationer. Vores team, der opererer i hele Norden og Litauen, genererede en omsætning på 280 millioner euro i 2023. Vi betjener over 8.000 kunder og understøtter deres digitale transformationsrejser.

Har du opnået den første erfaring med økonomistyring, men ønsker at booste dine kompetencer på datadrevne, automatiserede og tidssvarende styringskoncepter?

Vil du hjælpe nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder med at blive bedre til at planlægge og styre deres forretning ved hjælp af økonomistyringsløsninger? Bliv en del af en af Danmarks førende data- og AI-huse, som arbejder med nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder. Vi har vokseværk på alle vores fire kontorer, og vi søger derfor flere kollegaer til at udvikle de bedste økonomistyringsløsninger.

Kan du se dig selv her?

Du bliver en del af vores Digital Strategy-team, som bl.a. udvikler effektive løsninger til finansiel konsolidering, budgettering, forecasting, performance management og omkostningsallokering.

Vi er et uformelt team af konsulenter, som stiler efter høj kvalitet og integritet, samtidig med, at vi lægger vægt på at have det sjovt i hverdagen.

Vores løsninger udvikles i tæt samarbejde med kunden og er typisk forankret i økonomifunktionen, men de rækker ud til både salg , marketing, produktion og distribution, så vi sikrer sammenhæng og gennemsigtighed i processer og data.

Vi tror på, at vores kollektive viden gør teamet dygtigere og bidrager til bedre løsninger for kunderne. Desuden indgår vi i et større hold, som har fokus på andre analytiske discipliner, så der er mange dygtige kollegaer at trække på og sparre med.

Og kan du sætte flueben her?


Har en økonomisk baggrund og har siddet i en økonomifunktion som controller med berøringsflader til den øvrige del af forretningen. Alternativ har du en baggrund som revisor eller har anden relevant konsulenterfaring.
Har kendskab til økonomistyring og en bred vifte af forskellige forretningsprocesser og interessenter. Erfaring med konsolidering er et plus.
Har udviklet og drevet Excel-baserede løsninger (eller andre værktøjer) og oplevet fordelene og ulemperne på egen krop. Du ved, hvor tingene med fordel kan gøres bedre og mere robuste, f.eks. i forhold til dataindsamling og versionering.
Har både et teknisk gen og en glæde ved omgang med kolleger og (interne) kunder.
Din erfaring er et afsæt til relevant rådgivning for kunden omkring både processer og en understøttende teknisk løsning.
Du får energi af vekselvirkningen mellem samvær og sparring med kollegaer og kunder og den selvstændige indsats på kontoret.
Du vil prøve kræfter med konsulentverdenen, hvor du får mulighed for at løse forskellige problemstillinger for mange interessante og forskellige kunder sammen med dine dygtige kolleger.
Som person får du ultimativ jobglæde, når du i samarbejde med kolleger finder frem til de bedste løsninger for kunden. Du har en praktisk tilgang til at løse opgaverne og et stålsat fokus på at skabe værdi for kunden i praksis.


Vores løsninger er ofte integreret med kundernes øvrige løsninger og baserer sig på Jedox, og vi har ofte et Microsoft-baseret Data Warehouse i ryggen samt/eller Microsoft Power BI som rapporteringsværktøj.

Det er ikke en forudsætning, at du har erfaring med disse værktøjer, da vi sørger for den nødvendige tekniske oplæring.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

twoday er placeret i moderne lokaler på 30 steder i Norge, Sverige, Danmark, Finland og Litauen. Vi har et stærkt og unikt socialt miljø med højt engagerede medarbejdere. Hvis du er den kandidat, vi leder efter, vil du få en central rolle med spændende muligheder for at udvikle dig i en international og innovativ gruppe, med spændende produkter og tjenester inden for teknologi og software. Du vil også have fleksibiliteten til at "jumpe" og arbejde fra et af vores hovedkontorer i Oslo, Stockholm, København, Helsinki eller Vilnius til tider.

Diversitet og inklusion

Opfylder du ikke alle kravene? Studier har vist, at kvinder og andre minoriteter er mindre tilbøjelige til at ansøge om et job, hvis de ikke opfylder alle krav i et jobopslag. Hos twoday er vi dedikerede til at opbygge en arbejdsplads og et fællesskab, hvor alle er velkomne. Hvis du er begejstret for denne rolle, men din tidligere erfaring ikke præcist matcher jobbeskrivelsen, opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at ansøge.

Er du interesseret?

Så send din ansøgning i dag, de vil løbende blive læst.

Der vil løbende blive indkaldt til indledende samtaler. Du ansøger ved at klikke på knappen nedenfor.  Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er Ann Brahe-Orlandi, Talent Acquisition Manager, klar til at hjælpe. Hun glæder sig til at høre fra dig på ann.brahe-orlandi@twoday.com.
Show more

Med cirka 3.000 teknologer samarbejder vi med de mest beundrede private og offentlige organisationer for at levere banebrydende digitale løsninger. Vores dybe brancheekspertise omfatter Data & AI, softwareudvikling, digitale oplevelser og forretningsapplikationer. Vores team, der opererer i hele Norden og Litauen, genererede en omsætning på 280 millioner euro i 2023. Vi betjener over 8.000 kunder og understøtter deres digitale transformationsrejser.

Har du opnået den første erfaring med økonomistyring, men ønsker at booste dine kompetencer på datadrevne, automatiserede og tidssvarende styringskoncepter?

Vil du hjælpe nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder med at blive bedre til at planlægge og styre deres forretning ved hjælp af økonomistyringsløsninger? Bliv en del af en af Danmarks førende data- og AI-huse, som arbejder med nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder. Vi har vokseværk på alle vores fire kontorer, og vi søger derfor flere kollegaer til at udvikle de bedste økonomistyringsløsninger.

Kan du se dig selv her?

Du bliver en del af vores Digital Strategy-team, som bl.a. udvikler effektive løsninger til finansiel konsolidering, budgettering, forecasting, performance management og omkostningsallokering.

Vi er et uformelt team af konsulenter, som stiler efter høj kvalitet og integritet, samtidig med, at vi lægger vægt på at have det sjovt i hverdagen.

Vores løsninger udvikles i tæt samarbejde med kunden og er typisk forankret i økonomifunktionen, men de rækker ud til både salg , marketing, produktion og distribution, så vi sikrer sammenhæng og gennemsigtighed i processer og data.

Vi tror på, at vores kollektive viden gør teamet dygtigere og bidrager til bedre løsninger for kunderne. Desuden indgår vi i et større hold, som har fokus på andre analytiske discipliner, så der er mange dygtige kollegaer at trække på og sparre med.

Og kan du sætte flueben her?

  • Har en økonomisk baggrund og har siddet i en økonomifunktion som controller med berøringsflader til den øvrige del af forretningen. Alternativ har du en baggrund som revisor eller har anden relevant konsulenterfaring.
  • Har kendskab til økonomistyring og en bred vifte af forskellige forretningsprocesser og interessenter. Erfaring med konsolidering er et plus.
  • Har udviklet og drevet Excel-baserede løsninger (eller andre værktøjer) og oplevet fordelene og ulemperne på egen krop. Du ved, hvor tingene med fordel kan gøres bedre og mere robuste, f.eks. i forhold til dataindsamling og versionering.
  • Har både et teknisk gen og en glæde ved omgang med kolleger og (interne) kunder.
  • Din erfaring er et afsæt til relevant rådgivning for kunden omkring både processer og en understøttende teknisk løsning.
  • Du får energi af vekselvirkningen mellem samvær og sparring med kollegaer og kunder og den selvstændige indsats på kontoret.
  • Du vil prøve kræfter med konsulentverdenen, hvor du får mulighed for at løse forskellige problemstillinger for mange interessante og forskellige kunder sammen med dine dygtige kolleger.
  • Som person får du ultimativ jobglæde, når du i samarbejde med kolleger finder frem til de bedste løsninger for kunden. Du har en praktisk tilgang til at løse opgaverne og et stålsat fokus på at skabe værdi for kunden i praksis.

Vores løsninger er ofte integreret med kundernes øvrige løsninger og baserer sig på Jedox, og vi har ofte et Microsoft-baseret Data Warehouse i ryggen samt/eller Microsoft Power BI som rapporteringsværktøj.

Det er ikke en forudsætning, at du har erfaring med disse værktøjer, da vi sørger for den nødvendige tekniske oplæring.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

twoday er placeret i moderne lokaler på 30 steder i Norge, Sverige, Danmark, Finland og Litauen. Vi har et stærkt og unikt socialt miljø med højt engagerede medarbejdere. Hvis du er den kandidat, vi leder efter, vil du få en central rolle med spændende muligheder for at udvikle dig i en international og innovativ gruppe, med spændende produkter og tjenester inden for teknologi og software. Du vil også have fleksibiliteten til at "jumpe" og arbejde fra et af vores hovedkontorer i Oslo, Stockholm, København, Helsinki eller Vilnius til tider.

Diversitet og inklusion

Opfylder du ikke alle kravene? Studier har vist, at kvinder og andre minoriteter er mindre tilbøjelige til at ansøge om et job, hvis de ikke opfylder alle krav i et jobopslag. Hos twoday er vi dedikerede til at opbygge en arbejdsplads og et fællesskab, hvor alle er velkomne. Hvis du er begejstret for denne rolle, men din tidligere erfaring ikke præcist matcher jobbeskrivelsen, opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at ansøge.

Er du interesseret?

Så send din ansøgning i dag, de vil løbende blive læst.

Der vil løbende blive indkaldt til indledende samtaler. Du ansøger ved at klikke på knappen nedenfor.  Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er Ann Brahe-Orlandi, Talent Acquisition Manager, klar til at hjælpe. Hun glæder sig til at høre fra dig på ann.brahe-orlandi@twoday.com.

Title: Senior Insights & Analytics Analyst, Marketing Mix Modelling - Aarhus
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK

Do you know how to turn raw data via modelling into purified insights that makes a big commercial difference? And would you like to be part of our expanded modelling function? Then you might be our new Senior Analyst we are looking for in Global Media & Agency Management in Arla Foods.

How You Will Make An Impact

Your primary role will be to continuously support business objectives and improve our media and thereby commercial performance.

Your key areas of responsibilities will be


Drive and support media ROI agenda in Arla Foods with the rest of the modelling team primarily via use of insourced media modelling software solution
Build/maintain a strong stakeholder relationship (both internally in Arla Foods and externally towards key partners) to ensure modelling results are understood and learnings are widely executed.


In short, you’ll play a key role in bringing data and insights to the forefront of everything we do in Global Media & Agency Management. More specifically, your tasks will be


Conduct econometric/marketing mix modelling across markets, categories and brands and sup-port execution of media learnings. Deliver learnings on optimal budget allocation across touch-points, timing and weighting + to some extend input on creative quality (in regard to sales stimulation)
Drive portfolio media budget allocation projects pr. markets. Deliver learnings on how to optimize budget allocation across brands and categories in a given market
Co-drive global media budget allocation project - deliver learnings on optimal total media budget allocation across markets, categories and brands
Supply input to specific media/budget plans and overall media/budgeting guidelines
Support overall Marketing ROI agenda in Arla Foods
Drive agenda of putting data and analyses first to gain maximal value of all media initiatives.


What Will Make You Successful

You are data-driven by heart and passionate about the opportunities to covert data into commercial value.

You have a degree in marketing, math, IT, computer science, business intelligence or similar and proven experience working with data mining and statistics. Further you have


Highly developed analytical skills
Strong stakeholder relation building skills
Great communication, presentation and project management skills
Preferably media knowledge/experience – could be from an agency
Strong English skills – verbally and in writing.


What do we offer?

You will be part of Global Media & Agency management where we in a dynamic and collaborate way focus on optimizing marketing/media effectiveness and efficiencies. Our department is part of Global Insights & Analytics and the position is placed in Arla Foods global HQ in Viby, Denmark.

We’re committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. And you’ll join a market leader who produces nutritious household favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.

Would you like to join us?

If you want to be part of something special and help shape the industry, then seize this exciting opportunity at Arla. Please apply as soon as possible. We will invite for interviews on a continuous basis. For additional information, please call Head of Global Media & Agency Management, Jan Worre, on +45 8733 2822.

We have a purpose for Good

At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?

BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this link.

Ref.96972
