Title: Senior Data Analyst (Senior Foundations Analyst)
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
At Too Good To Go, we have an ambitious goal: to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together.

40% of all food produced in the world is wasted. And that has a huge impact on the health of our planet, with 10% of greenhouse gas emissions coming from food waste.

We’re more than an app: we are a certified B Corporation with a mission to empower everyone to take action against food waste, so alongside our marketplace app, we create educational tools, explore new business solutions - such as our Retail Technologies offering, and influence legislation to help reduce food waste.

We’re growing fast: Our community of 108 million registered users and 245,000 active partners across 19 countries, have together already prevented 395+ million meals from going to waste - avoiding over 1066.000 tonnes of CO2e!

Your mission

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (called "Senior Foundations Analyst" internally) to strengthen our use of data to inform our most business critical decisions. On a daily basis, you will be working with business leaders across various functional areas to inform how they measure success, how they use data to inform strategic decisions, and ensure they have the data visibility and tools they need to make progress on those strategies every day.

Your role


Support business leaders in identifying the right KPIs to drive business performance
Provide data-driven guidance to business leaders on key strategic decisions
Design and deliver self-service tools to various functional groups for operational excellence
Generate new ideas for how to leverage the data we have to drive business performance
Elevate data literacy across the organisation, with an eye toward consistency, ease of understanding, and educating on the right way to use data in each function
Elevate the Global Analytics team by sharing best practices and learnings and offering ad-hoc guidance to other team members on their projects


Requirements


You have previous experience in analytical roles overtime
You are strongly proficient in Looker
You are strongly proficient in SQL
You have a breadth of experience mapping business questions to data problems
You are a great communicator and storyteller - someone who enjoys helping non-technical audiences see what you see in the numbers!
You are driven by the “why” behind the work that you do, always eager to ask an extra question to make sure you’re solving for the right thing
You have experience managing multiple projects
You are passionate about data literacy
You have a proactive mindset and work well in a team environment


Our values


We win together: Food waste is a big beast to fight. We believe in a #oneteam.
We raise the bar: We always push for more. We work smart, smash barriers and elevate one another.
We keep it simple: Our ambitions are bold but our solutions are simple.
We build a legacy: We’re proud of the change we’re driving.
We care: We always look out for each other. Caring is also about the way we do business. We do the right thing.


What We Have To Offer


An opportunity to work in a global social-impact company and certified B Corporation! where you can see a real and tangible impact in your role.
To be an integral part of our Data & Analytics team. We are eager for you to make an impact and contribute to the role of analytics across key decisions and our solution processes. Your insights are valuable, and we are here to listen.
Work-life balance is important to us! Focus on the job to be done, not the hours spent, there is no need for overtime.
We trust in our employees and encourage an autonomous environment that provides several opportunities for employees to contribute, develop and take ownership of their work in a way that works for them.
To be part of an international company, with over 1,300+ colleagues across 19 countries that are on the same important mission.
An informal environment, working alongside 170+ passionate people within Tech & Product
We celebrate our differences and our successes and have a strong values-driven team culture.
We work in a hybrid set-up and value in office work weekly.
We may be able to support you with a working visa in Copenhagen, please be prepared to discuss this topic further as your first stage interview.


How To Apply


We take recruitment very seriously, so please carefully read everything we have written above. Please also check our website and international media in order to get a good overview of Too Good To Go.
Submit your CV and Cover letter in English.
Please note that we only accept applications coming through our platform. No CV or Cover Letter will be accepted by email or LinkedIn direct messaging.


Job Ref

A Movement for Everyone

We want to inspire and empower everyone to fight food waste together. With that mission, it’s only natural that we want to build a diverse and inclusive team of highly capable individuals who are passionate about doing things in a better way. We strongly believe we all excel and are more creative when we’re allowed to be ourselves, and we’re committed to a culture where all of us belong.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need. If you need reasonable accommodation at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.


Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you passionate about data and analytics, and eager to drive business value through actionable insights? Do you thrive in dynamic environments and love turning complex data into clear, impactful solutions?




We’re looking for an exceptional Data Scientist to join the team in Copenhagen for a 12 month period. You will play a pivotal role in our Customer Insights initiatives, helping us understand customer behaviors and enhance decision-making across the organization.




Would you like to…




Lead and steer data tracks of projects, conducting exploratory data analysis (EDA) to uncover trends and insights within large datasets
Develop and maintain AI-driven codebases, including predictive models, classification algorithms, and clustering techniques
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to seamlessly integrate AI and data science solutions into business operations
Provide BI expertise by creating and maintaining dashboards using tools like PowerBI
Translate complex data findings into clear, concise, and actionable insights for stakeholders at all levels of the organization
Develop and implement data models to support business intelligence and reporting initiatives




We would like you to be…




Highly proficient in SQL and PySpark, with experience in data modeling for business intelligence
Experienced in traditional Machine Learning projects, including predictive modeling, classification, and clustering
Skilled in Python for data analytics, with the ability to implement and optimize models
Hands-on with Databricks or Dremio for large-scale data processing and analysis
Strong in data visualization, particularly with PowerBI or similar dashboarding tools
Familiar with Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts and their application in customer insights (a plus)




Would you like to join…




A team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning
An environment where your insights directly impact business decisions and customer satisfaction
A culture that encourages innovation and the sharing of ideas




Please note Designit can only consider applicants with the right to work in Denmark.

Show more

Title: Data Center Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are seeking a skilled individual to take on a pivotal role in overseeing and improving Data Centre facilities across Kalundborg, Funen, and Zealand (minimum onsite requirement of 2-3 days per week).




6 month Contracts

Travel in Denmark is a must (Kalundborg, Funen, and Zealand)




Define, establish, and operate IT Data Centre facilities, including MDF/IDFs.
Coordinate maintenance and operations by working closely with contractors and vendors, such as electricians and cooling technicians.
Ensure new and existing Data Centre and Patch Room facilities align with established standards and best practices.
Oversee infrastructure lifecycle management and play a key role in managing major incidents affecting IT and business continuity.

Key Skills and Experience

Proven expertise in Data Centre Management, particularly in large organizations.
Strong vendor management and coordination capabilities.
In-depth knowledge of IT infrastructure, service management, and IT processes.
Familiarity with ITIL frameworks (certification preferred).
Experience working on large-scale IT projects and supporting technical architectures.
Understanding of pharmaceutical processes is an advantage.

  • Define, establish, and operate IT Data Centre facilities, including MDF/IDFs.

  • Experience working on large-scale IT projects and supporting technical architectures.

Title: Register in our candidate data base
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Veo is a global leader in AI-based sports camera technology. Our innovative, fully automatic camera solution enables sports teams to record matches and training sessions without a camera operator. We’re democratizing the world of sports by granting video analysis for teams on all levels—a privilege that used to be only for the few. More than 40,000 clubs in 90+ countries record their games every week.

Growing as fast as we do in Veo means that every day is different, exciting, and challenging, both on the front line and in the back office.

But that’s not the most remarkable thing about us.

The coolest thing is our people. We’ve attracted some of the brightest minds in the industry. They are the reason we can create a great product and do it while enjoying ourselves.

Does your dream job at Veo not appear on the list, then sign up in our candidate data base and we will get in contact with you if the right opportunity arises for you.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.

At Veo, you'll be part of a thriving work environment where every day brings new excitement. Our rapid growth ensures a diverse and ever-changing atmosphere. We believe in work-life balance and providing a positive culture that allows you to thrive personally and professionally.

Our Copenhagen office mirrors our innovative technology – with an indoor ball court, rooftop terrace, and well-equipped gym. We have created a facility that supports connecting disciplines across the business, facilitates creative thinking, and gives the space to engage with colleagues, our global partners, and the entire Veo community.

Diversity and differences are valuable assets for us. We value diversity and inclusion and welcome people from all backgrounds. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we still encourage you to apply.

We’re committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. And you may be just the right candidate for this or other roles.

Still interested? Join us at Veo and become a part of a team that delivers greatness and has a great time doing it.

We will invite for interviews continuously, so apply with LinkedIn or your resume as soon as possible.

Title: Power BI Analyst and Developer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Description

Why join us in 2024?

Think of the digital tools we use daily - from virtual shopping to contactless payments. They're shaping our future. Join us to influence the future of digital banking in an innovative environment. With our global merger, the opportunities for personal growth and collaboration are immense.

Role

If you join us in the role of Power BI Analyst & Developer, this is what you can expect from us:


Attractive salary and an overall competitive package
Well-structured training for the job and constant support from your manager
Hybrid way of working
Flexible work hours
Home equipment allowance
Equipment needed for the role (laptop and mobile phone, including monthly mobile phone subscription)
Private health insurance
Healthcare cost reimbursements
Sponsored sports activities
Voluntary pension fund (company-sponsored retirement plan or pension)
Referral bonuses for recommending new team members to join the company


About Your Future Role

If you join us in the role of Power BI Analyst and Developer, you will become a part of a team Self-Service BI team in Data Insights & Analytics responsible for building and maintaining self-service portal for our stakeholders to access and work with their data, reports and dashboards. You will never be alone and always have a lot of knowledgeable colleagues to support your journey.

We will be a team of 9 colleagues when you join in the Denmark Self-Service BI team with the team spread across multiple geographies - Norway, France ,Denmark, Germany & India.

Your reference line Manager will be Self-Service BI Manager Arjun Sagena, who will support your learning journey.

Your Key Responsibilities In This Role Will Be


Building full-fledged operational solutions, including building data models, reporting and dashboard solutions
Support delivery of data visualizations and insights to our customers and internal stakeholders via accessible, creative, and engaging data visualization and storytelling.
Maintaining and further developing data/reporting solutions by creating data sets to power critical dashboards
Usage of agile principles and methods according to SAFe (Portfolio configuration)


What makes you the best person for this job?

As you read about the role, are you eager to learn more? If so, review the qualifications that fit you for the position. Remember, beyond your skills and experience, it's your potential that sets you up for success in your daily tasks.

Qualifications Needed To Be Successful In This Role


You have professional data visualization and storytelling skills, are proficient in modern data visualization tools, and can communicate and present clearly
You are an expert in Microsoft Power BI with 5+ years of hands-on experience developing Reporting and Dashboard solutions in the field of Business Intelligence.
Proven experience with SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) and in building and managing tabular models.
Proficiency in using Tabular Editor for managing and optimizing tabular models.
Methodological knowledge in the field of data warehousing and data modelling
Strong SQL skills and experience working with RDBMS like Oracle, SQL Server, etc
Familiarity with SQL Server Management Studio (SSMS) and Visual Studio for database and application development.
It would also be beneficial if you have experience with the below technologies, tools and domain:
Power BI Embed: Knowledge and experience with Power BI Embedded for integrating analytics into applications.
Power Apps: Familiarity with Power Apps for building custom business applications.
Power Automate: Understanding of Power Automate for automating workflows and business processes.
Paginated Reports: Demonstrated ability to create and manage paginated reports.
Version Control: Experience with GitHub and version control practices for managing and tracking changes in code and project files.
Exposure to Payment industry – especially Issuing, Account/Card Management
High commitment, self-organization, and ability to work in a team
Enjoy friendly cooperation, exchange of knowledge and experience
Furthermore, that you have a solution-oriented and analytical mindset, and you thrive working with complex end-to-end solutions and processes
Strong in the English language verbally and in written topped with great communication skills

Apply now!

If this opportunity resonates with you, we'd love to hear from you!

Please apply at your earliest convenience. We'll be reviewing applications continuously and closing the position once we've found the right fit. We are committed to creating a diverse culture where talents from all walks of life can feel like they truly belong.

By exploring this job opening, you're one step closer to joining us. We're excited to learn more about you!

Responsibilities

QUALIFICATIONS

About Us

Are you interested in joining one of Europe's leading PayTech companies? Do you want to be part of a diverse team, collaborating with colleagues from across Europe? If so, you're in the right place!

About The Team

We are the result of merging Nexi, Nets, and Sia, with a presence in over 25 countries. With over 80 years of experience, we offer plenty of opportunities for personal and professional growth

At Nexi, we learn, adapt, and think like entrepreneurs. Discover more about our culture by visiting this page: https://www.nexigroup.com/en/people/life-at-nexi/overview/?utm_source=career-platform&utm_medium=job-openings&utm_content=about-the-team
Show more

Title: Bi & Data Analyst til afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Motiveres du af udvikling, store datamængder og analyser, der skaber reel værdi? Vil du arbejde med data fra kildesystemerne helt ud til brugerne? Hvis ja, tilbyder vi dig muligheden for at blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk fællesskab, hvor lysten til udvikling og optimering er essentielt, og hvor vi sammen bygger fremtidens løsninger.




Rollen og hvad du kan forvente

Hos MineTilbud er afdelingen for Økonomi og Strategi en central partner for alle forretningsområder, fra marketing, salg og drift til IT-udvikling. Vores fokus er at levere de rette data, på det rette tidspunkt, til de rette modtagere. For at styrke vores forretning med faktabaseret ledelse og databårne beslutninger søger vi en forretningsorienteret BI & Data Analyst, der brænder for at forstå, optimere og visualisere forretningsdata i høj kvalitet. Størstedelen af dit arbejde vil foregå i PowerBI og Excel, hvor du skal udtrække data fra vores underliggende datawarehouse, som ligger i Amazon Web Services, og illustrere det i PowerBI.

Som det første teammedlem i afdelingen udover virksomhedens chef for Økonomi og Strategi vil du arbejde i tæt kontakt med både CEO og det øvrige ledelsesteam. Du får en central rolle med stor kontaktflade, og i takt med områdets udvikling får du mulighed for at præge det fremtidige BI-landskab og forme din rolle i denne udvikling.




Primære arbejdsopgaver

Modellering og effektivisering af data
Implementering af forretningslogik i Power BI
Udledning af forretningsindsigt fra forskellige datakilder
Udarbejdelse af rapporteringsløsninger
Visualisering og formidling af data til brug for forretningsdrift og udvikling
Være en engageret kollega, der bidrager til et stærkt fællesskab




Din baggrund og kvalifikationer

For at være den rette til denne rolle er det en forudsætning, at du har erfaring fra en lignende stilling, hvor du i minimum 2 år har arbejdet med Power BI og haft tæt kontakt med interne stakeholders. Du har en relevant uddannelse på BSc- eller MSc-niveau og en stærk kommerciel forståelse.




Som person er du nysgerrig og opsøgende, har gode kommunikationsevner og lyst til at være en del af en virksomhed, hvor vækst og udvikling er i fokus. Du er selvstændig, detaljeorienteret og har en struktureret og resultatorienteret tilgang til opgaver. Erfaring med Amazon Web Services er en fordel. Da North Media primært er en dansk virksomhed, er det et krav, at du behersker dansk og engelsk flydende, både mundtligt og skriftligt.




Den der kan og vil og gør, får også lov

Du bliver en del af en dynamisk og innovativ virksomhed i rivende udvikling. Vi er en arbejdsplads med dedikerede og dygtige kollegaer og en uformel omgangstone. Med det rette engagement får du stor indflydelse på din hverdag. Vi tilbyder lækker frokost- og frugtordning, mulighed for at tage aftensmad med hjem, kaffe og te ad libitum fra vores café, træningsfaciliteter i eget motionsrum samt diverse sociale arrangementer.




For mere information om rollen og hvorfor det at arbejde hos MineTilbud gør dig til en del af et stærkt, udviklende og inkluderende fællesskab, kan du kontakte Mayse Lind, Senior Talent Acquisition Manager, på telefon +45 2154 9818. Vi afholder samtaler løbende og opfordrer interesserede kandidater til at søge snarest muligt.




Om MineTilbud

MineTilbud tilbyder en stærk medieplatform og teknologi, der giver retailers, brands og e-commercere mulighed for at tage del i hele kunderejsen ved at udkomme med relevant indhold på tværs af platforme. MineTilbud er en virksomhed med en skalerbar volumenforretning og et fundament bygget på effektiv håndtering af store mængder materiale og data – hurtigt, sikkert og til en lav enhedspris. Vi står over for spændende forandringer og udviklingsprojekter, hvor vores store datamængder spiller en central rolle i at forstå og styre forretningen. Som BI & Data Analyst får du en unik mulighed for at påvirke virksomhedens fremtid og bidrage til databaserede beslutninger.




MineTilbud er ejet af North Media A/S, hvis selskaber udvikler og driver platforme til transaktioner mellem erhvervslivet og forbrugerne inden for tilbud fra detailhandlen, lejeboliger, jobannoncering og digitale adgangssystemer. North Media A/S er børsnoteret på Nasdaq Copenhagen.

Show more

Title: Data Engineer
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
We are one of the fastest growing podcast & audiobook platforms in Europe and we are now looking for an ambitious Data Engineer to join us and play a key role in enabling the technical platform for our work with data and analytics.

Come and join us on our journey to enrich lives through listening.


This is the role

At Podimo, data is at the center of nearly everything we do; guiding decisions and fueling our business processes. This is where you come in!


In this position, you will join our BI & Analytics Engineering team, which is part of our global Data department. The team is responsible for our company-wide data platform and works to enable data-driven decision-making and operations across the organisation.


You will be collaborating with data/analytics engineers, analysts, and business teams, and will be responsible for ensuring a solid technical platform for our work with BI and analytics, and that data and insights are activated across relevant tools.

Our team offers a casual atmosphere with excellent opportunities for growth and impact, and you will in this position get the chance to take part in shaping and developing Podimo’s data engineering and business intelligence efforts.


While the role eventually will encompass projects supporting the broader organisation, the initial key responsibility will be to strengthen and take ownership of the data integration with our CRM system, Braze. This involves ensuring a seamless flow of relevant data into the system, enabling the Global CRM team to be even more data-driven in their work.

Your main responsibilities are:

Build and maintain robust, compliant and scalable storage and data pipeline solutions to form the data foundation for BI and analytics

Design, develop and maintain pipelines to deliver curated data and insights from our internal data platform to external systems (via APIs or other integrations)
Collaborate closely with members of the Data department, including analytics engineers, data analysts, and scientists, to understand their needs and meet these with high quality solutions, driving efficiencies in their work
Create and maintain data platform infrastructure, adhering to best practices
Take ownership of workflow orchestration, including scheduling, coordination, and monitoring of data processes
Collaborate with relevant engineering squads across the Tech department to optimize infrastructure, align practices, and coordinate data source changes
Work to optimize infrastructure and processes for performance and cost efficiency
Develop and maintain architecture and systems documentation


This is you

We are looking for a colleague who is motivated by and takes great pride in building and maintaining innovative and reliable data solutions. You understand the concepts of working in a dynamic and fast-paced startup environment, and you thrive in collaborating cross-functionally with your colleagues across the company.


In more detail, you will thrive in this role if you have:
2-3 years of experience of a similar role in a fast-growing company
Proficiency in one or more scripting languages, such as Python (preferred) or JavaScript, for building data pipelines and automation
Hands-on experience with batch, streaming, and event-driven data setups, as well as workload orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, Spark, Beam)
Proficiency in working with APIs, including ability to write and maintain stable services for interacting with various APIs to fetch or push data
Experience managing platform infrastructure on a cloud provider (Google Cloud preferred), including building data pipelines, monitoring systems, applying CI/CD practices, and using IaC tools like Terraform or Pulumi for automation
Prior hands-on experience with data platforms such as Google BigQuery or Snowflake
Experience implementing data governance and compliance best practices
Solid SQL skills and foundational understanding of data warehousing principles
A collaborative mindset and a passion for teamwork, continuous improvement, and learning, combined with the ability to work highly independently while ensuring alignment with team goals
Excellent communication skills in English (written and verbal), with the ability to articulate complex data concepts clearly and effectively to diverse audiences

Naturally, being passionate about podcasts, audio content, and entertainment is a big plus!



These are the benefits
ESOP (Employee Stock Ownership Plan) for all employees, no matter where in the world you live.
Learning and personal development opportunities to help you thrive and enrich your skills in a fast-paced creator economy.
Up to six months of fully paid parental leave for all new parents - no matter how you identify or where in the world you live
Free online therapy sessions through We.Care.
Delicious lunch with great colleagues.
Unlimited child sick days and the opportunity to work flexible hours and remotely.
Opportunity to make an impact at a growing international company and see your work pay off immediately.


This is the hiring process

Please share your CV or LinkedIn profile. We’d love to hear why you’re interested in the job, but it’s not a must. If we move forward with your application, here’s what to expect:

An initial conversation with a recruiter to set expectations
A case conversation with the hiring manager, Martin Otto-Sidelmann, Director of BI & Analytics Engineering
A coffee chat with some of your potential future team members

We might tweak the process to keep things smooth and enjoyable. We'll be conducting interviews continuously, aiming for a start date around March or asap after that date.

Can’t wait to hear from you!


This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear – whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We recognize the value every individual brings, and respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions, and time. We approach our work with integrity and humility, and believe that we are better together. We have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We’re fiercely passionate about discovering, creating, and obsessing over great stories. We support our creators deeply, and have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their most exciting ideas and stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we have a good time doing it.

We seek to build a company and culture that mirrors the diversity of the world we’re living in. This means; diversity of talent, voices, ideas, and thoughts. That goes both for our brand, our content, our creators, and our teams.

You are welcome at Podimo for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what stories you have playing in your headphones.



Equal Opportunity Employer

Podimo is an equal opportunity employer, and we believe in equal opportunities for all in our workplace. We don’t discriminate based on race, colour, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age or political orientation, no matter where we operate.


Show more

  • Free online therapy sessions through We.Care.
  • Delicious lunch with great colleagues.
  • Unlimited child sick days and the opportunity to work flexible hours and remotely.
  • Opportunity to make an impact at a growing international company and see your work pay off immediately.

This is the hiring process

Please share your CV or LinkedIn profile. We’d love to hear why you’re interested in the job, but it’s not a must. If we move forward with your application, here’s what to expect:

  • An initial conversation with a recruiter to set expectations
  • A case conversation with the hiring manager, Martin Otto-Sidelmann, Director of BI & Analytics Engineering
  • A coffee chat with some of your potential future team members

We might tweak the process to keep things smooth and enjoyable. We'll be conducting interviews continuously, aiming for a start date around March or asap after that date.

Can’t wait to hear from you!

This is us

Founded in Copenhagen in 2019, Podimo is a platform for podcast and audiobook lovers as well as audio content creators. Our app puts a world of podcasts and audiobooks at your fingertips. Our revenue-sharing model rewards creators for making content that people want to hear – whether they have an established following or a niche audience.

We're a courageous and curious bunch. We recognize the value every individual brings, and respect our coworkers’ ideas, opinions, and time. We approach our work with integrity and humility, and believe that we are better together. We have zero time for brilliant jerks.

We’re fiercely passionate about discovering, creating, and obsessing over great stories. We support our creators deeply, and have massive respect for their process as we help them bring their most exciting ideas and stories to life. We love what we do, but more importantly, we have a good time doing it.

We seek to build a company and culture that mirrors the diversity of the world we’re living in. This means; diversity of talent, voices, ideas, and thoughts. That goes both for our brand, our content, our creators, and our teams.

You are welcome at Podimo for who you are, no matter where you come from, what you look like, or what stories you have playing in your headphones.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Podimo is an equal opportunity employer, and we believe in equal opportunities for all in our workplace. We don’t discriminate based on race, colour, religion, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, age or political orientation, no matter where we operate.

Title: Student BI Developer
Description:
Are you eager to develop your skills within business intelligence, be a part of a great team, and contribute to the green transition?

If you have programming skills, a can-do attitude, and a willingness to learn, Energi Danmark offers a unique opportunity for students like you.




As a student employee in the Business Intelligence team, you will play a key role in supporting the optimization of renewable and conventional assets, contributing to the efficient management of energy production across the Nordic region and Germany. Your work will directly support the division's goal of maximizing asset performance and delivering optimal results for our clients, helping drive the green transition.




You will report to the Head of Market Analysis & Projects, Origination.




YOUR MISSION

Your main responsibilities will be to develop and maintain business relevant tools on a strategic and operational level. You will be exposed to big data mining, which is one of our core approaches to decision making.




Your startup project will be rethinking an existing project, which is written in C#, and writing the new project in Python.




Otherwise, your area of responsibilities will be to:

Develop solutions to help traders make the right decision
Develop backend code (Python) for analysis and present valuable insights
Pull data from databases (SQL)
Ad hoc tasks




JOIN A TEAM WITH LIKEMINDED ENERGY

Our team is made up of both an analysis function, focused on asset and market analyses and forecasts, and a software development branch that ensures operational stability.




As a part of the software development team, you'll collaborate closely on a range of challenging tasks, from developing tools to supporting daily operations.

This is a great opportunity to learn valuable skills in data science and contribute to the green transition, all while growing both professionally and personally.




The team consists of 11 dedicated individuals who work together to drive impactful results.




LET US SWITCH THE FOCUS TO YOU

The ideal candidate is someone who has started their second or third year of a bachelor’s degree, preferably in Physics, Mathematics, Mathematics-Economy, or Data Science. However, we value skills and experience over formal education.




We are looking for a candidate who excels in their studies, is curious, and thrives in a challenging environment where the learning curve is steep.

You should be conscientious, taking full responsibility for your own projects.

Additionally, we hope you are proficient in programming, particularly Python and C#, with experience in SQL, VBA, or R being a plus.




You should also be available to work an average of 14-16 hours per week.




There will be an introduction period at the onset of your employment.




We encourage candidates from all backgrounds and identities to apply, as we believe that a diverse team leads to innovation and success.




WE MIGHT BE BIASED, BUT IT IS QUITE AWESOME HERE

Building on decades of trading expertise, we are one of the leading trading companies in the Nordics. When you join us, you will be part of an ambitious energy trading company with over 300 employees, working alongside talented and dedicated colleagues. We are on a transformational journey, driving high efficiency in the energy markets and accelerating the energy transition by connecting and serving producers and consumers of renewable energy.




We offer an exciting and dynamic workplace that fosters high ambitions and nurtures a culture of dedication, problem-solving, and a winning mindset. As we navigate a significant transformation, you will find a lot of opportunities for growth, skill development, and specialization with us.




We place great emphasis on the well-being of our employees, both inside and outside the workplace. We prioritize excellent working conditions and offer a comprehensive benefits package, including extra days off, competitive compensation and flexible working hours to promote a healthy work-life balance.




LET US GET THIS CONVERSATIONS STARTED

If you want to join us, don’t wait – send your resume and application as soon as possible, but no later than January 10.




Please note that due to the winter break, you should expect to hear from us in the beginning of January 2025. However, we will still be conducting interviews on a rolling basis, so the post may close early if we find the perfect fit.




Got questions or need more details? Feel free to reach out to Smail Kozarcanin, Head of Market Analysis & Projects, Origination via email at smko@energidanmark.dk or on phone: phone +45 87 42 67 37.




You’re almost there – ready to cross the finish line and join us in 2025?

Title: IT Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Job Opening: Senior IT Analyst


Company: BluEdge
Location: Copenhagen, Denmark
Start Date: 06 Jan 2025
End Date: 28 Feb 2025 (renewable)


BluEdge is seeking an experienced Senior IT Analyst to join our downstream team within the Core banking program. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in collecting requirements from business stakeholders, documenting them in features and user stories, and independently driving the requirements from collection to handover to developers. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of data governance and data mapping, as well as extensive experience in the banking sector, preferably from a larger bank. Additionally, the candidate should have a proven track record as a senior Business Analyst or senior IT Analyst, and have experience working in a larger program with approximately 300+ employees. Knowledge of working in a Nordic bank, reporting, and experience with Hadoop will be considered advantageous.

Requirements


Professional knowledge of data governance and data mapping
Experience in the banking sector, preferably from a larger bank
Extensive experience as a senior Business Analyst and/or senior IT Analyst
Previous work experience in a larger program with approximately 300+ employees
Advantageous to have worked in a Nordic bank
Knowledge about reporting is advantageous
Experience with Hadoop is advantageous

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
About us

At RavenPack, we are at the forefront of developing the next generation of generative AI tools for the finance industry and beyond. With 20 years of experience as a leading big data analytics provider for financial services, we empower our clients—including some of the world's most successful hedge funds, banks, and asset managers—to enhance returns, reduce risk, and increase efficiency by integrating public information into their models and workflows. Building on this expertise, we are now launching a new suite of GenAI and SaaS services, designed specifically for financial professionals.

Join a Company that is Powering the Future of Finance with AI

RavenPack has been recognized as the Best Alternative Data Provider by WatersTechnology and has been included in this year’s Top 100 Next Unicorns by Viva Technology. We recently launched Bigdata.com, a next-generation platform aimed at transforming financial decision-making.




Join RavenPack:

RavenPack is searching for a Quantitative Researcher / Data Scientist to join the Data Science - QIS Team at our Spanish headquarters. The role is based in Marbella. We offer a relocation package, competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.

As a Quant Researcher, you will be participating in the development of new agentic workflows utilizing our semantic search engine, showcasing the value of our RavenPack data for excavating insights.

The ability to communicate effectively in English both in writing and verbally is a must.

European legal working status is required.

We offer competitive compensation, active mentoring, exposure to the top trading firms, and a fun working environment. Relocation assistance is available.




Your Responsibilities:

As a Quant Researcher, you will join the “Quantitative Investment Strategies (QIS) Team,” consisting of four quant researchers dedicated to feature engineering and developing systematic trading strategies. Your work will primarily involve data-driven research. You will create research workflows to enhance RavenPack’s reputation as a thought leader in the alternative data industry and present systematic workflows to conduct fundamental analysis. You will work jointly with the Head of QIS on practical use cases that demonstrate the value of RavenPack data. Additionally, your responsibilities will include:

Understanding accurately the fundamental implications of a topic on the macro and microeconomy.
Developing chain-of-thought agents to mimic a human professional analyst using our data, while discerning and filtering out irrelevant information.
Offering data-driven insights, engaging in research discussions, and presenting features to leading financial analysts, quantitative researchers and portfolio managers in the field.
Effectively communicating intricate analytical concepts to management in a clear and concise manner.




What We're Looking For:

A MSc in Data Analysis, Quantitative Finance, or Economics.
2+ years of relevant work experience as a data scientist or quantitative researcher, manipulating large and noisy alternative datasets for features engineering.
Outstanding analytical, critical-thinking, and problem-solving skills, with proven ability to conduct fundamental analysis in a systematic and quantitative way.
Demonstrated proficiency in Python, and in at least Dash, StreamLit, or RepLit web applications.
Strong enthusiasm for technology, and familiarity with big data technologies coupled with proficiency in language models is highly advantageous.




What's in it for you?

You will work with the latest technologies.
Our Headquarters is located in Marbella. Following the onboarding period, we offer a hybrid work model, allowing for up to 2 days remote per week.
Free Company shuttle bus from Malaga, Fuengirola, Riviera and Estepona.
You will have ownership of projects working in a collaborative environment where we will value your contribution.
You will work in an agile environment able to react quickly to changes with a fairly flat hierarchy.
As we encourage continuous learning, we will support your ongoing training.
Diversity is in our DNA! You will work in an international environment (over 29 nationalities and 24 languages spoken!)




We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Title: Data Engineer (Consultant)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight Copenhagen




Come work with us!




Netlight strives to be a truly diverse, equitable and inclusive organization. Regardless of who you are, what personality, background, and experience you have, you enrich our culture through your values. Netlight’s purpose is to unleash full potential, realize great careers, and foster personal growth. To achieve this, we have a highly engaged network organization where every employee gets a mentor, delivery coach and personal communities. The key to our continued success is trust and personal responsibility, diverse experiences, challenging opportunities and developing from personal values. Every Netlighter is an active part of building and shaping this culture, which leads to a clear correlation between personal growth and the growth of Netlight.




About us

Netlight provides a full range of premium IT-consulting services at the forefront of the digital industry and stands out for its product- and technology-independent expertise in a wide range of industries and clients. We are a network organization of more than 2000 role models making aspiring digital leaders successful in their business-critical IT projects. Netlight has been awarded several times as a top employer, as well as for growth, continued profitability and engagement for diversity, equity, and equality within the IT industry. Today we are growing across 12 offices in 8 countries, from Europe to North America.




What does it mean to be an IT Consultant in Data Engineering at Netlight?

In our central Copenhagen office (Amagertorv 29), a collaborative community of around 90 colleagues drives innovation and technology across the IT sector. As a consultant at Netlight, you will play a pivotal role in shaping current and future products, systems, and technical solutions. This entails contributing to the growth and scaling of existing and emerging products and companies, while continuously learning and mastering a variety of technical tools.




As a consultant within the data area, you will help our clients in roles such as Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer, Data Architect to name a few. We build comprehensive data platforms that encompass data warehousing & data lake infrastructure, data modeling, and the implementation of ETL/ELT data pipelines, whether batch or real-time. We design and implement innovative data products, incorporating elements of backend and cloud engineering. We are at the forefront of advising clients around emerging topics such as data governance, AI and data mesh. At Netlight, you define your career path, clients you engage with, your role (based on your strengths, interests, and experience), and your connections with mentors, coaches, EDGE networks, and social circles.




Main responsibilities

Netlight prides itself on technological agnosticism, meaning that we adapt to our clients’ needs while solving intricate challenges. As a consulting force, we lead the technological frontiers and encourage constant growth. You will be challenged by us, our clients, and in turn, you will challenge them. Collaboratively, we foster growth and harness potential.




As a Netlight consultant, you are:

Passionate about leveraging technology for innovation and value creation
Striving to evolve as a valuable collaborator, leader, and tech expert
Committed to understanding clients’ visions and strategies to help them achieve their aspirations




We imagine that you:

Hold or will soon graduate with a master’s degree in Technology, Computer Science, IT, Software Development or related fields
Or hold a bachelor's degree in one of these areas plus two years of full-time working experience in a relevant IT-field
Bring experience as a young professional in software development, data engineering, or related domains
Have professional exposure from internships, part-time/full-time positions, or similar contexts in agile software engineering roles
Verbal and written proficiency in English
Based in Copenhagen or willingness to relocate to Copenhagen




Get in touch

Netlight is always on the lookout for new talents. If our vision resonates with you, we encourage you to submit your application. We will respond within two weeks if your profile aligns with the current requirements.




We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment where everyone feels empowered to bring their unique perspectives and skills. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds to apply and are dedicated to providing equal opportunities for all.




We're looking forward to hearing from you!

Show more

Title: Medior Analytics Specialist
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
HTML:
Copenhagen, hybrid

This role is part of our Data team in Copenhagen. At DEPT®, we combine data, technology and marketing to solve brands’ business problems and drive revenue through a variety of digital solutions.

Job Purpose

As an Analytics Specialist at Dept, you work with our clients on the best data setup, implement these and educate the clients in the world of Analytics. Of course this role has its challenges. The death of the cookie is near, and in this role you will consult our clients to deal with this new reality. How do they need to set up their server-side measurement? Which new products and features should we test? How can we make the best use of Consent Mode, conversion uploads and more? And GA4. The end of the session, which is changing analytics like we know it. You like to dive into these questions and want to help our clients answer them. As an Analytics Specialist you are the absolute expert in data collection and solving complex analytics cases. You know how to create and implement measurement setups, take care of server-to-server connections between owned and marketing platforms and help clients to implement the best data collection setup.

Key Responsibilities

  • Manage and configure tag management systems (eg. GTM) to ensure accurate data collection;
  • Develop measurement plans in collaboration with clients;
  • Troubleshoot and fix data discrepancies & tracking issues;
  • Conduct audits of data collection setups;
  • Collaborate with development teams to develop and maintain tracking across digital platforms;
  • Use data visualisation tools (eg. Looker Studio, Power BI) to present data in an easily understandable format;
  • Consult with clients and help them take their analytics setup to the next level.


What We Are Looking For

  • At least 2 years of experience in a data role, preferably at agency side;
  • Hands-on experience with Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager;
  • Are proficient in Javascript;
  • Maybe you don't have the technical skills yet, but are eager to learn more about SQL, Python and Cloud;
  • Full working proficiency in the English language - spoken and written (proficiency in Danish is considered a plus, not a requirement);
  • Somebody who can switch from serious to play in a heartbeat;
  • An analytical, technical, independent profile with good communication skills.


WE OFFER

  • A healthy, varied and delicious lunch at the office;
  • A lot of fun social events such as Friday bars, company parties, team events, etc.;
  • A flexible, hybrid working policy and a great workplace in our awesome office in Christianshavn;
  • A reputation for doing good. DEPT® has been a Certified B Corp® since 2021 and named ‘Agency of the Year’ at both The Lovies and The Webby Awards;
  • Awesome clients. Whether big or small, local or global — at DEPT® you’ll get the opportunity to work with clients of all sizes and across all industries;
  • The opportunity for possibility. We want to enable you to do what you do best and help you develop your skills further with training and development;
  • Stay happy and healthy with a contribution to your health through the OpenUp platform, gym and wellness discounts, and healthy lunches at the office;
  • Global annual DEPT® Cares Month in which employees come together and donate their skills to support local charities.


WHO ARE WE?

We are pioneers at heart. What does that mean? We are always looking forward, thinking of what we can create tomorrow that does not exist today. We were born digital and we are a new model of agency, with a deep skillset in tech and marketing. That’s why we hire curious, self-driven, talented people who never stop innovating.

Our culture is big enough to cope and small enough to care. Meaning, that with people across 30+ countries, we’re big enough to provide you with the best tools, global opportunities, and benefits that help you thrive. While acting small by investing in you, your growth, your team, and giving you the autonomy to solve our clients problems, no matter where you are in the world.

DIVERSITY, EQUITY & INCLUSION

At DEPT®, we take pride in creating an inclusive workplace where everyone has an equal opportunity to thrive. We actively seek to recruit, develop, nurture, and retain talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, with varying skills and perspectives.

Not sure you meet all qualifications? Apply, and let us decide! Research shows that women and members of underrepresented groups tend not to apply for jobs when they think they may not meet every requirement, when in fact they do. We believe in giving everyone a fair chance to shine.

We also encourage you to reach out to us and discuss any reasonable adjustments we can make to support you throughout the recruitment process and your time with us.

Want to know more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion? Check out our efforts here.

Title: Senior Data Engineer (Advanced Audience Modelling)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Are you a cutting-edge thinker with a passion for leveraging the latest in strongly typed data pipelines, AI-powered anomaly detection and cloud-first compute systems? Do you want to join an existing, high-output team of academic and professional experts to tackle some of the most complex challenges in advertising? If so, we’d love to meet you.




Our team is embarking on a highly strategic project at the intersection of data science, advertising technology, and audience insights, with a focus on privacy-friendly predictive modelling for audience segmentation and targeting. The system you'll be designing will support 1/3rd of the world's ad campaigns, so the scope is huge, and the success of our team depends on our ability in the near term to demonstrate to key stakeholders the superiority of our system, and then follow up on that promise in the mid-long term.




What You’ll Do:

Collaborate with a high-performing team to explore, design, and implement proprietary models based on contemporary research papers. Your role will have a focus on designing and building out the supporting data pipelines and cloud infrastructure.
Implement AI-powered anomaly detection frameworks to help us discover signal loss of data degradation in our pipelines.
Explore advanced audience segmentation strategies using massive, multi-dimensional data sets spanning behavioural, social, and content engagement patterns.
Leverage your expertise in and experience with well-architected distributed compute systems and integrated ML solutions to accelerate our journey towards a privacy-first future for the ad tech industry.
Work on the full software engineering lifecycle, from first design to initial implementation, to maintenance of stable products everyone relies on.




WhoYou Are:

You have a strong academic background (PhD or Master’s in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Data Science, or a related field).
You’re passionate about solving real-world problems with advanced models and scalable architecture.
Proven experience in at least one strongly typed language such as Scala, Rust, Go or similar
You have a track record of delivering end-to-end software engineering projects and deploying them at scale, with a focus on measurable results.
A strong communicator who thrives in collaborative environments and is eager to learn from and mentor others.
You know how to land on your feet when priorities change. You want to work in a high-throughput environment.




Bonus Points:

If you have experience with multiple programming languages and particularly functional programming languages
If you have contributed to one or more open-source projects




Why Join Us?

Be a key player in shaping the future of privacy-first advertising and audience modelling using cutting-edge AI techniques and highly performant computing systems.
Join an elite team where your research and technical contributions will have a direct impact on strategic outcomes. Work with massive, industry-scale data sets and the latest machine learning techniques.
Growth opportunities; collaborate with leading minds in the field, present your work at major industry conferences, and push the boundaries of applied machine learning.




If you’re ready to innovate and collaborate on high-stakes projects with real-world impact, apply now to join my team and help us redefine the future of audience modelling.

Show more

Title: Azure løsningsarkitekt
Description:
Vil du gribe en spændende mulighed for at vokse professionelt og forme vores kunders cloud-rejse i samarbejde med vores internationale team?
Er du passioneret omkring Microsoft-teknologier og har lyst til at blive en del af et dynamisk og erfarent team med en kultur for vidensdeling?
Brænder du for at kommunikere den værdi, som Azure-teknologi kan tilføre vores kunders forretning, samtidig med at du hjælper dem med at optimere deres cloud- og softwareinvesteringer?




Praktisk information:

Placering: Søborg, Silkeborg, Aalborg, Danmark | Rapporterer til: Cloud & Security Advisory Lead| Sprogkrav: Flydende dansk og engelsk, skriftligt og mundtligt




Som vores nye Azure løsningsarkitekt, vil du på baggrund af dialog med beslutningstagere hos vores kunder gennem teknisk sparring og rådgivning, identificere cloud projekter og kommunikere Crayons services værdi i samspil med Azure teknologi. Din rolle vil være at drive pre-sales, definere og afgrænse, designe og optimere Azure-løsninger, samt udføre problemfri implementering og udrulning på tværs af forskellige kundesegmenter, direkte og eventuelt i samarbejde med vores internationale konsulenter.




Andre ansvarsområder:

Identificere kundespecifikke problematikker og designe lønsninger via Azure Cloud Adoption Framework og Azure Well-Architected Review for at sikre tilpasning til bedste praksis
Samarbejde med kunder om at definere projektets omfang, roller, ansvarsområder, indsatsestimater og succeskriterier
Holde dig opdateret om Azure-teknologier og bedste praksis for at kunne støtte kunderne bedst muilgt i projekterne
Lede proof-of-concept-initiativer, drive prospektering, kvalificere, præsentere, forhandle og dele produktindsigt gennem hele salgsprocessen




Dine kompetencer:

5+ års relevant erfaring med Azure technologier
Azure Certified Solutions Architect og andre relevante certificeringer
Kompetencer inden for teknisk sparring og rådgivning i forbindelse med implementering og udførelse af projekter
Specialiceret viden i at implementere Azure-infrastruktur
Specialiceret viden i migration fra lokal infrastruktur til Azure IaaS og PaaS-løsninger
Kompetence og evne til at identificere og kommunikere løsninger til kundernes smertepunkter




Om dig:

Uafhængig, vedholdende og drevet til at forfølge nye forretningsmuligheder, mens du rådgiver om teknologiens indvirkning på kundernes forretninger
Evnen til at sætte personlige mål og samtidig samarbejde effektivt for at nå team- og forretningsmål
Proaktiv og selvsikker i at tage føringen for at fremme muligheder og skabe resultater




En hos Crayon Danmark betyder også;

at du vil arbejde i en virksomhed hvis medarbejdertilfredshed er signifikant over gennemsnittet i Danmark
at du vil blive inddraget og have stor indflydelse på hvordan virksomheden udvikler sig
at arbejdstiden følger ’the new normal policy’, som er 2-3 dage på kontoret og ellers arbejde hjemmefra – vi er fleksible
at du altid kan finde Nutella, Cola og Cocio i køleskabet hvis du er sulten for sjov - og vores frokostordning vil du absolut ikke kunne klage over
at du vil blive inviteret til nogle fantastiske sociale events flere gange om året – vi holder altid nogle gode fester




Crayon har positioneret sig som Nordens førende indenfor Cloud-services, Software Asset Management og salg af software. Vores specialister leverer skræddersyende løsninger indenfor softwareleverandørstyring på tværs af Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, Google, Adobe, IBM, Oracle mv. – altså nogle af de største navne i branchen. Vi er en del af en børsnoteret koncern, som globalt beskæftiger mere end 4.300 medarbejdere på vores kontorer på tværs af landegrænserne. I Crayon Danmark er lige over 110 ansatte, fordelt på 3 lokationer, hovedkontor i Søborg, en lokation centralt i Silkeborg samt et kontor i Aalborg.




Hos Crayon Danmark vil du blive en del af et innovativt og dynamisk miljø, hvor vi har en meget åben og hjælpsom kultur. Dine kommende kolleger er enormt faglig dygtige, og er stærkt drevet af at gøre en forskel for vores kunder og partnere. Vi vil investere i dig via kompetenceudvikling, kurser, seminarer og certificeringer – og dine kommende kolleger vil rigtig gerne videns dele med dig.

Der er aldrig en typisk dag hos Crayon, vores DNA er noget helt særligt – og det er det vi elsker ved at være medarbejdere i Crayon.




At Crayon, we are deeply committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging (DEIB). We believe that diversity in all its forms strengthens our team and enhances innovation and effectiveness. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, regardless of race, color, age, origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender (identity), genetic information, neurodiversity, disability, or any other basis protected by local laws and regulations.

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.




If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Show more

When filling vacancies, we prioritize equally qualified candidates who bring diverse backgrounds and experiences, helping to enrich our team dynamics and foster a vibrant, inclusive work environment.


If you require any assistance or reasonable accommodation during the application process, please let us know.

Title: Business Analytics Consultant – med sans for økonomistyring
Place: Copenhagen Municipality, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
twoday er den førende digitale transformationspartner i Nordeuropa med en global tilstedeværelse. Med cirka 3.000 teknologer samarbejder vi med de mest beundrede private og offentlige organisationer for at levere banebrydende digitale løsninger. Vores dybe brancheekspertise omfatter Data & AI, softwareudvikling, digitale oplevelser og forretningsapplikationer. Vores team, der opererer i hele Norden og Litauen, genererede en omsætning på 280 millioner euro i 2023. Vi betjener over 8.000 kunder og understøtter deres digitale transformationsrejser.

Har du opnået den første erfaring med økonomistyring, men ønsker at booste dine kompetencer på datadrevne, automatiserede og tidssvarende styringskoncepter?

Vil du hjælpe nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder med at blive bedre til at planlægge og styre deres forretning ved hjælp af økonomistyringsløsninger? Bliv en del af en af Danmarks førende data- og AI-huse, som arbejder med nogle af Danmarks største virksomheder. Vi har vokseværk på alle vores fire kontorer, og vi søger derfor flere kollegaer til at udvikle de bedste økonomistyringsløsninger.

Kan du se dig selv her?

Du bliver en del af vores Digital Strategy-team, som bl.a. udvikler effektive løsninger til finansiel konsolidering, budgettering, forecasting, performance management og omkostningsallokering.

Vi er et uformelt team af konsulenter, som stiler efter høj kvalitet og integritet, samtidig med, at vi lægger vægt på at have det sjovt i hverdagen.

Vores løsninger udvikles i tæt samarbejde med kunden og er typisk forankret i økonomifunktionen, men de rækker ud til både salg , marketing, produktion og distribution, så vi sikrer sammenhæng og gennemsigtighed i processer og data.

Vi tror på, at vores kollektive viden gør teamet dygtigere og bidrager til bedre løsninger for kunderne. Desuden indgår vi i et større hold, som har fokus på andre analytiske discipliner, så der er mange dygtige kollegaer at trække på og sparre med.

Og kan du sætte flueben her?


Har en økonomisk baggrund og har siddet i en økonomifunktion som controller med berøringsflader til den øvrige del af forretningen. Alternativ har du en baggrund som revisor eller har anden relevant konsulenterfaring.
Har kendskab til økonomistyring og en bred vifte af forskellige forretningsprocesser og interessenter. Erfaring med konsolidering er et plus.
Har udviklet og drevet Excel-baserede løsninger (eller andre værktøjer) og oplevet fordelene og ulemperne på egen krop. Du ved, hvor tingene med fordel kan gøres bedre og mere robuste, f.eks. i forhold til dataindsamling og versionering.
Har både et teknisk gen og en glæde ved omgang med kolleger og (interne) kunder.
Din erfaring er et afsæt til relevant rådgivning for kunden omkring både processer og en understøttende teknisk løsning.
Du får energi af vekselvirkningen mellem samvær og sparring med kollegaer og kunder og den selvstændige indsats på kontoret.
Du vil prøve kræfter med konsulentverdenen, hvor du får mulighed for at løse forskellige problemstillinger for mange interessante og forskellige kunder sammen med dine dygtige kolleger.
Som person får du ultimativ jobglæde, når du i samarbejde med kolleger finder frem til de bedste løsninger for kunden. Du har en praktisk tilgang til at løse opgaverne og et stålsat fokus på at skabe værdi for kunden i praksis.


Vores løsninger er ofte integreret med kundernes øvrige løsninger og baserer sig på Jedox, og vi har ofte et Microsoft-baseret Data Warehouse i ryggen samt/eller Microsoft Power BI som rapporteringsværktøj.

Det er ikke en forudsætning, at du har erfaring med disse værktøjer, da vi sørger for den nødvendige tekniske oplæring.

Hvad kan vi tilbyde?

twoday er placeret i moderne lokaler på 30 steder i Norge, Sverige, Danmark, Finland og Litauen. Vi har et stærkt og unikt socialt miljø med højt engagerede medarbejdere. Hvis du er den kandidat, vi leder efter, vil du få en central rolle med spændende muligheder for at udvikle dig i en international og innovativ gruppe, med spændende produkter og tjenester inden for teknologi og software. Du vil også have fleksibiliteten til at "jumpe" og arbejde fra et af vores hovedkontorer i Oslo, Stockholm, København, Helsinki eller Vilnius til tider.

Diversitet og inklusion

Opfylder du ikke alle kravene? Studier har vist, at kvinder og andre minoriteter er mindre tilbøjelige til at ansøge om et job, hvis de ikke opfylder alle krav i et jobopslag. Hos twoday er vi dedikerede til at opbygge en arbejdsplads og et fællesskab, hvor alle er velkomne. Hvis du er begejstret for denne rolle, men din tidligere erfaring ikke præcist matcher jobbeskrivelsen, opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at ansøge.

Er du interesseret?

Så send din ansøgning i dag, de vil løbende blive læst.

Der vil løbende blive indkaldt til indledende samtaler. Du ansøger ved at klikke på knappen nedenfor.  Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er Ann Brahe-Orlandi, Talent Acquisition Manager, klar til at hjælpe. Hun glæder sig til at høre fra dig på ann.brahe-orlandi@twoday.com.
Show more

Hvis du er den kandidat, vi leder efter, vil du få en central rolle med spændende muligheder for at udvikle dig i en international og innovativ gruppe, med spændende produkter og tjenester inden for teknologi og software. Du vil også have fleksibiliteten til at "jumpe" og arbejde fra et af vores hovedkontorer i Oslo, Stockholm, København, Helsinki eller Vilnius til tider.

Diversitet og inklusion

Opfylder du ikke alle kravene? Studier har vist, at kvinder og andre minoriteter er mindre tilbøjelige til at ansøge om et job, hvis de ikke opfylder alle krav i et jobopslag. Hos twoday er vi dedikerede til at opbygge en arbejdsplads og et fællesskab, hvor alle er velkomne. Hvis du er begejstret for denne rolle, men din tidligere erfaring ikke præcist matcher jobbeskrivelsen, opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at ansøge.

Er du interesseret?

Så send din ansøgning i dag, de vil løbende blive læst.

Der vil løbende blive indkaldt til indledende samtaler. Du ansøger ved at klikke på knappen nedenfor.  Alle ansøgninger behandles fortroligt.

Hvis du har spørgsmål til stillingen, er Ann Brahe-Orlandi, Talent Acquisition Manager, klar til at hjælpe. Hun glæder sig til at høre fra dig på ann.brahe-orlandi@twoday.com.

Title: Senior Insights & Analytics Analyst, Marketing Mix Modelling - Aarhus
Description:
Location

Viby J, DK

Do you know how to turn raw data via modelling into purified insights that makes a big commercial difference? And would you like to be part of our expanded modelling function? Then you might be our new Senior Analyst we are looking for in Global Media & Agency Management in Arla Foods.

How You Will Make An Impact

Your primary role will be to continuously support business objectives and improve our media and thereby commercial performance.

Your key areas of responsibilities will be


Drive and support media ROI agenda in Arla Foods with the rest of the modelling team primarily via use of insourced media modelling software solution
Build/maintain a strong stakeholder relationship (both internally in Arla Foods and externally towards key partners) to ensure modelling results are understood and learnings are widely executed.


In short, you’ll play a key role in bringing data and insights to the forefront of everything we do in Global Media & Agency Management. More specifically, your tasks will be


Conduct econometric/marketing mix modelling across markets, categories and brands and sup-port execution of media learnings. Deliver learnings on optimal budget allocation across touch-points, timing and weighting + to some extend input on creative quality (in regard to sales stimulation)
Drive portfolio media budget allocation projects pr. markets. Deliver learnings on how to optimize budget allocation across brands and categories in a given market
Co-drive global media budget allocation project - deliver learnings on optimal total media budget allocation across markets, categories and brands
Supply input to specific media/budget plans and overall media/budgeting guidelines
Support overall Marketing ROI agenda in Arla Foods
Drive agenda of putting data and analyses first to gain maximal value of all media initiatives.


What Will Make You Successful

You are data-driven by heart and passionate about the opportunities to covert data into commercial value.

You have a degree in marketing, math, IT, computer science, business intelligence or similar and proven experience working with data mining and statistics. Further you have


Highly developed analytical skills
Strong stakeholder relation building skills
Great communication, presentation and project management skills
Preferably media knowledge/experience – could be from an agency
Strong English skills – verbally and in writing.


What do we offer?

You will be part of Global Media & Agency management where we in a dynamic and collaborate way focus on optimizing marketing/media effectiveness and efficiencies. Our department is part of Global Insights & Analytics and the position is placed in Arla Foods global HQ in Viby, Denmark.

We’re committed to professional development and promoting from within. Our positive and collaborative culture will bring out the best in you. And you’ll join a market leader who produces nutritious household favorite brands in a way that make things better for our customers, the farmers who own us, and the whole world.

Would you like to join us?

If you want to be part of something special and help shape the industry, then seize this exciting opportunity at Arla. Please apply as soon as possible. We will invite for interviews on a continuous basis. For additional information, please call Head of Global Media & Agency Management, Jan Worre, on +45 8733 2822.

We have a purpose for Good

At Arla, we strive to unlock the highest potential in each other while working together to create a sustainable future of dairy. We call it Stronger People Stronger Planet and it is deeply anchored in our organisation and founded on our commitment to respecting human rights, increasing access to healthy dairy nutrition, inspiring good food habits, and improving the environment for future generations. In order to succeed we need to hire people with a sustainable mindset. Could this be you?

BEWARE! RECRUITMENT FRAUD

It has come to our attention that there are a number of fraudulent emails and fake recruitment campaigns on the internet from people purporting to work for Arla Foods. Learn more via this link.

Ref.96972

Title: AI Engineer (OpenAI)
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
Vær med til at skabe unikke AI løsninger og enestående kundeoplevelser.




Delegate er et IT-konsulenthus i vækst, hvor stærke værdier og høj faglighed er grundlaget for din og vores udvikling og succes. Vi er med helt fremme på alle Microsofts Cloud platforme og har en spændende pipeline af projekter på tværs af brancher i den private og offentlige sektor. Hos os får du mere end 200 dygtige kollegaer fordelt på vores tre kontorer i Virum, Aarhus og Aalborg.




Du bliver en del af vores AI & Advanced Analytics serviceline og vil blive tilknyttet vores kontor i Virum. Delegate og TDN (The Digital Neighborhood) har valgt at satse massivt på udviklingen af robuste og cutting edge AI løsninger, hvorfor vi får brug for endnu en stærk profil indenfor AI engineering med Azure OpenAI.




Dine arbejdsopgaver:

Du vil indgå i leverancen i forhold til at designe, estimere og implementere projekter. Du kommer potentielt også til at være ansvarlig for planlægning, indsamling af krav og gennemførelse af workshops. Som konsulent i Delegate er din fornemmeste opgave dog at sikre at de AI løsninger, vi leverer til vores kunder, er af højeste kvalitet.




Dine tekniske kvalifikationer:

Krav:

Erfaring i Python-udvikling og/eller .NET-udvikling
Erfaring med udvikling af Azure OpenAI løsninger
Erfaring med:
Azure App Service
Azure Functions
Azure DevOps-pipelines og Bicep/IAC.
JSON/Rest API-integration

Plusser:

Erfaring med:
Udvikling af JSON/Rest API'er
Azure CLI
Azure Managed Identity / RBAC
Containere/Docker i praksis
Azure DevOps
CI/CD og DevOps i praksis
Azure Cost Estimation
Automatiseret test ud over unit tests
Erfaring, uddannelse eller interesse for klassisk maskinlæring







Professionelle færdigheder

Gode kommunikations- og samarbejdsevner
Vandt til at arbejde i et agilt udviklingsmiljø
Erfaring med tidsestimering og dokumentation af komplekse opgaver
Taler og skriver dansk og engelsk.




Skulle du mangle enkelte af ovenstående kompetencer opfordrer vi dig alligevel til at søge - det allervigtigste hos er, at du har interesse i at udvikle dig og bidrage til videreudviklingen af vores AI-løsninger i et miljø, hvor samarbejde og faglig udvikling er i fokus.




Niveau

Consultant / Senior Consultant




Work from anywhere

Vi gør meget ud af at skabe rammerne for at kunne balancere arbejdsliv og privatliv. I Delegate har du fuld fleksibilitet til at planlægge din hverdag, så du f.eks. kan hente børnene tidligt, eller lægge din træning midt på dagen, for til gengæld at åbne computeren på et andet tidspunkt, ligesom du har mulighed for at arbejde hjemmefra. Vi kalder det #workfromanywhere. Vi er forpligtet over for hinanden og vores kunder, og derfor stoler vi på, at du også anerkender den betydelige værdi af at møde ind på vores fysiske kontor i løbet af ugen.




Velkommen hjem

Hos Delegate bliver du mødt med nærvær og kvalitet på alle niveauer, og vi tager os tid til at hjælpe hinanden og gør os umage for, at både kunder og kollegaer føler sig hjemme. Her kan du udvikle dig i et stærkt fællesskab, hvor du får faglig sparring med dygtige kollegaer, som har lige så høje standarder for løsninger som dig. Samarbejdet med vores kunder er kendetegnet ved gode og afslappede relationer med en åben dialog, hvor kundens team er trygge ved at fortælle dig om behov og udfordringer, fordi de ved, at du sætter en ære i at løse dem.




Nysgerrig?

Du må meget gerne booke et uforpligtende og uformelt kaffemøde med Julie Lindvald Thorsen her, hvis du vil høre mere eller har spørgsmål, inden du søger.

Send din ansøgning ved at klikke på ’Ansøg’ her på siden og følg anvisningerne. Vedhæft dit CV og relevante bilag. Tiltrædelse er snarest muligt, og ansøgninger behandles løbende.

Show more
